5Z-3tcM07Pyc4mOF2Rjt6Q.review_text: Not necessarily the best spot for a warm day, but they have a solid happy hour and solid selection of beers.  I like the dark and cozy vibe, which would make a drink on a pre-global warming cold SF night just perfect.

20obRYPB25zQvpIwpERYXA.review_text: I sometimes stumble in here if I'm in the area. Thumbs up for their whiskey or bourbon specialty cocktails. It's not an easy spot to find as it is hidden in the shadows. Thanks for the obvious lion's face right in front! As I enter the premises I notice I have to squeeze my way through to get to the bar and wonder if I'll make it. Finally I manage to get the message across to the bartender, Sigh "someone"...someone spilled their drink on me. Whoops.  Although the set up is nice it's a bit too dim for my liking (hence lions den) probably because I actually want to see the facial expressions of the person who I'm talking to, drink away and problem solved! Nevertheless I'm forced to knock down 2 stars (insert sad face) due to this and the problematic seating I encountered every single time.   Note to self: don't come here after 8pm with a big group of alcoholics. Maybe it won't be a problem if they accidentally push someone over and pretend they weren't sitting there.  So if you like darker surroundings, crowds, cluttered seating, but great drinks then hit them up but don't say I didn't warn you...

xejgiQxrBooJVGF_V3ta0Q.review_text: I come here for one drink and one drink only - the greyhound.  Fresh squeezed grapefruit + vodka.  Fantastic.  The crowd here can sometimes venture into d-baggery "yea bro".  Sometimes it is really crowded on weekends.  Even then, it is not too difficult to grab a drink.  Few times I've been here, we get ourselves a table, chat it up, and drink our greyhounds.  Some might call this "pre-drinking".  For some strange reason, there is actually a platter of cheeses on the side that look like they've been sitting there all week.  I don't recommend trying anything from that platter.

Nfw6KZys6dVXnB5oiuZPdg.review_text: Just like most people, I like to call out the douchetasticness of most establishments, but, it's not really the businesses fault, unless the d-bags are opposite the counterside from yourself.    After reading some of the reviews, I can't help but defend the business - which I'm not affiliated with whatsoever, especially having been here only once, last night.  Let's judge the place for what it has control over:  1.) Drinks - great menu and love the fresh squeezed citrus and various herbs/veggies on hand. 2.) Price - it's San Francisco and it's Pacific Heights.  If you're looking for a place to get wasted and stretch your last $10, try the Hotel Utah Saloon off 4th in SoMa. 3.) Service - bartenders tend bar.  Ours made the drinks as ordered.  Not over the top personality and not a bump on a log.  Good for business. 4.) Ambience - loved the outside, loved the inside.  Nice unique atmosphere.  If I lived in this hood, I'd probably come here regularly.

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: The Lion Pub was pretty much your typical bar. The drinks were good and the service was surprisingly fast for how extremely crowded it was on a Saturday night.  I think the biggest improvement they need is making the girl's bathroom more than one toilet! Nothing worse than waiting ten minutes to go when you just downed tons of liquor.

0L6XAQ_wYgR2d4lfX43XTA.review_text: When I was 21 & had just moved to SF, my best friend lived next to Lion Pub. Every night (because we were 21 & went out every night), we'd go to Lion Pub & order a drink & then eat "dinner" at the cheese spread before hitting the town. Now I'm not sure if they still have that fantastic spread -- probably because 21 year old degenerates like myself would wolf down plate after plate over their gourmet cheeses & smoked salmon -- but man, the drinks here are to die for. Any drink that has fresh fruit, they squeeze it per order. The HH are strong & the Greyhounds are something else (though I'd pony up & get something other than the well vodka) -- though a note of warning: if it's a Friday or Saturday night, I'd stick to something that's easy to pour or pop because it can get very crowded & backed up. In fact, I wouldn't go if it was a Friday or Saturday night (remember, 21 degenerates like it here...)  But all said & done, while I'm very far from 21, Lion Pub remains one of my favorite places to pull up a stool, throw my arm around my honey, nurse a cocktail or nine & reminisce about all those wonderful memories -- at least those that I can remember ;)

Vcadamdv04NuyAiRIWSkOg.review_text: This is probably one of my new favorite bars in the city.  It looks deceiving from the outside, like its a house or some kind of lamp shop... but once you walk inside its pretty spacious with bar area and tables.  Plus there's a fireplace for those warm and cozy intimate moments if you like those.     The use fresh fruit in their drinks and the greyhound doesn't disappoint.  As an added bonus there is a cheese platter that is open for the public with cheese and crackers.  How can you go wrong.  The drinks are not overly pricey so that is never a bad thing.    The only think that i don't like is that this place can sometimes be filled up with douche bags,  but at least they don't have the same douche-baggedness as the marina crowd.  (usually)

IxQrE6BuM_QKnjSq6kVglg.review_text: The closest bar from my house and it has great drinks? Why am I still yelping in my living room? Wait, it's only 1pm...  Tip: do not sit at the table by the ATM machine (cash only), or you'll smell the bathrooms all night.

y_7-1MVW3y84dsjbrn5oVg.review_text: This place is definitely hard to spot. It's more of a locals bar, which I like. The cocktails are made with freshly squeezed fruit juice, which I like. Sometimes when I'm hungry, the bartenders give me fruits :) That's love.   The drinks are good, the ambiance is chill, and the crowd is diverse. What else can I say? I likey likey.

rZRCEAy-xv7TwDstUliTnA.review_text: Love this place for its fresh watermelon vodkas and greyhounds. Like it for its laid back vibe and cheese and cracker muniches. Love/hate it for the social scene - easy to meet cool people, but also easy to meet drunk annoying yuppy-wannabes. Always a great option on any night out.

1yWlHqIT52TuNSH7AjEa3g.review_text: Great cocktail bar.  Try the Greyhound - they fresh squeeze oranges.  Cash only!

VAxxDTYktnUFKDjEF5L2jA.review_text: Cool little funky place that makes kick ass drinks...........does get crowded.....but hey it's a bar!

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: omg, the drinks here are sooo good.  i had the strawberry/mango and cantalope/passion fruit mojitos here last night, and they were so delicious and refreshing.  my friend had the blueberry/pineapple mojito which was great as well.  i like this place, b/c it feels like you're sitting in your friend's living room, b/c it's so relaxing.  great music, too!

GpZpKakwykH-Gsw-1LpLHg.review_text: As much as I'd like to love this place (it's pretty close to where I live) I simply can't. The only time a person should come here is on a quiet weekday evening for a pint or a cocktail with friends. There is really no point in coming here on a Friday or Saturday evening, it'll be so packed that you'll barely be able to get a drink and the environment won't lend itself to chatting with friends or meeting new people.  My friend and I recently decided to give this place another shot and we both ended up saying "why do we come here? I've never had a good night here". This place definitely lost another star when they decided to start putting out some sort of buffet on Friday and Saturday evenings. It's simply gross to see people double dipping in a bar....  To be fair the mojitos are pretty good and they do use fresh fruit in their cocktails but alas this is only worth two stars in my opinion.

O8UYGyFMXxq58htx4lqYzg.review_text: Came here with my coworkers last night after working a big wig event ..... Kinda bummed out that they ran out of hefeweizen but I ended getting a shocktop and I think a fat tire amber ale . The only reason why I took one star off cuz the bar smelled like nasty wet bar towel. I don't know if it's because they were closing or they just reused the same towel but it was pretty stanky danky lol

gbWd0Syc5_oZt6I_7GSXLw.review_text: This is kinda my corner bar and I've always had positive experiences.  I came here on my birthday after the group got a little too loud pre-partying in my apt and the neighbors started to complain.  We staked out a corner and went crazy with the silly pictures, belly laughs, and general good times.   It was the perfect spot to continue with the shots, or wine, or mojitos, or whatever else people were interested in drinking.  They also have different kinds of fresh squeezed juices behind the bar so I'm guessing a cocktail that includes one of those is one to try .. but I have to admit I've stuck to my mandarin-tonics so far.  It haven't really seen it too crowded or stuffy, and the drinks are decent.  Lion Pub - I'm a fan.

_Ck1o1L32_hEno63_h2IKg.review_text: Love the laid back super cool bartenders.  I have brought a number of "drink dates" here and it has always worked for me.  My all time favorite neighborhood bar.  I cannot resist the greyhound with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice.  Minus one star for cash only.  I hate that.

DAikVU-yTq7nIRZmeR7gwQ.review_text: Fun decor and if you're a fan of grapefruit they make drinks with fresh grapefruit juice. Gets pretty toasty inside when it's packed.

eMnnPJ5lj8W0Nk1fj7bcjw.review_text: DOUCHE BAG CENTRAL! This place is way too small for the amout of tables and chairs they try to fit into the place, the bar is often too crowded, and it seems as though you have to pop your collar to get in.  Kids think they own the place and try to throw down, but when we went outside, they fled.  Management seems to consist of highschool drop-outs and meth-heads.    One guy who worked there called my black friend a N****r. BOYCOTT THIS PLACE IF YOU RESPECT CIVIL RIGHTS!!!

nbOYS_LPTy_d1UtC_B9fAw.review_text: Was at the Lion Pub mid pm. They had some snacks with cheese which I thought was cool. Not many people in there. Had some gin & tonics. Hangin' by the fireplace.  Everything was chill.  Then, a trickle, followed by a flood of people poured in. The music got louder and I couldn't hear myself talk anymore. I looked around the place and realized the pub had been completely overrun by preppie-poser automatons.  So is this where they congregate to recharge?   The whole scene reminded me of an old movie where mannequins come to life. Spooky, man.

8VmxAELPm0CKpKrZnS6NKg.review_text: I'm perfectly fine at Lion Pub. Until approximately 9:30, which is when the assholes show up. They must have some drink special for douchbags starting at 10pm or something because all of a sudden, the place gets packed and I'll spot the dreadful wench who openly mocked me in high school, no doubt sporting pointy-toed heels and one of those stupid ironic t-shirts, in an attempt to look gorgeously low-maintenance. So after several perfectly lovely evenings that crashed and burned by 10pm, I avoid the Lion Pub like the plague. It's not the place. It's the people...

5Udcogf30sGuQPwW7wnsFQ.review_text: Here's the thing - I want to like this place, really, I do. I go all the time, and I keep hoping that those tables in front if the fireplace will be rearranged in a way that doesn't make me feel like I'm playing Tetris. And last time, I sat at one of the benches by the window, but they're shaped so awkwardly that I couldn't focus on anything other than shifting around.  Ugh. Please, Lion bar, take out 3-4 tables from the main room.

BPocdupppjxeGFLml0VgLA.review_text: Great fruity drinks... and who could complain about the large quantity of cheese and crackers out to be snacked on all night!

pzIrjqIExp50TVhodothaQ.review_text: I was visiting a few friends in SF and we decided to go out for some drinks. We yelped and Lion's kept coming up so we gave it a go.  We came in Saturday night around 10:30 and it had a medium sized crowd going. I ordered up the well recommended Strawberry-Mango Mojito and it was pretty good I'd have to say. I think fresh-squeezed juices in cocktails might become a thing if it catches on. In about the next 30 minutes, people just started flowing in and the place got packed by 11pm. Half the place had tables and chairs for groups of people, with a nice fireplace there, and the other half was mostly the bar area where people do the whole stand and look cool thing. The tables were taken by 10:30pm and so we were stuck standing in no-man's land by the corner of the bar. If you want a table you should go early. Overall, it was a decent vibe. It was pretty mellow with a zest of maturity tossed in too. I'm 23, so the crowd felt a little bit older to me. I'd say late 20's to early 30's, single professional types. Not totally my scene, but, it was a great place to hang out. Definately a fan.  One thing though, they are CASH ONLY.

sMfAazU842DN6NNTC7PUuQ.review_text: Crowded but chill environment. Great place to grab drinks, sit around in a cozy space & catch up with friends.   Easy to find seating and tables.

GThFy9UPlYYa0NeqtFfo0Q.review_text: When I moved down the street, I thought it was a mini Winchester Mystery House! It's unmarked and so unassuming! After a visit or two (or 20), I'm hooked!   Lions always has the best crowd, (usually professional, yet fun, 20/30-somethings from the neighborhood), awesome staff and quite tasty beverages! Whether you're looking for a casual spot to catch up with friends and relax by their sweet fireplace, a quick stop after work to unwind, or a big night out, the ambiance is perfect across the board.   The only negative I have to report thus far is the women's restroom. It's a little gas-station-esque, but, whatever, it's a bar. Also, it's cash only, but obviously there's an ATM within!   Also, I must give a big thank you to the bartender (David?? I think) that helped ease the pain of an agonizingly boring date a few months ago. That extra special greyhound you made me was just the ticket! Thank you, thank you, thank you!  Cheers!

joVz-2pYmYP0ohO06rhMbw.review_text: I loved this bar.  We went on a Tuesday night and had the place mostly to ourselves.  Yes, the coolest thing about the bar is that they make the drinks with fresh squeezed juice, and YES they are amazingly good.  The bartender was cool and seemed to be having a good time with us.  I recommend this bar to everyone I know.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Stong drinks and a nice atmosphere. Gets a little crowded but doesn't feel like your typical bar in the city. If you are in Pacific Heights and need a place to get a drink, this is the spot...

uBGBtkZAerC-VcURTXmVWQ.review_text: 1- Fresh Squeezed drinks -I love the greyhound, where in the world can you get a screwhound so delicious??  2-Awesome cute bartenders 3-free cheese/crackers. This place is awesome!!!

3rWdCM2_AK7GWQlwzRO99Q.review_text: This pub is great.  They make one of the best fresh squeezed fruit cocktails in SF and the ambience of this place is so cozy and warm.  I love the fact that there is a fireplace in the lounge area.  Moreover, at night the bar serves free munchies for customers, and it is not cheap food.  Usually they serve some vegetables, cheese and crackers and fruits.

yyDL7wo9voRvKm9ldh9V-Q.review_text: Yes please to greyhounds. Yes please to fireplace and comfy chairs.  Shame on you for convincing me to stay till close on a school night.

pZZw7NqDFUxIg0YT0vls8g.review_text: Lion Pub has quickly become one of my favorite places for multiple reasons:  -Fresh fruit mojitos  -Other delicious drinks  -Really attractive bartenders  -There's a fire place

Y6s2HEIcQUcBAMWdDnQ8OA.review_text: I still absolutely love this place.  Every time I come here I have a great time.  The staff is really attentive and you can get drinks fairly quickly, even on a crowded night.  They always spin great jams, and even though the place can get a little jam-packed on the weekends, it's still awesome.  Have you ever actually looked around Lions?  It's like some weird trippy jungle.  I dig it.  Freshly squeezed mojitos and greyhounds.  Thank you, thank you, thank you Jared and co, I heart you guys and your mad bar skills.

CsOAZNAD-jMG3P0TpSEepw.review_text: This is a fantastic neighborhood bar.  I don't usually like mixed drinks.  But, the fresh squeezed juice makes 'em seem almost healthy!  Great vibe.  Eclectic tunes and the perfect amount of low light.  It's a go to spot for me.  People who give this 2 stars or less should have to shampoo my crotch.

-703WcbbBaXpT1JrtZ3SmA.review_text: Lion's den - as I like to call it - has a lot of haters, but it is near and dear to my heart (and my house). There are some days when I've just got to have the greyhound with ruby red sky vodka. I don't care that it supposedly attracts a douchey crowd, that the drinks aren't that cheap, yada yada. I will continue to claim that this is one of the best bars in the city, for drink, free food (which I'd advise coming early to eat and avoiding as the night progresses), and for the ambiance. I want a greyhound right now!

aOxFSXUEvy1cuSw7wfiJwA.review_text: I have lived a block and a half away for a long time and I've come to realize that I have neglected you, Lion Pub.  Turns out they have great drinks (a bit pricy but you get what you pay for).  I hear the mojitos are awesome, though I really enjoyed my Screwhound (vodka with fresh pressed orange and grapefruit juices).  My date had a chocolate raspberry martini which she loved, and a blackberry lemon drop which, while tasty, left her wishing she had repeated her first order.  The free cheese and crackers are perfect for taking the edge off, and the dark, fireplace lounge make the place extra inviting.  Was there on a Thursday night and enjoyed the crowd until 11, when it became a tad douche-y; that was our cue to leave.  Minus a star for being cash only.  I will be back before 7pm to check out the happy hour.

PLXuHH8owd8jMGhB4uqjcA.review_text: Go here!  This place has the most delicious drinks, so delicious that even my friends who don't drink are begging to come here again.    The best part about the Lions Pub is that they use fresh fruit in all the drinks.  So if you order a Strawberry Mango Mojito  you'll be sure to get fresh fruit juice, delicious chunks of strawberries and mangos, and if you're lucky, a fresh strawberry on the rim.    The drinks are kinda expensive, 8-9 dollars for the fruity mojitos and stuff, but for the more frugal drinker they also have Greyhounds (vodka + grapefruit juice=YUM) for a measly 5 bucks.    I recommend getting a really fruity drink (i.e. Strawberry Mango Mojito, Blueberry Pineapple Mojito, or  Strawberry Lemon Drop) and then switching it up to greyhounds the rest of the night, saves some money and gets you more alcohol.  They also have food here, and not your typical bar food, but damn good food...Cheeses, crackers, smoked salmon, guacamole, chips, etc...   Don't forget your cash though, credit cards are not accepted.

eTZhMslm9hfeXS-Rq8uGiA.review_text: Any bar that fresh squeezes their juices earns an extra star in my book.  While it was pretty dead on a Sunday night, the screwdriver with fresh oj was the best I've ever had.  And with the free cheese plate they have out, it's not a bad place to grab a drink or two.

YC4xH6hxgAQks-ngsr_Whg.review_text: What happened Lion?  I used to love you, your fresh fruit drinks, your fireplace and your free happy hour cheese.  All of that is still there, but now you're empty, your drinks are expensive and bland and your staff has turned up the radio in what appears to be an apparently belief that if it's noisy enough no one will notice it's empty.

vPPcQemnPEOE0CK8nCqvMQ.review_text: It's really more like, 3.5 stars, but thats not an option!  four stars for the fresh squeezed juice mojitos and free snacks! three stars for the slightly slow service. the decor is part relaxing vacation, part safari adventure-ish.. ehh not really my thing.  I recommend the yummy strawberry mango mijotos, but the cantaloupe passion fruit mojito is pretty interesting too!   I still can't get over the fresh squeezed everything! yum! hurrah mojitos!

3ebQ_H8URQcynuhcePhc-w.review_text: So. Here it is. Don't come here unless you want to pay $4.50 for a budweiser. When said Budweiser arrives it will be a  Bud-Light. And when the poorly goateed blond bartender dude puts a buck fifty in his tip jar and three bucks in the drawer, you will know this place is truly doomed. The two stars were for the cheese offered in the back.  Oh. P.S.  I am not a chronic yelp reviewer. I am a bartender who didn't appreciate getting ripped off.

JO9CPEwBjV3UJuIOgs8Zzw.review_text: The FRESHEST alcoholic drinks that you'll find are located right here at Lion Pub. There are only 3-4 bartenders at one time and considering how crowded this pub can get, they do a fantastic job at getting drinks for everyone in a timely manner. This place is definitely a unique find because they have these old school iron casted juicers that they use to squeeze fresh lime/orange/grapefruit/lemon into your drink which makes everything taste exponentially better.  My favorite drink of the night was a strawberry mojito - probably the best mojito I've ever had solely because the strawberries and lime were super fresh - definitely hides how strong the drink actually is. I loved it when I found strawberry chunks at the bottom of the glass - a little bite of fruit is always a good thing.  Another great drink was the watermelon vodka. In each drink is a handful of fresh watermelon crushed into the glass and topped off with a probably not so healthy helping of vodka. Can't say that I liked the grapefruit vodka only because I don't like grapefruit - it's too sour.  Anyway, LOVE the old school juicers, love the environment and I LOVE the fact that I'll definitely be back!

2ZCASyHp7_Y85DMb2-5ExA.review_text: One of my best friends' friends (someone I had never met before) was visiting SF for the first time and I was asked to take him out.  He was only going to be in the city for a couple of nights, since he was here for a conference, and I took him out along with some of my friends on a Wednesday.  I had no clue where to take him since I rarely go out during the weekdays now because I work early.  Now, I have been to Lion Pub a few times, but this was my first Wednesday night.  I was extremely impressed with the crowd.  I thought it was the perfect place to go during the week.  There were plenty of people (to watch and eye candy for my out of town new friend), but not to the point where it was packed and uncomfortable.  The bartenders have always been pretty friendly and served us immediately.  As mentioned in other reviews there was a spread with cheese and crackers out, which was nice, but I didn't partake in the snacking.  My visitor was impressed and we had a great time on a Wednesday.  The only thing that I found rather odd was the dog roaming around the bar.  Everyone seemed to be okay with it, but it definitely took a star away from my overall experience.  Next time I go out on a weekday you can probably find me at Lion Pub.

10IUU20u96o-EIG-g7cRZw.review_text: I like how this place uses fresh fruit and has an extensive list specialty drinks. I ordered the strawberry and mango mojito with actual pieces of the fruit. It was good, but really strong..can't really complain about too much alcohol though. Drinks here are pretty good, like the fresh squeezed grapefruit vodka,  but everything else...not so much.  The not so good part includes having no food on the menu, the bitchy bartender, and being way too dark inside.  I came around dinner time hoping for food to munch on only to find out they don't serve any and they don't do "free cheese and crackers" anymore. Next, the bartender accidentally sprayed water in my face and didn't have the decency to say anything. He looked pretty angry all night too. Lastly, I really don't like how dark it is in there. It makes me uncomfortable to be unable to see where I'm going or who I'm talking to.   I'll come back, but only because they use real fruits in their drinks and the place is close to work. Aside from that, I hope there's a new bartender next time

pZAktka6VfcXmUf4lWlBJQ.review_text: Great place for a fantastic drink. Its a little pricier, but totally worth the fresh fruit that is mixed in. My personal favorite is the strawberry mango mojito, but the cantelope margarita was pretty tasty as well. There is also a free cheese bar with a wide assortment of cheese and crackers to much on.   A good place to sit and sip and enjoy the evening.

rshFnj9YqfmO5Yp2jsPjrA.review_text: I now know how it feels...   There are many, many people on Yelp who have discounted some of my favorite bars based on the low comfort level they've felt being surrounded by hipsters and indie rockers with tight t-shirts and peacock hairdos.  I've always thought that this was a bit of a cop-out. Why can't you just be comfortable wherever you go? Why alienate yourself based on these superficial ingroup classifications?  I now understand. While I neither look like an extra from a Cure video or a roadie for Creedance Clearwater Revival circa 1968 (these being the two main motifs for hipster/indie fashion), I CERTAINLY feel like less of an ass in that crowd than I do in the J. Crewed, manicured world of the Lion's Den.   While I was by no means paralyzed by this social atmosphere, I certainly wasn't going to embark on a mission to make new friends or find a nice girl. My friends and I stuck to our table.  So why did we stick around? The drinks, of course. Any bar equipped with three grapefruit presses to make fresh greyhounds is okay in my book- and if that place has a spread of free food for you to nibble on, even better. The tabouleh was pretty darn good, I must say. There's also a watermelon/vodka cocktail that is fantastic- much more appropriate for a hot and humid summer day back east than the cool breeze and fog found in San Francisco in August.  Three stars for now. I'll give it another shot. Maybe a weekday Happy Hour or something.

Z7wYV7NVNAH_B0eE35d2wg.review_text: YUPPIES IN DENIAL!!!  Maybe I should hit this place on a week nite, but everytime I'm here...I leave with my clothes drowning in alcohol (not so hot!!)  Decor here is cool with golden lion statues everywhere (very hot!!)  But it gets so crowded that I'm literally breathing down someone else's neck (not so hot!!)  Peeps here are dressed to the nine (very hot!!) but the 'tudes reek of "i'm not yuppie like those who hang out on fillmore, so i'm gonna hang out on Divis but still act like a yuppie"  (not so hot!!!)  The drinks came WAY fast (very hot!!) but this is an ultimate death trap for claustrophics (not so hot!!)

_5uZ9Ur33MnFvpjeryyKMQ.review_text: Lion Pub is a nice spot to wrap up those nights when you're having fun but not out to rage.    You'll typically get a few dancey songs thrown in the mix and the beer and drink selection is decent.  The fact that the bar is cash only kills the buzz a little bit, as does the fact that you have to shell out like $10 for a mojito, but the mojitos are made with love and tons of fresh fruit, so sip those cares away, have a bite of free cheese, and start dancing around to the Journey song that just started playing.  Unless, of course, it's before 1am.  Then you should just stare down the fool who decided to play Journey at such an unacceptable hour.

hQGDGOWk26jjIeQ-mAD7Xw.review_text: Love this bar!  Delicious cocktails with fresh squeezed citrus juice and an amazing twist on a Black Russian that includes crushed fresh cherries.  Prices are actually quite decent for the area and the bartenders are helpful and attentive.  The crowd can be a little douchey, but there is definitely a lot of eye candy if you're into that.  Approve!

bk3LC4qjyk3VEVtpP4P68w.review_text: so this place was number 4 on the spontaneous and apparent lets get as drunk as we can evening i had recently with a friend...it wasn't on my suggestion but turned out to be a pretty cool place.  i love the decor, all red and sexy.  there was a fire pit, but we stood near the door because at ten pm on a saturday night that place was packed! who knew that this was the go to place in lower pac heights?  i think the drinks were good, I just remember them being strong...but my opinion really shouldn't mean a whole lot...as i woke up this morning and remembered leaning against a horse statue thing all night...and said friend corrected me that the horse was indeed a lion.  yeah that would make sense.

lThzub113E9iCw_0XncXzA.review_text: Be sure to come on a weeknight, no marina influx. Be a man an step up to the bar for great girly drinks like a strawberry mango mojito with freshly muddled strawberries. I'm not sure where the mango came from.

-VMmi-tMcMO7bR90aCg_iA.review_text: First time here tonight, fun times.   Cool bar, mellow decor, unpretentious and easy going barkeepers.  Sat at said bar, right next to - actually left of - the fruit press. Still smelling like grapefruit, basil and mint. Smelled definitely worse after bar nights.  A mighty speaker behind us made me feel as if I was sitting in the American Idol studio, on the "Club Evergreens" theme night.  Learnt how to shout into someone's ear without hurting said ear.  Did I mention the fun times?  I'll be back.

5DLd32wA2AquFh1aFNOlWw.review_text: Really fun place to go an chat with your friends....nice that it's off the beaten path as well.  Although I am a wine/beer drinker (wine's not so great, and served in tiny glasses)-the mixed drinks are made with fresh squeezed fruits.....greyhound is delicious......and I think they are only 5 bucks!  Added bonus, they have a really cute fireplace! Then my friend keeps telling me that they have an incrediable free spread of food later in the night (I have been on a Friday and Satuday-and have yet to see it) maybe on week nights?-But she swears it's amazing.

U_0XP7wiSomrU-df6NHJYA.review_text: The drinks are poured to perfection and you have to try the Greyhound shot. So delicious! The bartender was attentive and good at his job. I had a mojito with strawberry and mango they have a fresh fruit for you to see they make the drinks and slice up the fruit right in front of you. They also press the juice fresh it's so delicious.  The menu is very interesting.  I will be back!

fE65QsHN6FdkzJ15AU3iOQ.review_text: I frequented this place when my friend was bartending here.  I mean, how can you say no to a pretty boy and a cheap glass of bourbon?  Anyhow, now that he's gone I don't have to pretend to like it here anymore.  This place blows. Sorry, but it my opinion.  The music is almost always terrible, the vibe is douchey, and it seems like the owner/manager is going for that pretentious "mixologist" kinda thing which is SO eye-roll inducing.  The drink special shots were named "Chuck Norris" and other shit, which just feels WAAAAY behind the ball. Sorry kids, the Chuck Norris tipping point was reached a few years ago. Sure, we'll still chuckle every now and then, but the fad is over. It just felt a little tired and like it was trying too hard.  My life won't suffer if I never come here again. Plus... its waaaay the hell outta the way for me, so no worries... I won't.

y34uvpsfOf3D_O4CtBm6vg.review_text: If a girl walks into a bar at 12:30am on a Friday night, and she's standing at the door looking around, chances are she is not looking for you. She's looking for her friends, who called twenty times and finally convinced her to brave the cold and walk on over there. If you've got half a brain, you already know this, so you're walking over and grabbing her by the arm with a nasty grin and saing "Hey, I'm right here!" just to be annoying. Shame on you. You've just brough your kind down by 20 points and nullified the chances of any other guy in the joint.   But this place gets an extra star for the cheese and veggie table, since I always get the munchies after my third drink.

tuyHbiK0_3Cba2pZhVxLrA.review_text: I love cocktails. I love fresh fruit. I love Lion Pub because they combine both. Always had a good time here, except for one time when our intern threw up all over the back door and we had to split...and quickly. It gets super hot in there, and there's this little annoying beeping sound that reminds me of my alarm clock that goes off everytime you open the door. Other than that I LIKE IT.

faQWVwFSXt2Abn4xpgW1zQ.review_text: Any bar that uses fresh squeezed juice and i'm hooked. I've only been at kinda of off times so I'm not sure how they handle dealing with the weekend crowd that all wants fresh squeezed juice in their cocktails. I recommend having them make a shot with fresh raspberry juice and vodka.. so yummy. Everything I have had here has been great and the bar tenders generally nice. Also, the atmosphere is fun. A definite must go to in my opinion.

ddNrziPGmcmmW_J8c0rKQQ.review_text: it's 6:30pm.  wondering what to get, the bartender tells me they're outta mint.   didn't you just open?  looked at the specials, they're all mojitos. guess I'll get the greyhound( fresh grapefruit juice and vodka). my girlfriends came in a bit later and I they bargained for topshelf vodka. nice.  they've got a cool fireplace if you actually get to sit by it.  we did, place was pretty empty.  conclusion: if you're drunk enough, you'll think you're in a tropical paradise. there's no more food at happy hour. that sucks.

xtZMctl7AQNspIL_SF3guA.review_text: One word --- greyhound. If there's one drink to order at Lion Pub, it's their signature greyhound with fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice. Beyond that, the cheese & appetizer platter is always great, especially at 1am when you don't feel like waiting in line for a stale piece of pizza or gut-bomb Mission burrito.  The crowd is beautiful, the drinks are delicious, the decor is classic 70s fern bar... what's not to like!

7TkRpN-z5MrxHTlUHsTxww.review_text: Believe it or not I remember nothing about this place. But my Yelp app does :) I guess I was at least drunk ad didn't get into fight.

mwJEd2Pp9bFfNGo1rZ9NvA.review_text: Man, the drinks are expensive, but they sure are good! The Lion Pub makes the best strawberry mojito I have ever tasted in my life! This place is crowded, but the people sure are good looking. It's in the middle of nowhere, but it's definitely a place you can spend the whole night in. Come early and stay late.

-u09K95xauSZe2fNY_oaMA.review_text: This place has become one of my favorites. The crowd is mixed and entertaining, the bartenders are generally friendly, and the drinks are filled with fresh-squeezed fruit, so it's super healthy. If you can, grab a spot near the cozy but unobtrusive fireplace for good conversation and a full view of the premises for great people-watching. Drinks on the menu range from standard to unique and the juice makes all the difference.  The vibe here is decidedly low-key, though the energy (e.g. crowd) level varies on the night. All are welcome (young/old,straight/gay, rich/working-class) but make sure to bring cash unless you like shucking out hefty ATM fees near the bathroom. Oh, and an appreciation of good 90s hip-hop is a must here.

-DFCC64NXgqrxlO8aLU5rg.review_text: Man, I don't know if I've been to a bar that's nicer than this one in San Francisco. Outside, large planters line the wall, inside a fireplace welcomes you to an almost European interior with an outdoors at night feel to it that helps you forget that your holding a 14 dollar drink.  By the window, an old fountain-? converted to a standing bar. The bar itself is long and beautiful. The bartender.... also beautiful. "another round anyone?"

f0poMZKHuabERnFBoGlaIQ.review_text: Attitude from bartenders, weak drinks, dirty everything and bad music makes this place perfect for knuckle heads. I think Pacific Heights deserves a little better.

VK-ds3dGSSBoavkFde3e2Q.review_text: I really really really liked this place.  CUTE decor, pub style but with cute plants, and a warm vibe.  I thought it was sorta tropical feeling but the BF said it was like an Asian pub with all the lion statues and the what not.  Tons of cute tables and areas to lay out food if you want to section off an area for a birthday party which is why we were there.  They also provide free food to nosh on which I think is really nice of them.  By the time of the evening when we got to the free food table, it was mostly gone, but lots of cheese and bread and crackers, fruits, and chips and dips.  Not bad.    So it was pretty packed, but it wasn't obscene.  I could still move around and not spill anyone's drink.  They apparently are known for their super sweet yummy drinks which I didn't get to try, but I will do next time.  Service was slow but that is to be expected with the huge crowd here.    The crowd in here was good looking, nice and fun.  It kinda reminded me of SoCal but without the fakeness.    If I lived nearby I could see myself coming here all the time.  But since I don't I may not be back soon, but if I do come back I can almost guarantee myself a fun time here.

wi9SvS7xCmKMyElJVlwJdg.review_text:
(Pinching my nose)
 Uhb.  I'b dot the first to say that I love your free hors d'oeuvres and bojito congoctions which bake be feel so it's-the-circle-of-life Hakuda MBatata, but bhaybe you should cut back ond the cheese subbly because sobbody dext door keeps passing gas. (Ew)

xGysD5oa9bJ5y1ZOYk1qjA.review_text: This is a great neighborhood bar to check out on cold foggy evening.  Get there early before the place fills up and sit by the fireplace.  They bring out the snack food sometime between 9 and 10 which can be very tasty.

220NBEU9WyTrI077MPPlJg.review_text: Two words: Watermelon Vodka.  They shove huge slices of watermelon into a glass, mash the shit out of it with a big stick, then pour a copious (sh*t load) amount of vodka to top it off.   It tastes like the sweetest, most delectable watermelon juice you've ever had in your life. Plus, you get bonus watermelon pulp goodies in your mouth too!  Lion Pub has giant lion and tiger statues sprinkled around its cozy establishment. Cocktails are made from freshly squeezed juices and range from $6-$10, for those of you who are concerned about your wallets. Shots are also available (Chocolate Cake!!), as well as some creatively named drinks (which I can't remember right now, due to drunkeness).  Also try: Greyhound (Grapefruit + Vodka) and Mojitos  Note: Cash Only  Must come back soon to try everything else!

3ZrjvKpBvez2uHzvDNxa_g.review_text: Came here to meet some friends on a rainy Sunday afternoon, and sat drinking greyhounds for damn near 3 hours.  The drinks were actually quite delicious, although they can't have been that strong since I somehow had five or six of them, which under normal circumstances would see me cornering a stranger and explaining to them in excruciating detail the intricacies of cross-site request forgery attacks or some such technobabble.  They've got tons of seating, a big spread of cheese and crackers for general enjoyment, and after some initial stumbling, our relationship with the bartender blossomed into something beautiful.  Nice spot.

_E3yaczgef7enusOIf7Jug.review_text: Great happy hour. Drink had smooth vodka and fruit... Watermelon chunks

SXEaqdvMiYs2LNxeIbM51w.review_text: Fresh fruit cocktails, friendly atmosphere and plenty o' cheese to be shared by all!

CU6B8xPsxveZueDewBECXg.review_text: I LOVE this bar.  I love that is has like 6 names (Lion Bar, Lion Pub, Red Lion, etc), and I love that is close to home.  I have never left this place sober.    You should know that they fresh squeeze juice at the bar, and it makes the mixed drinks SO good.  The greyhounds are great.  The Screwdrivers are better.  The SCREWHOUNDS are amazing.  Screwhound with basil?  Holy Sh!t.  It will change your life.  (In a good way).  Oh, and two bits of advice:    1) When the bartender offers you a pomegranate greygoose shot?  Say yes.  it is two parts awesomeness and one part blackout.    2) Do not, under any circumstance, go fat pig on the mountain of cheese by the bar.  Just because it is there does not mean you need 3 fists full on your way to the cab at 2am.  It has been sitting under warm lights since 5:30.  You WILL pay dearly tomorrow.

V8LAqUPrT4KOalrs0Df5rw.review_text: This is a great club. However, It's more a neighborhood joint, and sometimes i feel like it's kind of clicky, because lots of people seem to hang out in groups, talking to each other. So, it's probably a good place to meet a group of friends, but if you're single and mingling, this may not be the spot for you.  It's cool because it's out of the way, not where you might expect. This is very charming until it's 2AM and time to leave, and you have to really be pushy to compete for the few taxis out that way (Uber is good in this situation). Also, bartenders are extremely good at making drinks, and they are super friendly in a very loud and crowded joint.  Mixed fancy drinks are expensive, but they are delicious! Try their mojitos, they are amazing and will get you drunk quick. They do not take credit cards, so make sure to stop at the ATM and pull out a fair amount of cash, as it will disappear quickly.  Show up here late and a little wasted, and you will have better luck meeting people, or, kick off the night here with a LARGE group of friends. You won't be disappointed.

XPOx-mCubVGQ1rRknztFtw.review_text:
I don't even know why I am bothering to write this review now that I have seen the extra super great review of the Lion Pub that Megan W wrote today.....
  Nice room, love fresh juice thing  - but I just can't give it 5 stars because of the surprising odor of dive to the place.  
 It doesn't look like a dive.  It doesn't feel like a dive.  But it definitely smells like a dive.  
 Sure, you prolly won't notice after your second drink but still.

MjCIBCRp7p4B_ITMWDpKzQ.review_text: I can't believe I haven't heard of this place before. This is my new favorite spot in the city, hands down. I went on a Tuesday night, so it was not packed, which was nice as I was with some of my lady friends, and we just wanted to catch up over drinks. I loved the dim atmosphere, and all the lion decorations everywhere. It wasn't like anywhere I had ever been, and I like that about this place.  They played awesome music (a little loud at times which didn't bother me so much), and plenty of seating that night. I ordered a greyhound for myself, and a mojito for my friend. Every cocktail is fresh squeezed right in front of you. This makes a HUGE difference in the taste of the drink. I can confidently say this was the BEST cocktail I've had in my life.  There's really absolutely nothing I can complain about this place. I will have to go back on a busy day to see how that is. I'd like to go back to see the place packed on a weekend , as I'm sure the vibe is a little different then. I'm looking forward to more amazing cocktails and memories at Lion Pub.

vSSb13hg8tif-XVFhGrO1Q.review_text: I've only been here twice...But will definitely be coming here more often...Love the fact that they use fresh fruit juices to make their drinks!!! The Mojitos r great but LOOOVE the screw-hound! Its vodka with fresh oj and grapefruit juice...I guess u can either call it a screwdriver with grapefruit juice or a greyhound with oj...lol....

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: one word: fireplace that's what I was looking for, on a cold foggy night in San Francisco. Pull out my handy-dandy yelp app and find a place with a fireplace to keep me warm.  No flashy signs on the outside- I must have driven by the place several times, not knowing.  Dark mystic interior, warm gas lit fireplace, spacious seating, mix of old and new, kitschy and trendy, white lion marble statues and buddah in the corner (?), neon lights and ethnic printed hides hanging on the walls, bathroom with a separate toilet and an open sink.  Bar tender was friendly, mixed up some fresh fruit drinks- bloodhound (twist on my fav greyhounds with blood orange instead of grapefruit; still tangy but I'd recommend an upgrade from the well vodka).  Place gave a cool, laid-back vibe, but it was blasting party music a little too loud for the early evening crowd. I could imagine it gets pretty wild later in the night. I saver the earlier scene, and could do without the music. Can't say much for the demographics- looks like it might drawn in some of the Marina crowd.

8wHKhb9wqIHca43Xr1xJZQ.review_text: One star for the fireplace and one star for being library-esque, which I like.  I've never been on a weekend night when it has been as crowded as people here have discussed.  Every time I've been here it has been scarce.  Maybe one or two people in the joint.  All in all, I like empty and quiet bars, but only when the bartenders are nice.  I can get fresh squeezed grapefruit juice at Deluxe and its closer to my house.

cj7jJnSOPaeZIJo9jJYsqg.review_text: I looooove this bar!  I come here all the time.  They're freshly squeezed drinks are to die for!  Not to mention, this is the ONLY bar in the city that serves complimentary cheese/crackers and their BOMB spinach dip.  The staff is super nice.  The only dowside is that they are cash only but it's totally worth it!  Yum!

gIV-ODmuHlJZ_oLprZWBnQ.review_text: Keep the cheese away! I like strolling here from my home when I do not want to go far. It is really hot during the winter so make sure to not have a flannel on. I like to drink sodas here.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: There are three distinct types of reviews that I see for this place. The first is the 5 star, written by the yelper I have never seen in my life or, if I have, clearly did not connect with in any way, shape or form. Then there is the 1 star review that uses the words "douchebag" and "striped shirt" at least a half a dozen times. The rest are reviews that teeter on the edge of using these words but instead the words "free snack food" creep in, thus raising the rating.   Lets think for a minute about the friends we have. We all probably have at least one of the following; The friend that is super cool until they drink too much (you know who you are). The friend who would live and die for you but has a high level of drama, which you have to comfort them through in exchange for said loyalty. How about the friend who you met when they were on a healthy, healing dose of meds but has since switched brands making them bat shit crazy, but still remain your friend because they are a good person and you are convinced they will switch back to brand A even if it does make hair grow in strange places on their body.  This bar is just like one of those "friends" and on the weekends it is in a cycle that makes you want a little, no, a LOT of distance. Come the early part of the week it is having an upswing and is not just tolerable but a damn joy to be around.   After all, this bar has good drinks with fresh fruit, good music, a super cool relaxing interior with plants, a fireplace, plenty of seating, and they have funny animal statues which are just plain cool in a tacky way. Oh and lets not forget that free food mentioned prior which, unlike the "douchebag" clientele, who apparently do not eat, I am not too proud to dig into.   So, 5 stars on a quiet night, and 1 star on a weekend. But, really, didn't I just describe three quarters of the bars in San Francisco?   So, to that effect, I give this bar 3 stars and a warning to stay away from it when it is drunk, stressed out or not on its meds ie. DO NOT COME HERE ON THE WEEKEND!!!

aEKUC4oQg2CokbwyW_CXSg.review_text: As long as it's not packed, this a great place to meet friends for a drink. Bart makes a mean strawberry kiwi mojito that is absolutely out of this world. They have fresh squeezed juices which make for a great drink - my favorite is vodka soda splash of grapefruit. Funky little SF spot.

4LBQJOg86EZAcoiYEjPL0w.review_text: It's really just OK. Known for their greyhounds and fresh squeezed fruit drinks. It gets really crowded at 9-9:30 on weekends. They have a fire place going and wall to wall people so it gets really hot. The music is to loud too talk but no dance floor to dance. We had an ok time. My guy friend liked talking to all of the 22 year olds. Really uncomfortable since the chairs are kind of big bamboo furniture and if you don't find a place to sit you have to stand and get pushed around. Annoying CASH ONLY.

3VGsxY6-3tjnul_bIFgjvA.review_text: this place is hit or miss but really depends more on the crowd than the bar itself.  don't forget to bring cash as they don't take credit cards and be a bit patient when it gets busy getting a drink can be a little slow.

FyrBt7vKNJcCliLBCF649g.review_text: Free. Food. People. Seriously. I mean, there isn't even anything else to say. Except that the drinks are also pretty good, and they'll crush fresh cantaloupe and pineapple into cocktails.

56vERWd2VPTfjytCQlSc6g.review_text: Fresh squeezed greyhounds and free cheese and smoked salmon?  Wowza.  The free appetizers will offset the really expensive drinks.  Comfy seating. Fun fun.  A great place to catch up with old buddies.  Bring massive amounts of cash and dont expect to be leaving with any of it.

N_7Oc3mNCRkrZUMNEcAElg.review_text: 3 stars for... Incredible mojitos! Nice warm fire. Free cheese.  no more stars for... Sucks on the weekend. PACKED full of trendy air heads chasing each-other.

Op1d1btEf1B8RokwZLBZvQ.review_text: Wonderful drinks (fresh squeezed!) and quaint atmosphere...it gets a little crazy on the weekends, but it's a great Wednesday/Thursday joint!  The cheese is free, but that doesn't mean it's bueno...perhaps have a few cocktails first.

VFxrLIlgApHIdOCrkAYIGA.review_text: To quote Theron L, this place is hella ghetto douchebag hell. That might be so but the cocktails are totally worth the bros and hair gel, just  don't get the French Kiss because I don't know what's in it but it was not pleasant.   They have fresh fruit and a fruit press and aren't afraid to use it even on crowded weekend nights. Thus resulting in a juicy fresh selection of cocktails. Heck, they even serve jello shots.

5rK8eYZHUvugbVoAjvUX0g.review_text: What is there not to love about lion pub???? Who can resist a freshly squeezed greyhound or my preference.. a screw hound. They have every type of seasonal fruit and can make any freshly squeezed fruit drink you want, they are always tasty and a lot of fun. The decor in here is awesome and sets up a great vibe... you feel like you are in a jungle. It does get packed and is 100% better when you have a table, I love coming here on week nights for this reason but its really fun to if you up for the packed weekend bar scene. The free cheese and crackers station is a plus to, even though I'm sceptical i find myself sneaking bites every time.

7vs_NdEgeZh8Lp5AR8z9fw.review_text: It's a cool place to hang out -- if you're a freakin' yuppie. Went there last night to get a drink or two.  But we kept it at only A drink.  Despite the pretty cool jungle -lion theme... i found the place sorta lame. The bartender, although very nice - was kinduv bland and lacked some personality.  Perhaps it was an off night.  But first impressions are important.  Not sure if I'll go again unless someone drags me there.

Cp4JiQA_eW0O-JctBljdPQ.review_text: The Lion Pub was one of the first bars I visited when I moved to SF five years ago.  Though totally off my beaten path (I lived in the Mission), the mysterious lush exterior and the not quite placeable interior theme of lion statues, stone fireplace, and cave-like dwelling sparked my intrigue back in the day.  And what solidified the love affair was the fresh-squeezed cocktails of all varieties and the generous spread of munchies  that came out between 8 & 10pm.  I swore that  I would infiltrate with my crew and make this my spot (I wasn't really feeling the crowd).  But things got busy and the Lion Pub was out of the way. It was hard to justify the multiple buses or late night cab.  And so five years past.  Now I live in Oakland and work in SF.  The alleged Lion Pub has graced many a conversation as that awesome bar with free snacks and the place where they pour vodka in a glass, place it under a juice press and squeeze half a grapefruit in it to make a greyhound.    I spoke so euphorically of the Lion Pub that folks began to doubt its existence.  Some started calling it my "Shangri-La" bar that only seemed that good cause it was a long time ago and I was probably way too wasted.  So naturally, a re-visit was in order.  I've been twice in the past month and it was totally like I remembered it; mysterious decor inside and out, fresh-pressed juice cocktails both tasty and fuerte, complimentary snacks of the highest caliber, and a crowd I wasn't totally feeling but was able to deal with after a drink.

IxKjgqLAG6teY_pqGnh9ZQ.review_text: 4-STARS for the best MOJITO I have ever tasted at a bar!  Fresh strawberries, not too sweet, and iced cold. If only the drinks ($9 each) were a bit cheaper, I would have had 5-7 mojitos... seriously :-)!  The fireplace is cozy and the mirrors all around makes the place seem bigger than it really is.   This bar is really really loud!  Right when you enter, you hear people trying to sing, chatting, yelling, laughing and the music blasting is definitely unnecessary.  It gets a bit crazy here so be prepared to wait a long time to get your drinks and expect to stand by the bar, unless you get lucky and score a table.  The crowd wasn't very diverse, lots of preppy/jock type guys wearing striped button down shirts -- some even so drunk that they were acting like an ass and embarrassed themselves by singing along with the music and dancing (or maybe they just wanted some attention).  It was not pleasant to watch a drunk 30-year old man trying to freak the air and dance -- I was really surprised that he did not do the moon walk.    I wish I could have spent more time here, but the singing and dancing got so irritating that my friends and I left after an hour or so.  Would be back here again for sure, maybe on weeknights when it's not very crowded and the obnoxious dancing/singing men are elsewhere.

ZZkqi-ulTw4kvSr2ywQ5mA.review_text: Yummy mojitos. Delicious mojitos. Fruity mojitos. The best mojitos. Fresh fruit crushed into each mojito. Had the strawberry mango mojito. Then the blueberry pineapple mojito. Wish they had the big boba tea straws so you could suck up the fruit instead of looking like an idiot digging them out with a straw. But as a lightweight, the jumbo straws might not be a good idea for me. I'd just suck down those mojitos that much faster.   Bartenders are nice considering they have to make one of the most labor intensive drinks over and over again. I took off a star b/c it's cash only and if you're going to be cash only, then don't charge 9 bucks a mojito. And also, it got really crowded so that got a bit annoying. Best to show up before 10pm if you're going on a weekend. We were lucky to get seats at the bar but then had to deal with annoying people pushing in between us to order drinks all night.

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: I went on  Friday evening.  Drinks were fruity, crowd was kind of weird.

MGb5TiKvR9QirMdj4_wgag.review_text: If Lion Pub wasn't within a few blocks of where I live, I probably wouldn't be going out of my way to visit the place. However I think that speaks more to the abundance of great neighborhood bars here in SF and not so much to the Lion Pub itself. It's perfectly acceptable, especially as a spot to grab a night cap on the way home... the drinks are decent, the crowds don't typically get too overwhelming, and they've often had out a table of snacks set up during the few times I've dropped in. Enjoyable cocktails + a place to sit + cheese platter = just fine by me.

bWxxfPP08zWJuM5wKG0LvQ.review_text: I totally thought this place was called Lion's Den. Oops. Anyway, this place isn't bad, a bit too crowded for my taste and the crowd is a tad Greek Life but the drinks are good, especially the ones with fruit in them. Also they have a nice spread of snacks for people.

OaJlwMnbJwHmMjlmgX6jmg.review_text: Don't try to go on a weekend night when it's packed like the 1BX after work, but it's the perfect place to go when you just want to sit and enjoy a cocktial or 2. The key word is enjoy because the drinks--made with fresh fruit--are delicious and refreshing. Plus I hear they have free cheese at night super late, which is awesome.

dAmglI3_6Z1MS3efeEM4SQ.review_text: GREAT decor and dark atmosphere with fireplace!  Super funny and cool bartender, Matt, I think. WISH they would take credit cards!!!

u6ms8jCUMd3qhlB6hufV-w.review_text: I always thought it was called Lion's Den, but whatever, we can call it Lion Pub.   They've got free snacks! And pretty good ones, even if they are a little stale by the time I get there. There's usually a cheese plate, sushi, a little bit of fruit, and usually some kind of bread and dip.   The mojitos are to die for with yummy fresh squeezed juice and menus that are consistently rotated with what's in season. Because they squeeze the juice when you order,  be prepared for a long wait to order your drink when it's crowded, but it's well worth it. Also bring plenty of cash, because the drinks are pricey and they don't take cards. You're more than welcome to use their ATM for a surcharge though.  Downside is that it can get very crowded. This might be changing, because l came by about a month ago, and had to wait outside in a line. I'd never had to do this before, so I thought that the bar was going to be worse than I'd ever seen it. Imagine my surprise when I got in to find about 1/2 the crowd I'm used to. I don't know if they got busted by the fire marshall or what, but I like it!  The decor is like a swanky jungle - but beware, as I've learned, sitting on the lion is frowned upon!

gDr7m_PavR0x8K4Vk-DRQA.review_text: This is one of those only-in-SF places. They actually have a stained glass window of a lion. The overall decor inside, including several big lions and a fireplace, is awesome. The crowd is somewhere between frat party and yuppietown but nowhere near as obnoxious as your average Marina bar.  On to the drinks - all those drinks made with fresh fruit are just amazing. The place is also quite reasonably priced overall.  And free cheese and crackers? That seals the deal.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: Great Place for cocktails. From experience, I'd recommend a Thursday night. Friday Saturdays get a little too crowded. Thursdays have the perfect amount of people, still booming yet enough space to sit at the bar or have standing room without being bumped into. The atmosphere is warm and relaxing. I haven't tried the food, but the cocktail selection is fun. I don't know how much they cost, but next time I'll look into that. I ran into people I knew, so the crowd is obviously awesome.

UPI0hpRC36a6GsNi0bq6Lg.review_text: five words: 6 dollar jack and cokes.  you gotta go.

om1aydWaYijFepbRO32Esw.review_text: I might be a little biased since I live right up the street, but the Lion Pub is a great place to get a drink any night of the week. The drinks are good and well made, and on week nights the atmosphere is nice and more relaxed and on Friday and Saturday nights it's upbeat and fun. However, sometimes the service is pretty slow when the place gets busy and it can get really hot inside. But overall it's a great hidden neighborhood bar that I don't think I'll ever tire of!

4XIjdvV3bz-e_NYzJRJLHg.review_text: Love Lion Pub. Great tap beer selection, fresh squeezed juice for greyhounds etc, sometimes they offer a cheese plater if you get there early enough. I like the ambiance; dark with comfy chairs and a fireplace.

4k9-LoufKfGflVzQfmkrdw.review_text: this place has always been in my 'hood, and i've occasionally stopped here from time to time, never really thinking much about it.  this last visit has altered my opinion.  1. fun music  2. its jammin' on thursdays - perfect for when you dont wanna do the "dooch dooch dooch" thing at slide or sutra.   3.  it has an elusive, plush ambiance to it with lots of plants that i enjoyed.  4.  i discovered that they make all their drinks with fresh fruit and they are DELICIOUS!!  i'll never have another greyhound anywhere else again.  plus, they have a number of creative concoctions like strawberry mango mojitos and blackberry lemon martinis.  girly, i know...but BOMB!!!   oh, and the g.m., Bart, is cool and makes sure everyones having fun.  no pretenciousness.  it can get too crowded, however.

mJHhMXJK8yWnG1CNgJKxGw.review_text: At Lion's Pub I have sat on a lion, met dates, mates and have stayed quite, quite late.   I love this neighborhood bar immensely. It is a cozy place to meet for a drink during the week to suit your various lounging desires.  At the bar? At a table? Near a fire place? On a lion statue?  On the weekend it can get quite crowded, but only makes for more fun.  Get a Greyhound.  Freshly squeezed grape fruit juice? Vodka?  Why don't you ask me to marry you already, Lion's Pub.  One thing to remember is that this pub only accepts cash.  Or else.

4Ev2ab9JLlbaZbwI0jPuRQ.review_text: Get there later in the night, but a great joint.

iNG7ZttDhk5rU-9H0UyAEg.review_text: I have been craving visiting this place since I went there last. It's the perfect place to go when the weather isn't so friendly outside. The fireplace is nice and warm and if the fireplace doesn't warm you up then the drinks will, internally!   The fruity mojitos are just amazing. I think I had a strawberry mango mojito when I was there, if memory serves. Granted, I don't know if memory does serve because I was already a bit inebrieted when I walked into this comfy warm little joint with my friends. Bring good friends that you can have decent conversations with and you'll have a fine time! Mmmmmmm...strawberry mango mojitos!   Minus one star for being hard to find, really expensive, and me not knowing about it sooner! :P

YMvLjKg0LDenF_amDErkVA.review_text: Cheese and crackers after 10 pm, fire place, fresh squeezed juices and cozy romantic atmosphere.

IgilLxPgRc3x7GSbD_dp5g.review_text: Don't go on the weekends.  If you do, go early! 3.5  I usually frequent this establishment on the weekdays and it seems to be a pretty chill place to grab a drink close to home.  Some drinks are made from scratch (fresh fruit, muddling) but they're pretty pricey for the type of establishment you're in (a dive bar with a young/hip crowd).    1)  ITS SMALL....and that sucks.  Just walking in on most nights and you are right away fighting to make your way to the bar or a table (there's no table service, so grab your drink first).  Plus, it gets hot as hell.  Wear 'breathable' clothes.  2)  Bartenders, for the most part, are fast and efficient.  They usually run with 3 on the weekends w/a barback who DOESN'T make drinks -I'm still flabbergasted why some barbacks do this...don't you want to be a bartender one day or at least help the bartenders make more tips which would in turn benefit you?  Keeping your head down while washing glassware or pointing to a bartender with 5 people waiting in line  is not going to fulfill either of those goals- but I digress.  The bartenders seem to know what they are doing, and most of the ones I've talked to seem to be cool and engaging.    3)  Yes, there is a cheese and crackers display, but unless you get them within the first hour or two....I wouldn't touch them!  Especially around 12 or 1 in the morning after the hammered guys and girls have been slobbering all over them.  **Overall, very cool place to chill on the weekdays for a good drink and crowd (guys, sit by the fireplace...you'll thank me later).  Stay away on the weekends unless you love shoulder to shoulder contact.

-eRfdiI6gmGyKYvckXxvhA.review_text: Fresh squeezed juices....grapefruit, watermelon...yum.  Try a greyhound here, it'll ruin every one you have after that.  Very dim and chill.  There's a fire place, I think, another afternoon delight.  Other yelper's are right though, the crowd is OC rejects, but typical for it's location..and who cares anyways if you're having fun with your friends.

wAw9FHMiOZd9ROoc5x4DpQ.review_text: I love this little social haven in the middle of residential lower pac heights.  they make the most delicious mojitos with fresh fruit.  And if you haven't heard yet, they have a fantastic platter of free food including spinach dip, cheeses, guacamole, and chips.    It's a great week night spot to catch up with friends.  now if they would only start taking credit cards, I'd give them that last star.

RySDpRT0wC1xTkq5worldA.review_text: Lion's Pub, or "The Den" as I call it is my all time favorite bar in San Francisco.  Their drinks are delicious and the bartenders are real sweet.  They also play FANTASTIC music, they have great taste, oh and they always have fresh, beautiful orchids.  Their decorations also crap me up during Halloween, Xmas, ext.  My friends and I love going there during the week.  5 stars, 5 stars.  You can also throw private parties there and their fireplace is adorable.  Ohhh and you can't miss the giant Lion near the door, its money.

uyOd-CBpiP69ruQNZyt_bw.review_text: This is the spot to be in Pacific Heights on those nights where you just want a chill atmosphere while you hang with someone close to you.  The drinks are made with fresh sqeezed juices (my faves were the Watermelon Vodka, Bloodhound & Greyhound.) They play good music, the staff is really nice, the drinks amazing & well priced.  There is also a fire place & lots of seating.  I just moved a block away from the Lion Pub (Aka: Lion's Den) & have made it my regular place to take my out-of-town guests because its pretty underground and the vibe is unique... You should definately check it out if you are in the area.

ucfCpo-qkQWE-pXp2873Uw.review_text: I was forewarned that the crowd was pretty 'fratty' and that warning was correct. Not really my scene. We borrowed a chair from an empty 'reserved' area and somebody came by and took it back from us even though we said we were more than happy to return the chair when the party showed up.  The reserved party never showed up, btw, and we had to sit on each other's laps all night.  Sounds cute, but in practice isn't quite as fun as you'd think. It was one of those places where you have to yell to hear the person next to you.  Also, yes, they only take cash. The drinks were quite good and the decor is actually kind of cool, so if someone wanted to come here on a week night I probably wouldn't discount it *right* away.  However, a weekend night is a big NO from me from now on.  Bleh.  I was turned off by this place.  Oh yeah, and they don't have any toilet seat protector papers available in their bathroom. :(

F-1Sjy1xOk0UIvXpCgiGgA.user_location: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, CA
F-1Sjy1xOk0UIvXpCgiGgA.review_text: Amazing bar! They are known for their fresh fruit cocktails: they squeeze everything in front of you! My only complaint would be the fact that the bar layout makes it hard to get a drink and/or stand around...

355W7iKObLwu3greKAJcqQ.review_text: Meh...I don't really see what the big deal here is either...the decor is kind of tacky..but maybe if i were there later at night and drunker i wouldnt notice...the fireplace wasnt on when we were there, so that would have been nicer.. its very hidden away, so you would think maybe its exclusive, but it seemed more a neighborhood kind of bar (not a bad thing!), i didnt think the drinks were very strong personally for $9 (i do have a high tolerance, but the drink was 99% ice and fruit...) also, after blueberry mojitos elsewhere, which are amazing but  practically virgin my expectations were high... all in all, not a bad place if maybe you know the bartender and get free drinks, but otherwise, i wouldnt bother coming back... also cash only, which is always a downer..

6Q_itWphZ2Fn_qC6I53Fkg.review_text: Cool bar. Good hang out place with your friends, but not a bar to bring a book to.   Great location filters out some of the 'cheese'. Locals know what I mean.

yN3cBeSdhtFRcFPdLgDlbw.review_text: Placed on a random corner, one would never see or think that such a place as the Lion Pub exists.  But much to my surprise, I was brought to this gem a couple of years ago by a blind date and found myself very excited when I moved into the neighborhood recently.  I don't know when it happened, but this neighborhood haunt became flooded with the Marina crowd, who I guess decided their nightly jaunts to Bar None were becoming blase. Not that I mind really. It makes for great people watching, and if you get a Marina guy on a good night (meaning he isn't trying to get into the pants of a blonde Marina girl) they can actually be funny to talk to.  I HIGHLY recommend their mojitos, and their greyhounds are fabulous. Hands down the BEST mojitos I have had in the city so far.  PLUS they have food. OMG. This basically gives me free license to drink myself silly because I have food at my disposal, and lovely cheese.   The decor is fun and different, and the bartenders are pretty mellow too.  Do note that they only take cash, so be prepared with some $20s or suck up and use the ATM.   Also, I recommend weeknights as to truly enjoy the bar and ambiance. You want a night where people are there to enjoy the drink and the company they are with, rather than who they can end up going home with.

cDAdfpWUkpP9BB_aW4qjbA.review_text: Crowded and dark and really really warm if you end up sitting by the fire. But that's probably the best spot if you want to make some impromptu nachos. Go over to the free snackies bar and get some chips and some mozzarella and melt yourself some nachos. The juice squeezer at the main bar is a total plus--fresh OJ, fresh lime, etc. Mmm. Thems knows hows to makes freshys drinks.  Times visited: 1

9IYZc_sX7v939OhRGDjj-g.review_text: Four stars and here is why  Star 1) Cheese spread, I love cheese and it is free and good Star 2) Great mojito's and Fresh Squeezed everything Star 3) Good interior decor, very cool and loungy Star 4) Good bartenders they only problem, the crowd sux, it gets to crowded on the weekends, and the people are full of themselves, a pet peeve of mine.  Go on a slow night and it well worth the trip.

K9U2qxPFi5llft8KuZIPjg.review_text: I really want to like my neighborhood bar, but I can't get in on the weekends.   I guess it is okay on the weekdays, but with the G Bar and Solstice within walking distance, why?

SF9TF3Zj8TOrk-0d3qjcUA.review_text: Great cocktail list. I love the fresh juices.  Dark with a cozy fire place and mellow vibe. Totally recommend!

UHgXmu7hl-o078IW_Fp4dg.review_text: alas poor lion i knew you well for today you stand conquered by breeders  weeknights are tolerable here but the kids at SFSU really ruined this place.  famous as a gay bar for several decades(check for the mention in  maupin's "tales of the city"), young kids figured that they gay men wouldn't sweat them for not having ID and took over the place.  the product is still fantastic, fresh squeezed madras and hor's d'oeuvres hit the spot, but it has lost that subtle feel where you could go to get cruised by a guy in a tweed jacket and a monocle in favor of some dimwit wearing an izod with turned-up collar spilling his red bull and grey goose on you and then trying to get in your face about it.  once an incognito landmark, now just another chump factory.

Npp5jjoVA4FBm7pYQZgr0g.review_text: LP (what the locals call it- and I would know this because I am a local), Lion Pub is so random, but oh so lovely. It's a few blocks from my apartment, so that's probably why I go there. It is crowded on weekends which can make it pretty hot in there, but otherwise, the free cheese makes up for it (unless the cheese gets hot too).  I have found that though there are some lame people (when I say lame, I am referring to the people who think they are cooler than the average person and get way too dressed up for happy hour), but otherwise you can always meet someone new. Average age ranges from 20-29, but anyone would enjoy the delicious mojitios! All their fruity drinks are made with the real citrus- squeezed right there! I am a huge fan of the greyhound (grapefruit and vodka...mmmm).

qmXEQq33yvAiL7DPk8Si2Q.review_text: I love this place... great drinks, great location, great music... until it gets crowded and then it is dirty and sweaty and loud.  Oh well, I'll just go during the week or for an early evening drink on the weekend.

OmLK-5oDDF7q4xmXvE6XBg.review_text: Hate to admit it but the strawberry mojito is damn good. Even worse, it might be my favorite drink.....of all-time...yes, it is unmanly....but...once it hit your lips...

k3wjSI44_hXgqMiYHqah7g.review_text: I don't really have anything bad to say about this place but it also wasn't a favorite of mine. Yes, it's true - they have a long list of specialty drinks but to be honest they weren't good (and we tried a LOT of drinks). We had to order basic drinks after the first round or two. The drinks are also kind of pricey.  The vibe is pretty mellow (it was on January 1st so maybe that's why) and I like how hidden it's location is. Only bad thing - not too much around the bar.

716WqAcXCBScPvRx3vhE8A.review_text: I write this review with great sadness since Lion pub used to be one of my most favorite neighborhood spots. Before, I would have rated it with 5 starts. Now, a lousy 2 stars describes my experience last Friday night. Here's how it went down...I walked the 5 blocks it takes me to get to the bar from my house and pull out my I.D for the door man. Right then a young man opens the door and says "dude, douche bags!". The door man explains to me that it was that bartender and I joke that he should be more picky when letting people in.  Right when I walk inside I realized this is a completely different experience I had ever had at this bar. First and foremost I would like to reference the Music. This place used to have a great sound track, but Friday night....techno and club beats! what? at the lion pub?  The place was packed, the lighting was dark (which is pretty normal for the pub) and i couldn't even hear myself talk over the blasting music. I left right after i finished my drink.... A word for the bartender who is complaining to the doorman about the crowd he's letting in...change the playlist on you ipod and maybe you wont attract so many douchebags!   How I will miss the greyhounds with fresh squeezed grape fruit juice!   ps. what happened to Doug? .

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: stopped into the lion's pub (which i thought was called the lion's den... is that something different?  maybe i was misinformed) for drinks after dinner, celebrating my friend's bachelorette party.  i thought it was a cool spot, definitely crowded for a saturday night of course.  but the layout was cool and my mango strawberry mojito was delicious.  not sure about the crowd though, i think i need to go back again to really make a judgement call!

OFPNE_TTnl9TAEQxrTK23w.review_text: FRESHHH. Greyhounds to mojitos to whatever you want, it's amazing drinks with fresh fruit squeezed via old school iron OJ squeezers. Location is not so great ... meh unless you live close by and I don't know of too much else in the area, but if you're just looking to chill with some great drinks and a nice crowd, definitely check this place out on a quieter night.  Yum yum. Definitely will come back to try more mojitos and greyhounds again. Oh, cash only? Yeah, bring the Benjamin's. Well more like Hamilton's and Jackson's.  Cheers.

c8FOqDRhtL7q_YsQio6bog.review_text: The Lion Pub is famous for a few things...  1) All their drinks feature freshly squeezed juice (they have an old school juicer at the bar). 2) They offer complimentary crackers and cheese late in to the night. And if you've been drinking for a while, this can save you from a nasty hangover the next morning. 3) They have a cozy fireplace (perfect for a first date). 4) It used to be a gay bar back in the day. Now it mostly appeals to Pac Heights heteros and metrosexuals. 5) No one seems to get the name right of this place. I've heard people refer to it as the Lion's Bar, the Lion's Den, etc. Folks - it's called the Lion Pub (plain and simple).  Personally, I prefer coming here Sunday - Wednesday when it's less crowded. It's a nice, intimate spot for a tasty cocktail and good conversation. But come Thursday - Saturday, this place turns in to a raucous frat party. Don't get me wrong, this is probably a fun scene if you're in your early 20s. But I'm in my late 30s, so I'm less inclined to hang out in a loud bar and wait 20 minutes for a drink (Boy, do I sound old or what?!!).  In any case, if you're looking for a cool bar that caters to in-the-know locals, Lion Bar will serve you well.   ** FYI, this is a cash-only bar (no credit cards). They do have an in-house ATM near the bathroom, but the service charge is pretty steep. Please plan accordingly.

w7CvXX2dtmPCm67TRJw7kQ.review_text: Luckily, the strange location means I don't go here often.  I really like the free cheese plate, but this place plays the worst music ever. And how tacky is the decor? I like the fireplace, but there's always a table of annoying people either bogarting it, or making out in front of it.   The names of the drinks? Is this a college bar by San Diego State?

e5nVwumNhVF7K_3OR8OcdA.review_text: This bar would be pretty amazing if it wasn't extremely crowded on weekends with Marina bro-hams, but it's still the best bar within stumbling distance to my apartment. Honestly, this place is at it's best right when it opens at 5pm on the weekends or on any weeknight. It has a very 70s cave-man/log cabin kind of vibe with the exposed stone walls and fireplace. They're always playing the best random mix of 90's, grunge, punk, classic rock, electro, and generally awesome hits from the past 10 years. Their fresh fruit cocktails can't be matched, especially their strawberry mojito, and one of their margaritas definitely left me feeling quite saucy. Bonus points for the free cheese and cracker spread. They also have some pretty amazing names for their shots, like the Chuck Norris and Kurt Cobain for example. All in all, love this place...during the week.

DH7ABAMHvl6IQfJ_yK7x5Q.review_text:
The three stars are strictly for the cool jungle decor, ambiguity of location, and fresh fruit drink selection.  I had to take away two stars for the horrible techno music selection and the undesirable crowd.  They kinda make you think you ARE in a lion's den because the men look at you like you're a piece of meat and the women glare at you like they want to scratch your eyes out because you're with the cutest guy in the bar.  Well, these cats can keep it... I'll do my hunting elsewhere.
  Drink of choice:  Strawberry Mango mojito...  huge chunks of ripe strawberries muddled with fresh mint leaves... one damn good drink!  Now, if they could only use a rum that packs more of a punch than mango flavored Parrot Bay, it might seem more like a cocktail than a fruit smoothie

bRXgdy0b8cGRgOJgw0X0vw.review_text: interesting venue, good crowd, good drinks
