PRf0WHLd3FwdtZ3TJnOjjA.review_text: I am not sure how wonderful the atmosphere was, or how great the leafy treas were lining the walls.  I do remember that every time we asked for grey goose soda, we got grey goose tonic, which I hate!  The reason why they get 4 stars is because I had such a great time here.  It was the night before Thanksgiving and my friends and I partied till closing time!  Then partied more afterwards!  It was blast!

-Qf4ffBkhYailgZ57ZenOA.review_text: I really liked the Lion Pub.  I thought it had a fun and young atmosphere.  The drinks are made from freshly squeezed fruit, so they are fresh and yummy!  I think I had the one with grapefruit and vodka, I don't remember the name of it.    They also have the infamous cheese and cracker table which is a nice snack after you've been drinking.  Stand around the bar or sit around tables, this place has plenty of room.

nNsDgAaEbxXw-fPOlIaP-Q.review_text: I came here on a friend's recommendation, because the girlfriend and I like cocktails (we both bartend/ed) and I also liked what I read on Yelp.  What a disappointment. We didnt' like our mojitos (strawberry and raspberry) at all. We both make MUCH better ones. Giving them the benefit of the doubt, I tried their Chimney Top; I like lemon drops and I like scotch, so I figured, why not? Well now I know why not: because it's disgusting!  I like the decor, it's a really nice setting. The music was ok, the usual House thing.  The bartender was not really friendly with us; but he was super cool with the group of 3 girls next to us.  I really like their free cheese and crackers; that's a nice touch.  But the best thing about this is that it gave me an idea: I am going to make a Yelp list of mojitos in San Francisco, starting with this place. Every mojito I try now will be rated as follows:  - Taste: 2 stars. Tasted like a mojito, but no fruit flavor. - Appearance: 1 star. Awful muddling, no effort on presentation. - Price: 3 stars. 9 bucks, fair. - Bartender's name: didn't get it, but no biggie since there is nothing memorable about him, or his mojitos. - Overall: 1 star and a half mojito.

x3JcGJ0FdEEnFqM2GeU9mQ.review_text: I am enamored with the fruity, delicious beverages at this incognito establishment on Divis. This low-key neighborhood pub is a good counterpart to the nearby Solstice which I like but can get over crowded and stuffy on a busy weekend night. Try the Mango Mojitos, try whatever fresh and bubbly concoction strikes your fancy, you won't be disappointed.

n0j_WX6RxpHUBsaeoLcjXg.review_text: wow, a pub that mixes drinks with real, fresh grapefruit and/or watermelon... of course, i would never order one of those sober...

xskdmkZQJVqFLgwhrB6vrw.review_text: Maybe it was just last night, but mostly this place was overcrowded, full of douchey folks, and slow on the bar-service.

HtIOLw_1bL9LxQ2tNnuZmw.review_text: How come there's a checkbox for Hipster but not Yuppie?  My friend was in town from the East Coast and stayed at my place, so when the lady friend he kept in touch with via FB wanted to take him out, I humored him and tagged along, eventually ending up here. What ensued was a night filled with the pop hits blaring over the speakers that one would find at a girl's 22nd birthday. It was like a college frat party without the fit, attractive coeds. An added point for the fresh squeezed Great Danes/Greyhounds.  Pass.

H42gxpws1xE4sf7c0G3yAg.review_text: I live a about 5 blocks from Lion Pub.  When I can convince my lazy ass friends to walk it they always thank me for it.  The best fresh fruit drinks you will find.  I go here strictly for the Salty Dog's.  They use fresh grapefruits, lemons, limes, and oranges for all the corresponding drinks.  Nice tune selections by the friendly bar staff combined with great spirits equal a postive experience.  Do they still have they cheese, crackers, smoked salmon, etc plates?  I haven't seen them the last few times I stopped in.

fvt04gH2_0koTf8cL4NyOg.review_text: great drinks, great bartenders, great time!

FkiDKAYGGNIPQVdMe4JEXQ.review_text: Recently a lot of things have been coming full circle in my life. Five years ago I used to stay on Divisidero and out of nowhere I've found myself back in places I haven't seen in years. Last night was one of those times.   I meandered in here with a few of my newer friends and was lured in by the promise of alcohol and cheese. Cheese? I thought. Well lo and behold, a few seconds after walking in, a huge basket full of crackers and four huge chunks of cheese sat before us. After taking in the cheese I observed my surroundings and realized that I had been there before but couldn't really remember a damn thing about the experience.  Damn shame to because this bar has this decor that could totally serve as the backdrop of a Tarentinoesque film. Reddish lighting, mirrors, funky seating and large lions posted about give it an interesting look. But of course, half of an experience is the company your with. I wound with some people I know from Polk. I realized we're like little gremlins. You know how there are a bunch of rules for gremlins like you can't get them wet or feed them after midnight? Yeah we need a set of rules. We're a bunch of little hooligans and descended upon the snacks. We had three hairdressers (read: creative types) and they turned a healthy portion of the shnacky offerings into pretty appetizers. It's what they do. The bartender on duty was nice enough to our gaggle of heathens even after one member whined about the lack of ranch dressing for the (free) carrot sticks. I really dug my lemon drop, too. The process to make each shot was time consuming and I later noticed other yummy looking drinks being sent out.  Hmm.....I foresee an update on this one later...

NDODNoud0WAT6212kg6SDw.review_text: Bold statement: probably my favorite bar in SF for delicious drinks.  This place is essentially unmarked except for the fact that it looks like a hidden jungle overgrown with plants and a tiny engraved door with windows on the side covered in plants.  I think there is a lion's head on the door which is how you know...   The drinks are UNREAL. They legit take handfuls of FRESH fruit and mash it into each glass one at a time to mix these delicious (and strong) concoctions.  You really cannot go wrong.  Each drink is about $8-$10 and it is cash only... but I swear it's worth it.   The bartenders are usually pretty friendly too. They are willing to chat with you about the drinks while they work if you're feeling chatty.    There's this whole platter of cheeses and crackers... Um awesome? Yes. I think I thought it was an illusion when I first saw it but I went over and took about 4 different kinds of delicious cheeses to snack on.    Great music is always blasting and I hear it gets pretty crowded on weekend nights.  Unfortunately it's kind of a hassle to get too and there isn't always easy parking, but if you're in the neighborhood it's DEFINITELY worth it.   Overall, the inside is pretty dark and mysterious - it legit feels like you're in some kind of a jungle because the windows are covered in vines and there's just barely a glow from the fireplace and dimmed ceiling lights.  Fun vibe if you want to really impress someone with a unique bar.

T6SuLkeGko0shJacHYWq6g.review_text: Oh shoot, Lion Pub... You so could have had 5 stars!  I really like the atmosphere here and there are so many beautiful girls.  The greyhound was the best I've ever had, ever...I want another, now.  Buuuut, only two (cool, but slooow) bar tenders for the whole place!?!  Our big crew of people were ready to drop a lot of money, but since we could only get one drink in 45 minutes we just had to move on.  I'll get this place a few more tries...

xwlHo-QHxB8BM9jb2ITirg.review_text: This is one of the essential stops on my SF tour. There are some of the best mojitos at this place. They use fresh fruit in all of their cocktails. In the summer they have Watermelon and strawberry mojitos. Taste like candy. Its the perfect drink for those people who have a low tolerance for the taste of alcohol. Now I think they have the mango blueberry.   Also later in the evenings there is a free cheese plate for you to pick at.   I don't like going during the weekend. It gets too packed and sweaty in there. Monday thru Weds. prefect place to get some drinks after dinner.

x4jz0a19Si0BhfftElEjvQ.review_text: I came here to try one of their famous mojitos and left disappointed. The mojito was incredibly sour -- I think the bartender forgot to put the sugar in when he was mixing it and wasn't really open to hearing that from me. I'm hoping it was just a one-time thing because I've heard great things about their cocktails but I don't know that I'll ever be back to try it.  The cheese and cracker spread was nice though. The boyfriend was all about that.

IB0_DRx-L8O1MtzwPF-lQw.review_text: Love their fresh fruit drinks. Even a seemingly simple drink like a greyhound tastes absolutely amazing when fresh juices are involved.   Their fruit mojitos and margaritas are pretty great. Will need to report back on the shots. If nothing else they have great names.  One thing that's sort of annoying is that some of the drinks on the menu are basically never available because they seem to constantly be missing essential ingredients.  Pro-tip: Ask for a splash of St. Germaine in your greyhound. It'll taste like honey and a party on your tongue.

yl6XMllhyZGKA9qKNLYK4Q.review_text: Look at my striped shirt!!!  Look at my striped shirt!!!!    This douchebag skank house is amazingly bad.   However gets extra star for free cheese and crackers - that's a very nice touch.

efCnbnlcAYyFYwFAR-RgEw.review_text: A friend turned me on to this place.  If you like Mojito's you must try this place.  The downfall is that it gets super cramped and it's hard to get to the bar.  Once you are there it takes a while to get the bartenders attention from all the rest of the people also trying to order drinks.  But once you get your drink it makes up for most of the trouble it took to get it.  3.5 stars.

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: "Check out Fresh Nugs, wheezin' the juice...Oooooooowwwwww! Bud-dy!"   (Freshly squeezed mojitos, margaritas and caipirinhas. A MUST for cocktail enthusiasts.)

Zl1fJNTzNULZiqBRShxUYA.review_text: I could have sworn that this place was called Lion's Den and that it was on Sacramento.  Oh well.  I've only been here three or four times, and this was before I hated all of Pac Heights except for Fillmore Street, so I have a basically good impression of it.  I don't drink, so I shouldn't be reviewing bars, but I do eat cheese, and this place has free cheese.  And it's good cheese.  I think there are crackers and fruit too.  But mostly cheese.  The decor of this place is slightly Miami, slightly Manhattan, and slightly Malibu.  I don't know if the regulars are that pretentious, but I didn't smell too much pretentiousness when I was here, but again, that was back when I didn't have a nose for this stuff.  It would get four stars if it weren't in Pac Heights.

9Y0nDI1K97QReyQjHUQxWw.review_text: The best thing I could really say for this place is that the bar back was pretty cute and talkative. The drinks that everyone was raving about brought me back to my non-too-far-ago jungle juice days...less "fresh squeezed" more "many kinds of kool-aid" flavor.  The free cheese and crackers were a nice touch, but my friends and I could only loom over there momentarily (for fear of becoming the cheese-hoarder girls).

GoAQCvu0E9vQjJjoMb91eg.review_text: I thought it was Lion's Den!? Anyway, this place is pretty awesome. I went here with a couple of buddies of mine this past weekend. It was super cold, so the fireplace was highly appreciated. And they have a free cheese and cracker spread?!, nice, about to fall in love! They make a killer Greyhound, with fresh grapefruit mind you. They juice it right in front of you. The place has a nice laid-back, almost jungle like vibe to it (I know that sounded weird, but hey it does). It's decently big, but gets packed pretty quick on the weekends from what I've been told. The crowd is mostly 20s and early 30s,  with a couple of yuppies thrown into the mix, but hey it is super easy to meet new people. I would've given this place 5 stars, but a cash only establishment in the heart of the city is just wrong. Fix it!   Oh, skip the Irish Car Bombs, they skim on the beer. On the whole, an awesome place to chill at with a group.

mB50b5XbG05whEBXkQRA-w.review_text: What a great little find this bar was.....the screwhound, amazingly tasty. Basil in a drink....what? Superb. My husband said the Mojitos were one of the best he has had in the world! They use fresh juices, juiced right there in front of your-was a big treat! The atmosphere is unique and love the fact that it seemed hidden among the jungles of the building-nice touch. We'll be back!

f0emREVyDVN-xbGmheXISQ.review_text: Discovered this place last night - I had a top-shelf margarita, which was delicious.  The crowd was both good-looking and fun to talk to.  Because it's almost invisible from the street, it seems to attract a neighborhoodie crowd - a nice thing for anyone who lives in Presidio Heights or Pacific Heights.  I plan to go back!

TXginX5AqsLPhC0--NKVGQ.review_text: I love this place, but want to give it 1 star to keep other Yelpers away from it. Be sure to try the greyhound!

yVZGQfKeBBYFElt-nsfxBQ.review_text: Fresh squeezed juice drinks and 3 blocks from my apartment? What else could I ask for? I've hit up Lion Pub a few times and each time I go it's a different experience.  First time was for the cheese plate that my guy friends went directly for. Second was for the fruit drinks. Third was for the fruit drinks...OK, the fruit drinks are awesome as they're FRESH squeezed. Reminding me of the East Side Company Bar in New York (but about 2x its size) with its bartenders acting more like bar experts. Raspberry mojito was delish as well as my new favorite drink The Greyhound.   Friendly crowd of the mid-late twenties flock to this bar. Come in at 9 and the place is empty. Wait 45 minutes and you won't be able to move. Grab a table if you can and if you wait around long enough, someone will jump on the life size lion statue for photos :)

0k07_WcBZSOs6VaJ8t3jDg.review_text: Minus two stars for making really incredible fruit mojitos that cost $10 a pop and then not accepting credit cards.  Cash only is NOT the way to go.  But the strawberry mojito (and then a mango one) was amazing.

PQwC6zXjQXMOtRuC_vhP6w.review_text: Wow how times have changed...I used to work at this little pub and when I worked here the crowd was not ummm yuppie or pac heights as it appears that it has become...in fact here is how this pub has always been advertised as -   "Esteemed by some who are in the know as the classiest gay bar in SF, this Victorian-fronted club-pub is renowned for the beauty of its bartenders. A diverse crowd comes to glimpse the gorgeous staff, the fellow clientele, and the interior, which features a changing array of antiques that are always in the most exquisite taste."  yes, I was the only female at a "classy" gay bar for the time I worked there...and I loved it that way...yes we made great mojitos, greyhounds, margaritas, screwdrivers and I'm sure that they still do! I loved working here, they used to give out almonds during the day those go oh so nicely with a good bloody mary. But the transition from gay bar to trendy hetro bar was a rough one, sounds however that this bar has done well and I'm glad to hear it, the owner is a sweet man.    i miss those days...

GEedwjwfRYSBu22h1BUkGg.review_text: Great little neighborhood bar. It's close enough to the Fillmore to have elegance but far enough to be more "real" and less "stuck-up".

oOnOGWB3my27zynil49nmA.review_text: I thought this place was pretty cool. Bartender was a nice guy and the atmosphere was chill. I liked all the tables by the fireplace. Unfortunately it was warm last night, so the fireplace wasn't near as effective but it would be great on a cold night. There is cheese and crackers out for everyone, however I was a little scared of the thought of all those hands touching the food. If I was drunk, I probably wouldn't have cared, haha.   I wouldn't say a strikingly gorgeous crowd, although there were a couple cuties.    Con: one bathroom for women...Unfortunately in a bar, there needs to be a couple. Other than that, pretty cool place.

TmAd0zvOqTd7lRCclz_ouQ.review_text: The fresh-squeezed drinks are nice, but: - it was too crowded on a saturday night - the music was too loud to hear people talking, which would be fine if people were dancing, but no one was - the atmosphere crossed over from divey into douchey.   Might be 3 stars on other nights of the week.

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: I like "pubs." The wooden bar really does it for me. Lion's pub has a great bar. But their lack of beers on tap, cheese and crackers, and the high prices kind of didn't.   I feel like it's a pub for people who club more than they pub. i.e., not me. It'd still be a good place for a drink on a date.

j4FECd4INVCEMoGaxdADkg.review_text: If you want fast service here, be a cute girl and wear a cute hat. Works every time!

g5D9Uwt9jNzg6TNHtuHuuA.review_text: All their drink are made with real fruit! Great drinks, and its packed on the weekend. We go on a regularly.

vtqG1feOJe08x0lf0BVZSg.review_text: I live really close to this bar and I love coming here for their fresh fruit drinks.  I think I have probably tried all their fruit mojitos and have come to the conclusion that the cantaloupe ones are the best.  I feel silly sometimes, but I literally will grab out the chunks of fruit cause they're delicious.  One mojito is usually enough for me as they are quite strong!  I'm pretty sure the blueberry mojitos use frozen blueberries because once when I ordered it and ate the fruit,  they were rubbery and chewy.   And there is no way you can skip out on the cheese platter as it is such a great addition to the bar.  On weeknights you can actually easily get to the cheese platter and not feel like there have been dozens of hands in it.  It gets EXTREMELY crowded in here on weekends and the place is a cash only bar - which is really annoying and hence the loss of one star.

kdFqlY8tt_th1lN-1iAv3A.review_text: This place was pretty great.  Really mellow, roaring fire, nice lighting, cool bathroom.  All very unpretentious but nice, including the bartender.  Drinks were average priced (6-8 dollars for cocktails) and well made.  Would definitely come here again if I were in the neighborhood!

p6ucyVInOdbf1-jlwz1Vcg.review_text: Cute place. The lighting is dark and the tables were low and comfortable to sit and people watch. There were a TON of girls here all dressed up for a Friday night. They have a big fire place in the middle of the room too, which feels cozy. The specialty drink menu looks great too and the prices were reasonable. I would have tried one but it took all my effort to flag a bartender just to order, that I hadn't picked anything yet and didn't want to keep him there while I decided. That's my only beef with this place. The service at the bar wasn't attentive. It felt like the 'cocky bartender' place and each one who helped us made me feel like I was wasting his time. I tip well, I'm friendly, I know what I want to order, and I order easy drinks... So there's no reason to be a dick to me. The cheeses they had out for everyone to snack on was a nice touch, but looked a little 'sweaty' and disturbing after a few hours. I'll try this place again, cause the vibe was definitely worth a second shot!

cPwB9IY8bjdD0fukJr5mjg.review_text: This place is away from the tourists and seems more of a locals bar.  It is kinda hard to spot.  I was visiting a friend who lives in the area and we walked here and i walked right passed it not thinking this place could be a bar.  We were there on a Thursday early evening so it was still kinda dead. Which was nice because I hate very crowded bars. Locals say this place gets PACKED so I recommend going early.   The drinks are made with fresh squeezed ingredients. I ordered a Basil Mojito which was nice and tasty.  Tasty as in it was SO strong i didnt taste anything but Rum (not a bad thing) haha.  5 Star place but only 4 Star only cuz the staff really didnt seem too friendly (heavy handed pourers yes but personality was kinda lacking)   Cant wait to go back!

tLOru0DbqL6oMVhdGlFW0Q.review_text: Definitely a good find in the city.  Pretty hidden at the corner of Divis and Sacramento but very chill, cool music, plenty of table seating, great drinks and can't wait to come back to try more.  I actually had the strawberry mango mojito which was just okay but like I said, I would like to try more on the list.  Interesting to see an assortment of cheese and crackers in front of the Buddha statue in the back.  Note: cash only but they have an ATM inside

Ha4mOL_9JtmYgn7NvrAu6A.review_text: Oh shit! This place is a special kind of awesome! I've only been here when it is kind of quiet but it totally feels like the kind of place that I went to in Petaluma. Where there was a make shift DJ & dance floor on Friday & Saturday and you got shitty with gross guys because there is no cover.  Not that that is what this place is. It's just what it reminds me of.  But I am a large fan of their fruit mojitos. And the funky plant like decor. It feels like this place is half tiki bar & half gross dirty bar that you get into with no cover (see above). I'm sure I will come back and give it a more solid try, maybe on a Friday to confirm my suspicions.

dQLNRErgI9UygLUb9xJBIQ.review_text: All the "girly" drinks are made with fresh fruit and nothing beats a fresh drink. Watermelon vodkas, greyhounds and strawberry mango mojitos are definitely worth the trip to one of the lone bars in the area.  It's a little crowded, dark and stuffy, but the fireplace adds a nice feel and if you're lucky enough to get a small table for your group, you should feel settled for the night.

KVmhGRWJjWouy45gebVzLw.review_text: The best bar in the country.

puS8HuNdeXhhl5F4bb0EEg.review_text: Like this place.  Loud but friendly.  Strong mojitos.    I was tipsy by the end of the night so I didn't get to ride the lion!    Will be back...

w37I_X9BTpxTo8mCT-BAZw.review_text: This place was packed when I came to celebrate my friends birthday. Fun bar, if a little on the smaller side. Overall, good beer selection,    This seems like a good bar if you were trying to meet girls, they have a table full of cheese. It's almost like a mouse-trap... I of course have a girlfriend, but the girls in our group loved the cheese so I don't think I'm too far off-track here.  They were squeezing fresh fruit into the drinks too, which I thought was a nice touch.

BwTPj8XS_iqdSTLPBVMs1w.review_text: Holy crap. This place is nuts. Who knew this bar would be packed and crowded on a Saturday night? Tucked away in Pac Hts, this place is hard to find and does not belong in the neighborhood. That is why its so great. Because it does not belong.   Awesome place to grab a drink for a birthday party. I'd love to check this place out on a "slow" night. There is a fire place in the back and huge back area w/ seating. Huge juicer in the center of the bar for freshly made fruit cocktails. Freshly made mojitos are a great treat. Be careful though. If the fruit isn't in season then you will be stuck with a tart and tangy drink.   Try the Chuck Norris and Burt Reynolds. You'll be crying in the morning.

im_awbp-8gXBg-qDA9HbmQ.review_text: Tried this one out last weekend.  The decor and interior were great.  Positively rammed with frat boy D-bags, fun if you like that kind of thing (trust me, it doesen't say anything good about you).  My girlfriend and I DOWNED our OVER priced drinks and bounced the fuck up OUT of here QUICK.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: I am NOT a fan of using the word "chill" as an adjective, but it really describes this eclectic neighborhood bar to a tee. It's comfy and kitschy -- decorated in early "Grandma Got Shipped to a Nursing Home and We Got Stuck with Everything from her Florida Room" style. I'm a sucker for a strong drink and fireplace, so they're two-for-two. The energy can depend on the crowd, which is by all accounts cool.

vj-71bWcddq5l-FEkThVbw.review_text: Wow! Who knew this bar existed in the Pac Heights area... came here after lots of drinking (obviously to drink more) and it was so nice and cozy and completely dark inside. I should have read Yelp in my drunken stupor to know that they made speciality cocktails but instead drank the usual grey goose and tonic. We had a bunch of tables put together and had some cheese and crackers. It was a chilly night and loved that I could sit by the fireplace and warm up!   Bathroom is tiny - one stall and the sink is outside to wash your hands.

_BHTC7nyCBoZcfiiD5cOXg.review_text: Eons ago, this was a very discreet gay bar - hence all the foliage and lack of sign outside - for the sweater set . . . the only leather to be found was on Gucci shoes and shoulder bags, and it certainly wasn't black.  From the sounds of it, the place has turned hetero (but the decor stayed the same). Why must these pushy straight people take over everything??? Watch out Castro, here they come!

Nc4uWHBuFF407t3MzX0tOg.review_text: It's been a total miss recently... always empty!

Y20JOmRsD92VNo-XozNypA.review_text: Good drinks (stiff and pulpy), free snacks, and lush ambiance.  Walking distance from my house is also a big plus.  There are, however, a few gaffes: -Too damn many wicker chairs.  They're all over the place, and when it gets crowded, the goofy floorplan (bar right in front of the door) makes this place a total cluster-fuck.  It's like death by Banana Republic. -Cash only.  When is this phenomenon just going to go away?  Businesses (bars in particular) need to suck it up, pay the measly 2% and stop inconveniencing your alcoholic and over-estended patrons.  We have credit for a reason!  ***1/2.  When is yelp! going to get 1/2 stars?

f6iRA1UBcdPv1x3mDhvdyQ.review_text: the drinks are very good. but last year i found out a new rule for this bar.  if you have grey in your hair (as i do) - then you are welcome before 10. and it's a mellow place to relax over a drink w/good company PERO after 10pm go to Solstice, Lion's doesn't want you there.  good drinks though. late night - very young crowd.

Mdfl-U6LvKjZbczs4HTFWw.review_text: From my many fuzzy memories of being here, I'm pretty sure this place is awesome... :)  But really - the decor is interesting, the drinks are very yummy and decently priced, and it's big - which is good because it's absolutely packed on the weekends. If you don't like crowds, don't come here on a Saturday night. It can get almost too crowded to move. Definitely a spot worth checking out though, with a sweet happy hour. It's also really great for out-of-town guests, as it has a certain something that seems to appeal to everyone. As my roomie puts it - it's the only straight bar in the city he's guaranteed to have a good time at!

HZJA620xWYxaJI_PKbK0FA.review_text: I really like this bar. It has a fun decor that kind of makes me feel like I'm on vacation and they usually have snacks to pick at during the weeknights. I'm a big fan of gimlets, so it's great to be at a bar that specializes in fresh squeezed fruit drinks.   They're really affordable too and the bartenders are really knowledgable and friendly.

vHD6gH1GU9-qtTP_b-hypg.review_text: Basil greyhound and greyhound drinks are excellent! I hate sweet, girly drinks but this was definitely not. The bartender put a good amount of alcohol and used fresh squeezed grapefruit juice..so fresh tasting :)

bA6sFAZTIc5ddwpnB_WJUw.review_text: Campy lower Pacific Heights former gay bar went Abercrombie and Fitch before Abercrombie and Fitch -- Colonial India meets African jungle safari theme, shuttered windows, banana plants everywhere, and a crowd of buff good looking white people straight out of a ten year fraternity reunion.  This bar kills because the bartenders are attentive and caring, and make the best fresh fruit drinks in town -- watermelon, papayas, mangoes, strawberries, mint, grapefruit, it's all fresh and pressed, muddled, gouged, reamed, and squashed to your order.    But the REAL reason to come is the buffet spread.  Hummus, spinach dip, and cheese assortment stocked from open to close, seven days a week, so immutable and permanent it even has a street named for it.  I mean, every item has been in exactly the same place on that table -- cucumber rounds with the humus, brie round cut in half just in front of the pepper jack block, cocktail napkins just to the right of the spinach dip, for several years.  Any other part of town the buffet would be a shark attack.  But Pacific Heights yuppies don't like to show huger desperation in front of each other so the whole table waits for you untouched by their big back slapping hands.  The only real challenge is the lack of plates and utensils, you do it all with a sharp little knife and your fingers.  But if you  edge through the sea of striped shirts and push up bras to get to the back palm tree, your free dinner awaits.

FPGBCPxb1kJM8qm81lOZ-g.review_text: Yummy fruity drinks. They had great looking blackberries behind the bar, so I asked for a blackberry pineapple mojito. Delicious!

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: This was the first stop on our Easter Break pub crawl. I like the set up inside with the faux-tropical decor. It reminded me of places I envision my drunk uncles lounging in during the early 80's or something.  The girls in the group got the fruit-infused mojitos. My friend Maggie, the organizer of the pub crawl, had been raving about these things and they definitely lived up to the hype. The one I liked the most was the blueberry/pineapple mojito, but like a true man I stuck to beer the whole night.  Overall, more like 3.5 stars but it was better than anticipated (I heard the chode factor could be quite high here). And props to the cool doorman too for the friendly conversation outside whenever I stepped out for a break.

urhy2vLd0VWRPz9D3JAYMA.review_text: Not much to say. Old, dingy...oh I'm talking about the place itself, not the patrons. =)  Now I won't judge them all based on one but one guy thought he was the lead in Dirty Dancing on my way out. Classy.

sfQXLZGk6beiSuNZYb8iSQ.review_text: I LOVE this place! A great spot to hang, drink and chat with your friends! Cozy fireplace, bar service can be a bit slow but they do their best!

AhOYmLZ0oi3yFd3ut4e5aQ.review_text: Rub a Dub Dub, Three Lion Cubs in a Pub  Located on a remote neighborhood block in Pacific Heights, this oasis is filled with fresh fruit cocktails, a trendy atmosphere, and a crowded bar that rivals MUNI during commute hours. I took a fair damsel to this on the most joyous of first dates, and we each quenched our desert thirst with healthy portions of their renowned Greyhound.  We arrived at just before midnight, and the odds of us finding a place to kick up our feet were about as Slim as that music venue on 11th and Folsom. But the gods of the first date smiled upon us, and as I parted the red sea of people, a small table for two appeared and we quickly claimed it - fortune favors the bold (or, in this case, the man with a few two many daquiri's in his system).  We shared a few drinks over thoughtful conversation, despite the boisterous ensemble of young people clamoring for attention all around us. And after a time, we left, and stepped into the quiet night to wait for an Uber. Hakuna Matata

1XANyLruTMqMCYelC8qBig.review_text: I definitely liked the feel of Lion Pub- it wasn't too small, and there were enough chairs and tables to go around. We met up with a group of college friends on a Friday night around 10:30 and were able to find seats right away. We did ask the staff to turn the fireplace off...probably great in winter but it was a really warm night.  As for drinks, I went with a $5.50 screwdriver because I need the rest of my ten dollar bill for the taxi home....too bad I couldn't get a mojito. Anyway, it was ok...for sure used cheap vodka (I didn't see the bottle but I know it was less than Smirnoff quality) but for $5.50 it was fine.

PNrp5hUB1wN7djkS8M6fnw.review_text: It's Wednesday and I think I'm just going to meet up with a couple girlfriends for a drink or two at my friendly neighborhood hideout, but as is the case every time I come to Lion's Pub, I am wrong. So wrong.   Once the greyhounds start flowing, it's all over. The next thing I know, it's 6am and I'm driving to work with what seems like a bottle of vodka still in my bloodstream. I'll spare you the rest of the gory details.  Ok you get the point. Drinks are pricey, but man are they strong, oh and delicious... come any day of the week and it will be packed by 10, mostly with 20-something guys. Douchebags? Maybe. That's what beer goggles are for.

lxhoW93Liu--hWiT0jPiwQ.review_text: Awesome drinks! Names like screwhound, greyhound, and bloodhound.   Fresh squeezed juice is amazing.

veqqcf1hjdsB7ZPIs8kHzw.review_text: This place get's 5 stars because I have frequented it so much it feels like home. My co-workers and I come here because it's close to work; but I first came here because I went to LMU and we had a Lion's Den and Lion's Pub so I had to check it out! There is a fire place and SO MUCH seating.  So it's great for groups for any sort of celebration. The bartenders are really friendly and make great drinks.  They have fresh fruit to squeeze and infuse and meddle into the best things you've ever tasted.  Drinks are about $8-$10 but the Quality makes them WORTH IT.  My favorites are the Lemon Drop Martinis with various fresh fruits and sugar on the rim (i like sweet) but they also make fantastic Mojitos (omg cucumber and/or basil?!) and Gimlets.  Drink names are fun and silly and once again, the bartenders love to describe them to you. Sometimes there is free cheese and crackers. It can get crowded Thursday-Saturday. Big Perk? They have a tiny TV but earned my heart for always playing the Giants games.

mxSrfNcdvby9Et_GSLuMAg.review_text: I used to make fun of the drunk girls clustered around the remnants of the cheese table at 1 AM...and then one morning after a night at the Lion Pub, I woke up to find some crumbs and a Ritz cracker nestled inside my pocket.  I'm blaming the greyhounds.

4wooaHkthPXYPektXIPkBg.review_text: Like a few people mentioned, the greyhounds are yummy. I am a sucker for fresh fruit in my drinks with top shelf vodka. Also, sometimes if you order a few in a row they will give you a free one - but not mention it, just make it free. So that is nice, a little awkward the first time since I was like "um, here is money" and the bartender just walked away, but nice.  If I was in the neighborhood I would stop in, but wont likely make a trip out for it.

UDDAYVY1Iif10lpogHB_SQ.review_text: Oh MAN have I found my new little secret place!!!! My mouth is definitely happy! All I can say is FRESH SQUEEZED JUICE AND FRESH CUT FRUIT! I think I'm in heaven. Mind you, this review COMES from a bartender, and a DAMN picky one at that!  Ordered a watermelon margarita. I got freshly muddled watermelon chunks, fresh press of OJ, fresh price of lime with a HEALTHY dose of Cazadores. JEEZZZUUUSSS!!! Can't wait to try one of their mojitos! And I fully appreciate every once of muddling energy that goes into one of these bad boys!  There's even a little cheese spread to enjoy for the public..for free!?!?! What?!?!?! Oh right, I'm in Pac Heights! :) Hhahaa...nonetheless, scores extra points on my Yummerz scale for that one!  Bartenders are cute..and more importantly friendly and can make some DRINKS! I dunno about the crowd, but I'm not there for them.   Did I mention that they've got an awesomely cozy fireplace? It's way dope! The decor definite makes it memorable in a horridly cheezy sorta way...but cool funky nonetheless.   It's the perfect place to get lost in!!!  FIVE Yummerz stars from me!!! Will be back...REEEALLLL soon!

ml3vS1NZTMeXTuxamvAZgw.review_text: Drinks . . . . . . . . . . could be better  (try stuffing a little MORE ice into my small glass). Price . . . . .  . . . . .  typical Bar Layout . . . . . . TERRIBLE.   This is a difficult place to get around in.  If its peak bar hours, I would generally avoid this place.  If your with good friends its not too painful.

DDwuwjZHsTmN7-Fju7D1qw.review_text: Okay, to be fair, I visited on a Wednesday evening at 5 PM - my bad. So, it was dark as heck in the place, so-so techno-bullshit tunes playing, loud fans blowing air...setting up for a BIG fail, right? Whoa, not so quick! The Lion had nice Speakeasy Big Daddy IPA on tap and it turned out to be a good place to chill for an hour. Despite the one drunk/chatty chick ordering shots, I kinda liked the place. Would I like it on a crowded evening? Probably not, but tonight it was okay. 3.1 stars.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: This is a favorite hang out place of my friend Shana. (since she lives so close to it)  Thank God that it is only a 5 minute walk from CPMC, we could just go here for happy hour after work...believe me, sometimes, Shana and I don't only deserve it, but we need it to stay sane!  I loved their strawberry mango mojitos, with its chunks of yummy strawberries and just the right amount of rum. They also have free (hello: FREE!) cheese and crackers set-up on one side of the bar.   Perfect place to unwind, especially with the cozy seating around the fireplace.

s6-kSU44dU3wSikEpwSf9w.review_text: 5 stars worthy because they make their drinks with fresh fruits and serve cheese and crackers for free!  The noise level is pretty loud and it gets pretty crowded on the weekends.  The drinks are very reasonable, but it is cash only.    Best greyhounds in town!

8BpJUrRCezI98_gKZWFZmQ.review_text: i like this spot.  it's tucked away and looks completely non-bar ish from the outside.  inside is a comfy space full of greenery and those lights that make you look good to others even without the aid of alcohol.  definitely order a fresh fruit drink and don't feel bad when the bartender has to use some muscle in mashing your fruit.  the fireplace in the back makes for a cozy spot, adding even more allure if the light (see above) isn't quite doing it.

TMWgq3KNRDaESXs8ZCrRtA.review_text: I've been here a few times.  Once I came with some friends and I'm not going to lie it was after a few other bars.  So that ocasion was not one I recall very well.    Second time was on a really ackward date so I remember it quite well.  Drinks are cheap.  Staff is friendly.  During happy hour I believe they have cheese and crackers FOR FREE!!!  I mean thats amazing.  I love "fern bars" they remind me of my dad and his friends and "Tales of the City".  I mean when they lived in the city in the 70s in the fern bar hay day.  I wish I was here then!  They're so relaxing and quaint and they bring you back to that era.  Good place for drinks with friends on any night.

uopaCM4Hb532C6AUkcGXPQ.review_text: This is my new "go-to" bar. Yes, they don't accept credit cards, yes it can get crowded and yes sometimes Mike Dunleavy (the guy who makes $9 Million dollars/year as a reserve for the Warriors and is super socially awkward) shows up every now and again - BUT, it's a freakin' awesome watering hole.  Get on the Bus, they Greyhound bus that is, because they have fresh grapefruit and you will never again order anything else. Mojitos also good (what kind of bartender OFFERS to but in more work by adding blue berries). This place is a good mix of people, and everyone always leaves wasted and happy. On Fridays, post up on the right end of the bar with a cutie bartender who helps you out. On Saturdays, the dude with glasses down there is an allstar.

BfPrx-qMPgbbhTPox6kMkg.review_text: The first time I came here, I was buzzing and off to my own la la land.  One of my friends bought me a shot, and from what I remembered -- it tasted unusual but in a good way.  I pounded the shot while all of my other guy friends were pounding theirs.  They kept yelling "Chuck Norris" the whole night.  ***  During a more recent visit, I went with the girls and told them that they had to try the "Chuck Norris" shot because it was "really good" I said.  I ordered a round for all of us and the bartender gave us a smirk.  When he asked, "You sure about that?", I was confused but confirmed my order anyway.  Little did I know that the shot I had the first night was NOT a Chuck Norris!  I had the Chocolate Cake shot -- which is 100% opposite.  Because of me, all of us had to drink up a shot of Jim Bean and a glass of light beer.  Disgusting, but funny.  But who cares?  Lion Pub is still awesome.  Their mojitos and cocktails are made with real fresh fruit, their theme makes me feel like I'm lost in a jungle, and I have fun every time.  Minor wishes: (1) Wish it was less of a college scene (2) Wish they accepted credit cards

CqJVkZYzNiPgOVaOB1bMdw.review_text: MOJITOS! Try em here.. your mouth will thank you. CHEESE.. try it after a few rounds of mojitos soooo good. I actually know people who stumble in here late night en route home for a quick drink and most importantly a late night meal (CHEESE). Your stomach wont thank you and in fact neither will your bed companion later in the night.. that is if you are lucky enough to have one. Crowd not so good.. but who cares as long as they have cheese and good mojitos who cares really?

BGHdDra4uLCpIqTLOorNRw.review_text: All i gotta say is free food on Friday and saturday nights...like brie and smoked salmon. Cool place, not such a great crowd, usually full of frat boys who have made the journey over the hill. Good for a happy hour drink or a mellow night, but wouldn't try to make a wild night out of it. Ladies, plan on getting harrassed, esp if you loiter outside. I have had way to many weird incidents with obnoxious guys at this place.

dkoeSCONcRx70c7WjRp3eg.review_text: We came here after a Saturday afternoon baseball game & were the only ones at the bar. The bartender, Christian, gave us his full attention and was incredibly friendly. The drinks were fun, fresh, and fruity! I love that they use real fruit in the drinks - freshly pressed, muddled, and squeezed. For the level of work that goes into the drinks the prices are considerably cheap (especially after an afternoon of $12 beers at AT&T park). We will definietly be back!

aZlvWxJYu1_JSLujaLqxOQ.review_text: AWESOME BAR. You can drink at the bar, play the meat-market game, dance on a table, or lounge in comfy chairs and talk to your friends -- all on the same night.. very intimate spot, always a fun crowd. Great drinks and no pretentiousness...

IWal1ziP1AlfcgDJj5CKFw.review_text: I'd give Lion Pub 3.5 stars if I could.  Specialty is fruits mashed into the drinks.  Had a couple including a mojito.  Fine and dandy.  We lucked out and got a table by hoovering and snagging one when some folks left.  OK crowd.  Kinda random.   No cover.  A bouncer but no troubles getting in.  If Lion Pub was a lolcats, it would say I can haz fruity drinks.

A13PPWcKAAc4L-GSH6OMiw.review_text: Great exterior decor/landscaping. Very intriguing. It was packed on a Saturday night with a young, hip crowd. Apparently the drinks are made only with fresh fruit. But thats makes me wonder if my cantalope passion fruit mojito actually had freshly squeezed passion fruit. Nevertheless it was delicious, $9, but delicious. And a definite star for the cute bartender. Bar is cash only (wah wah) but definitely a place to stop at and try a drink. I'm curious to see what happy hour is like without all the people.

rgLKap9rij7gyTDmJC-4zA.review_text: here's where i'm coming from with the three-star rating:  If i were rating:  just the service:  one star just the handmade fruity mojitos, greyhounds, margaritas, etc:  five stars (especially the greyhound and the gimlets) just the ambiance: two stars ambiance plus cheese plate: five stars typical crowd on a th/fri/sat night: three stars  this clearly lands me at a three star review.  The Lion Pub is always crowded, usually full of semi-douchebaggy marina types who don't want to go to the marina because they feel type cast so they stick to pac heights and hit up the lion pub, fish bowl, etc every weekend.  sometimes there are hot guys there. ALWAYS they are cougars in the making trying to hit on my boyfriend.  well.  they hit on my boyfriend when i had a boyfriend.  anyways.  moving on.  the drinks are F-ING AMAZING.  fresh squeezed juice anyone? the blackberry mojito....strawberry lemndrop (get it as a shot)....the fresh lime juice in their perfect gimlets...yum yum yum and PROPS to the owner for always having a semi sketchy cheese and cracker plate available.  Nothing like getting hammered and then dipping into a plate of cheese that's been available since 1975.  the bathrooms; however, are disgusting and there is only one for girls and one for boys.  not cool.  prices are expensive.  so all in all a pretty typical SF bar experience!  see ya there next weekend for a gimlet....and not this weekend only because i'm going to tahoe.

iP8b_foSaElGhhNg1G-N6Q.review_text: The owner of this joint Kelly is great! and always hook it up big time with the drinks. Maybe it's because he banks with us? But whatever it is...this bar is a great place to grab a few cocktails and chillax after work. They have GREAT mojitos made with real fruit...my favorite is their strawberry mango mojito sooo yummmyy. We never make it for happy hr here..but if the owner is here we don't have to...he'll extend it just for us. This place gets full really fast because it's tiny and the tables and chairs are kinda squished all together but is also which makes this place nice and cozy if u scored a table near the fireplace with the cushions. Parking is kinda difficult but not impossible. I tend to stay away from this place during the weekend because it gets REALLY packed where you can't even order and the crowd gets a little snobby with their cocktail dresses and their clutches tucked underneath their arms

-89IDABrt2vnhvoCiUlVCw.review_text: L-O-V-E!  It was my friend's birthday celebration, so he decided to have us meet him here. My boyfriend and I live in the area, and didn't understand what he was talking about when he said it was on the corner of Sacramento and Divis. It's a quiet little neighborhood... where was this rumoured "pub?"  We got to the top of the hill and heard some music. We looked to our right and saw what looked like a boarded-up Victorian home. "No way is this it!" We pushed the doors open and WOW! Disco ball, flashing pink lights, and some Britney?! Sold.    The bar space is huge, and there are tons of options written on the mirrors. I got a margarita, my boyfriend got a mint julep. I didn't realize the shots were served in full-sized glasses, so I took a swig of my margarita and was taken back. It was the first time I had ever sipped from a margarita glass, and let me just say: I have a new appreciation for a salty rim ;)  I am already trying to plan my next visit back. It was really easy to add tables to your group of friends, so the expansion possibilities are endless! Now if only there were more room to dance...

A6QxREcT6k2goutnVemBpA.review_text: mixture of yuppie douchebag bridge and tunnel heaven + skanky makeup-smeared HoBags

-JOOrjmmS8G9og93QROBFA.review_text: This place was so much fun! They had free appetizers and great music. Decor was kind of cheesy but it kind of works... We were quickly able to find a table and orders some drinks. I looked like it got pretty crowded later on in the night. We ordered several of their greyhound drinks w/fresh grapefruit juice - they were delish!

TMLVzNYs-zwwREudyvI08A.review_text: Ok, people.  Say it with me:  "Greeeeeeehhhhhheyheyheyheyheyheyhoowwwnnds."  Nice work.  Now, go ask all of your friends to spot you some money b/c you can't pay for the round b/c you don't carry cash, and this place doesn't take credit cards.

M0aIB-0yrginraKifvcCBA.review_text: Proceed with caution.  Those are the three most important words you need to know when drinking here.  Not in a bad way or anything.  Quite good, actually.  They have a list of drinks written behind the bar with names that have no bearing on what is included in them.  Or was it the wall?  It could have been a mirror, or a chalkboard, maybe. That I can't really remember - and for the most part, I remember things pretty well despite what my state of inebriation might suggest - should speak volumes about the potency of the drinks served here.  Anyway, the only solution is to just order them one by one and find out.    I almost never drink mixed drinks - it's almost always booze or beer.  One of my friends kept ordering rounds of Greyhounds, so down the hatch they went.  One.  After.  Another.  Yeah, so they're fruity... I was looking to get plastered and they got the job done.  Plus you can tell yourself that the fresh squeezed grapefruit juice is good for you.  Skip the beer and just order off the wall.  Side note: a friend of mine lost her phone and the bartender hung onto it for her the next day.  Pretty awesome and indicative of their service (the bartenders are awesome - attentive and fast).  The sole downside to this place: cash-only kinda sucks when you have to fight your way to the other side of the bar to use the ATM.

ZRvPkOOMp0pjM07ICKQswA.review_text: went here last night for the first time, for my friends bday.  it was definitely a mellow wednesday evening but we had so much fun ordering fresh squeezed greyhounds and all their fun shots!  the kobe bryant isn't the greatest tasting, but there is so much to choose from its overwhelming!   the selection of fresh fruit-squeezed cocktails is not only the great thing, there is a cheese n cracker bar too for those late night munchies!

2l9kaRFEX2w9MBL_lGzC5A.review_text: Awesome place. At night they roll out a great spread of free food (sushi, cheese and crackers). The drinks are pricey, but with all the free food, you just can't complain. Overall, fun place to go with a group of friends before you find a place that offers cheaper drinks. Oh, BTW they are cash only!!!

l2FP_ewP7kz5pNwXGeIcug.review_text: believe me, I know my mojitos, and this interesting-looking joint has about 5 pretty damn good flavours to choose from. happy to come back here

_n-kr9A6r7F_Pr4hv9yXtQ.review_text: I've never been here when it's busy (maybe because I drink at 8pm on a Monday...) but I always love the vibe of this place. Cozy and dark, warm and welcoming, with a great beer selection! (I like beer, okay??)  Tend to be some of the only people in there, though I'm sure it gets packed on the weekends since everybody knows we can't ALL fit in fishbowl...  Bartender was super nice AND super cute, let us play our own music and bought shots for the bar! No complaints there. Plus, SNACKS!!  Need I say more??

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I could see myself liking this place a lot if the crowd here was different.  I've just decided that the people in San Francisco are really weird in general, though.  Anyway, I don't really get it.  The place is set up with a a bunch of smaller tables to sit at, dim lighting for relaxing and having a good time with close friends.  I don't really see it as a kind of place where you go meet people... more of a place where you go and catch up with an old friend... which is what I was doing.  But for some reason, some guys still think it's okay to grind up behind me when I'm hugging my friend after not seeing her for a long time.  And then later when I'm VERY CLEARLY having a serious / private conversation with her, some other guys think it's okay to join in on our conversation that was, again, very clearly a private conversation.  Maybe I'm being a little tough because I was sober, but come on.  If I wanted to be hit on, I would've probably worn something more revealing and smiled more.  And probably go to a trashier place.  In light of all this, I really liked the staff and the bouncer.  They were all really sweet, and got my one drink pretty fast.  I ordered the Moscow Mule, which I thought was overpriced for the size and taste of it (a bit too sweet for me), but I would have liked to try some other drinks.  This place reminds me of a trashier version of Starlite in San Diego.    I think this place would be great on a less busier night when people aren't so trashed or trashy.  The drinks / ambiance / set up here just don't really match with some of the crowd.  If you're going to get trashed, why are you getting trashed off of nice drinks?  Go take shots at a dive bar.

quJ6c-0zWUTKkNUZRMpBag.review_text: fresh fruit ground into your glass, then filled with ice and then filled with alcohol. drool. i tried the watermelon vodka($8) and the canteloupe margarita($8). The watermelon vodka was to DIE FOR. Seriously, just watermelon - did you just hear that, fresh - and vodka. that's all. Very reasonably priced for what you get, nice bartenders, wasn't too crowded on a Thursday night.

61S4cCdpsNdMzLZ-uGf0yg.review_text: Fresh Fruit!  Order a screwdriver or greyhound.  Hell, order anything that might contain fruit juice and they will fresh squeeze it right into your drink!  It tastes a lot better than bottled, and this "gimmick" alone is worth going here for.  Throw in some comfortable neighborhood decor and you'll have a great time.  It can sometimes fill up with a yuppie marina type crowd but they tend to fade as the night goes on, and is minimized by its out of the way location.

3tJcTVPckkv7ZOrn1EcqPg.review_text: I'm pretty sure this place is called the Lion's Den, but whatevs.  Anyway, moving on, so many good points:  -  Fresh squeezed juices in the drinks -  An awesome cheese and cracker table -  A chill, low cielinged, plant dominated environment -  Huge plaster lions!  Just be careful, them tasty drinks is strong.

U6LgkUFWmmmfMTrzh5o6Nw.review_text: $5.50 for a freshly squeezed grapefruit and vodka drink? I wish I lived in SF and was an alcoholic.

KheemzNvPqrxDtOqdrOQ5g.review_text: After moving in down the street, I've decided to make this my new local bar. Their mojitos are ridiculous and their bar tenders are HOT. A pretty decent midweek crowd here and I love how small and dimly lit the interior is.

T1kRNW8UyZkcs1K1O0Gb_A.review_text: This spot is really hit or miss.  I was there on Friday an no joke the company makes the place.  From what I have been told this is the old neighborhood gay bar.  Cool, dig it, but all the people in there on a Friday happy Hr. were ladies giving my pal and I the stank eye.  Hello, we are super fun!!  Anyway, the bartender kept the drinks flowing and yes there was a whole spread put out.  Now had I been quicker on the up take, I would have had more than 3 crackers, and my Saturday would have been much better.  But in light of that, I would go back, yet if you are looking for a scene this is not the place.  It is a neighborhood bar, no joke.  Flats and houses on each side.

8526ZJhSR9CEX-vfjSFD-w.review_text: 4 stars for the mojitos. so freaking good! the strawberry is a yum. but the cantaloupe passion fruit... AMAZING!!    the place itself is a bit crammed. there's a bunch of seating if you can get a table. but if you're not sitting, your crammed somewhere else. also the ceiling is low, so you can't hear the music, just voices from everyone talking.    but i'd go back for the mojitos... oh and can't forget their cheese and cracker table. haha. nice to get a little cheese to munch on.

K1rJjAFm-FnRLqTmsHcing.review_text: The place feels like home, even when you're wasted and in a halloween costume

qthtyjV-1dHIApNHtWB40A.review_text: Lion's Den? Well apparently it's called Lion Pub.  You have to order grayhounds (vodka & grapefruit juice that they squeeze right there), they are delicious!   Great atmosphere & lots of tables!  I will definitely be going back soon!!!!!

wP_suL5hXCL6G8cG7fJVPw.review_text: Nice, unmarked local bar. It gets suuuper hopping late night, which isn't really my style, but if you can make it for happy hours (all week) you can get a super tasty cocktail, quick service, and a lovely environment. Cheers!

yfVbdcHTyb2N-2MI4Z9dGw.review_text: I'll give it a 5 for friendliness. Bar tenders have always been nice to me and have gotten me my drinks quickly. People I meet here tend to be friendly and well spoken. Upscale area, maybe that should give some people a clue.  A 5 for effectively lacking people who would criticize someone for wearing dress/work clothes to a bar. Or people who would criticize someone who would *gasp, dress up to go out! Omgz..  It's like me going to the mission and saying "oh man this place is terrible! everyone wears t-shirts! they don't even look like they've showered!"   - that... THAT... is pure asshatery.  I feel like there are more substantive reasons to criticize a place. The multiplicity of "striped shirts" reviews are a waste of time.

0DAJCCZcwsftU0gX5C0P7A.review_text: this place is pretty dope.  you got seating, you got cheese and crackers, oh and you got fresh squeeze citrus drinks.  what's not to like??

Bv-_z6wpJvBLyWHMzCSKzg.review_text: The interior of the bar is nice.  The drinks were pretty standard.  I know people go nuts over fresh juice in their drinks, but that is hardly unique in the Bay Area anymore.  On the weekend I went it was the Marina K-Fed look-alike contest apparently.  If you like to have your whale tail on display or if you want to sport your bleachy white baseball cap and hoodie this might be the place for you.

trBWOElHWgGQiD63LDhHlw.review_text: Happy Birthday to me!!!!!!! Some friends of mine that live in Pac took me out to the Lions Pub for my birthday. I had a great time, but.... full disclosure.... I was wasted.   The bright side? Cheese plate?!?!?  Free beer with purchase of any tequila?! Hand squeezed fruit for cocktails   The bad side....  Mixed crowd  Cheers,

4nUQy0CGdyCJubcFH9xHRw.review_text: Cheese spread, Greyhounds, and Cougars!  All I have to say.  I wish I still lived right around the corner so I could stumble home.

FuVHSOP8pT8DIxkukjjaUA.review_text: Anytime a bar has free food you have to check it out. They lost their best bartender when Mike left. To be honest  this place is just a bunch of popped collars and Marina trash.  Weekdays you might get an occasional cougar. AND watch out for a creepy walking cadaver!

9jpfKbCg4t2c80aNJ4Ix1g.review_text: Great to take my out of towner friends to, while still being 4 blocks walking distance from my house. And all of them loved it. The drinks are fruity as hell, but so fresh, even guys can't complain because they are yummy and they will sneak up on your ass. They play good music, have cheese/cracker plates to much on friday/saturday, and the bartenders are friendly and remember faces. Strawberry/mango and blueberry pineapple are my hands down favorites. The decor is cheesy as hell, but is super fun in a tropical tiki way. CASH ONLY.  Yeah the crowd is sometimes really mixed and sometimes odd, but some people really hate on it!  It has good drinks at an average price and fun scenery? its okay by me, I don't need to talk to anyone.

vF-UDqkCAozh9YRaJRWy9w.review_text: Strawberry & Mango Mojito & FIREPLACE (for those that like a cozy fireplace *wink*..*wink*)!  Parking is kinda tough, though...

ljN6jyPQc132ccQz5hSRQQ.review_text: I stopped coming here after I turned 21, but this was THE place to go to get my underage drink on in SF before I lived here. They made the stiffest long islands and they always had the gubbalicious snack spread. Now that I have a choice, I would choose 100 places before coming back here but I still hold you dear to my heart, Lions Pub.

1fN43CYscPf_dB_3cEwzvQ.review_text: Nice little cozy bar.  It is the most foliage (real and fake) covered bar that I have been in, but adds to the comfortable atmosphere.  On cold nights, the fireplace is great to sip a few freshly squeezed cocktails.  The music is decent and pluses for the complimentary cheese and crackers.  Definitely a gay draw to the bar - have seen that it used to be a gay bar.  Come to think of it - I don't think that Robin William's character from Birdcage would be out of place at this bar.  I have always enjoyed my time at this bar.  It's a little out of the way, but when in the neighborhood, it's worthwhile to stop for a few drinks.

H4g9fbbMB9BVfbUDGSeTcA.review_text: After visiting the Lion Pub my friends and I were forced to determine the term for a male cougar.  The decision.....bobcat.   yummy strawberry mojitos though.

05_9qfrcKCGyMaTbXu9cGw.review_text: This is your typical SF bar. We came here on my girlfriends' birthday with a big group specifically in search of the alleged cheeses and appetizers the ladies' had found upon their previous experience. To our disappointment the bartender told us that the tradition was no more. Yet, despite this let down, the drinks were great.... actually they may have been the best drinks I've enjoyed in sf! Exotic and unique. My personal favorite: the VODKA SALAD--a fusion of cucumber, basil, vodka. YUM :)

TRpI4fgC5SAZzjKV2iRSMQ.review_text: This bar is a great neighborhood spot that often gets overrun by bridge and tunnelers. It gets a little hot and crowded at times but is still one of my favorite bars in the city. The owner is a sweet man who is often there for a drink and the bartenders and really sweet too.  The big downside is it is cash only, but they do have an ATM in the back.,

HZbl3_RJ23maBIhBKEY_Qg.review_text: This is a good spot when you are looking for a relaxed and loungy - but not trendy or divey - place to grab a drink with friends.  Their mojitos are excellent with big chunks of fresh fruit and mint.  The prices are a little steep but they do have complimentary snacks so I guess that helps.    Its a good place to go on a cold SF evening, as their fire place makes it warm and toasty.

oAz4s21FA2QjE0kCNIDxOg.review_text: So my oldest sister was in town a while back, and she hasn't really been "out on the town" for a while (married with an 8 year old daughter), so I decided that Lion Pub was her speed. I kept telling her that I someone was going to hit on her, and about 20 minutes into our visit to Lion Pub, some European dude that looked like Fabio had bought her a glass of champagne and was chatting her up. Score for big sis! Too bad he wasn't hotter.  Anywho, Lion Pub does, as I established, have a pretty weird crowd, and the atmosphere is so-so. However, their drinks are excellent...they hand squeeze all of their juices, and make a killer watermelon mojito.  And if you're looking for a dude to hit on you 39 year old sister, this is the place.

O2qAlgUHKft3Lm-hPqO7rA.review_text: I went here with my best friend on a Tuesday to celebrate being promoted. The bartenders were very friendly and the laid-back atmosphere was was perfect for conversation. We snagged a table in the cozy bar and chatted for hours. The bartenders ended up hanging out with us after their shifts ended and they even bought us celebratory drinks!  Skip ahead to 10pm. Free food was placed out and I was in heaven. I must have eaten my weight in cheese and shrimp, and I don't regret it a bit. Overall, this was a fantastic way to celebrate my promotion, and I can't wait to return!

KUcXU40pk1TftQ4J5hOnZw.review_text: Interesting neighborhood bar. The entrance was a little deceiving because the main door is actually around the corner. The bar has their menu written on the mirror wall behind the bar. It was a bit overwhelming at first but every drink is categorized in sections.  Greyhound ($7) - freshly squeeze grapefruit juice with vodka. This was pretty cool because they just grab a grapefruit half and squeeze it right into the glass. I liked this so much that I got a second.  Their special of the night was the Pisco Fig. I like pisco sours and this was also a hit. There was a fig smash right into the drink. Very figgy taste.  Their drinks are pretty stiff here. They accept cash only. Music was great (old school hip-hop).

m792BbpHzcHIMceUlrBccg.review_text: Service was slow but mojitos were excellent. Wasn't much of a crowd but those that were there were fun and the dark ambiance was nice. I will be coming back.

Ay1mMAWKBrwndn5b8vRP8g.review_text: Good music, good ambiance, packed on Thursdays and Fridays. Highly recommend it. The best Gray hounds in town. This place is like Jumbo-ahol Jumba Juice with alcohol. Lovely.

aJCjOAGLAsA4vJ26Mc99tg.review_text: The ONLY thing you should ever order here is the Greyhound. Absolutely amazing drink.   Ice? Good Grapefruit ? Good Vodka? Gooooooood  Best recipe to an amazing cocktail.  I love this place. Perhaps my favorite bar in Lower Pac. The waitress's may not be as hot as Harries but the Drinks sure are better.  Big Ups to The Lion

nupL64WzTUOu6n8PwCKf3A.review_text: I really enjoy the Lion's Pub, although I am not totally fanatical about it so it doesn't get five stars. A cash only establishment, they make incredible cocktails and mojitos. Anything with juice in it is pretty much destined to be solid as they do fresh squeezed juice in everything. They have a long menu of shots, but I'd go for their cantaloupe mojito that has big fruit chunks in it or one of their greyhounds. The crowd is mostly 20s and early 30s, some yuppies but nothing compared to the Marina, and its pretty packed on weekends so I can never find a place to sit, but its cool because you end up squished in with random people and its easy to make new friends. All in all, I'm definitely a fan and its one of my few go-to bars in the city with a group of friends.

6HEyiSBJASZOLyCYaOiJ9Q.review_text: One star is to many. If you like frat-boys who all they want to do is pick a fight or harass your girlfriend then this is the place. I live nearby and on Thursday-Saturday you can hear loud mouth drunks until closing time. Also one of their drunken patrons smashed my window of my car to steal stuff.

lqYKaQnnlvnEtCJ-XETp9A.review_text: Lion's Pub can be a hard place to find if you've never been before. It doesn't really have any signs to let you know ,"Hey come inside for a good drink!"  This a good place that you can get a variety of fresh fruit mojitos made. Plenty of fruit and no holding off on the alcohol either. It also helps that there's a good cheese spread in the back with crackers. As for regular mixed drinks, not weak here at all either. It's a good place to go if you have a group of people, just make sure you get there before it gets too crowded or you'll be left with standing room near the bar.  A good place to stop off, unwind and have a good time. =)

swz3xh7FW-_jLOmuaR2_BA.review_text: Their cocktails are really good. Creative and Friendly taste... I like their Cheese and Cracker Bar.  I didn't see that much of mix poeple there though.

BbjT5pj4YbU9r4OLD1RYsg.review_text: Whoa, I just had a flashback to my college days in Boulder. Packed bar, everyone on the prowl, stiff drinks... ah, the days of yore. There are free snacks, which quite frankly can be dangerous when you've been drinking. It doesn't look like any of the girls who patronize the place actually eat anyway, so I guess they're in the clear. Anyway, if you can't afford to turn on your heat you could always go here; there are so many people packed into such a tight space you're sure to be warm.

thgb3xy8GgNvUcQJltwkXQ.review_text: We were traveling from New England and stopped here for a later happy hour on a Friday. The bartender was great, and helpful with suggestions. The drinks were amazing!! I had a watermelon jalapeño margarita and strawberry basil mojito- freshly squeezed juices... Delicious!

OlCeIZWcoztD-SyzzujPWg.review_text: Jason is the man! He was hooking it up with amazing, freshly squeezed drinks the whole time, they were so delicious. Great crowd and great vibe. Awesome neighborhood right there with some more cool bars and restaurants in the immediate area.

ym6lisvhlI9UrE5JSoXQ8w.review_text: The bartenders are masters and they give decent pointers on the wine as well. The free food adds a nice accent to the evening as does the warm cozy fireplace. I like to sip champagne in front of the fireplace and pretend I'm in the library of some old mansion.... where of course you sip champagne in front of the fireplace and read a smart old novel which has that bookish smell to it.   The seating is good for conversation. They only take cash and you'd think you could easily get a cab off divis but no you really can't ...so 4 stars it is.

POII61f173-yVs3qmmQoPw.review_text: I like sweet & fruity drinks, therefore I like Lion Pub.  Even if you're a male, you won't run the risk of appearing effeminate sipping on one of their fruit cocktails.  It's not sickeningly sweet and girly.  They use real freshly squeezed juice in their concoctions - the pulp proves it.  The Greyhound is light and refreshing with bits of grapefruit pulp floating around.  Also had some Watermelon vodka drink with lots of watermelon chunks at the bottom.  Kind of deadly because one could easily down a lot of these at once.  Pretty cool if you can get the table in front of the fireplace.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Here's what you're going to get at Lion Pub: -a damn good mojito -huge (somewhat douchey) crowds on the weekends -free cheese! Clearly a great cocktail and free snacks win out every time, right?  Look, we all know that most bars suck on the weekends but don't hold that against Lion Pub.  Do yourself a favor and go during the week or early on a Saturday night, grab yourself a mojito and a seat in front of the fireplace and enjoy.

kkPeKKul6stHZn6sRFuhEQ.review_text: Try the greyhound.. fresh squeezed grapefruit juice is aparantly supposed to be good for the hangover.. or is it? The free appetizers are a nice treat.

A-q5Rz4z7k6Kafos0Vx96w.review_text: I really really really like this bar. It doesn't feel like a bar, but more like a jungle safari with drinks. Well no, but once you see the decor you understand.  This place is fabulous! There drinks come with fresh squeezed fruit juice and the prices are very reasonable. I highly suggest getting the Greyhound (excellent), or a mojito (another good one!). They usually have a cheese and crackers station set up but after a while you start to question how long has that cheese been out and do I really want to risk it over a piece of cheese. There are tons of places to sit as well as stand but it does get crowded so you may have to battle for a chair. The surrounding mirrors make the place bigger than what it really is, which I smart and deceiving. You get used to it, and with the laid back atmosphere, I am more concerned about what I am drinking over running into walls.

LahgT0Dec0B6NSws7VHiJQ.review_text: I lied, and I'm sorry. There was a time in my life when I stated the Tunnel Top* had the best Mojito in the city, but upon my recent visit to Lion's Pub I have changed my mind. Admittedly, I am more of a beer guy...but I've been known to get a little foo-foo at times and enjoy a Mojito or two. Hell, I'll even wear tights & a mask if the occasion is right. The Strawberry Mojito at this joint is made with fresh EVERYTHING, and you can taste just how awesome it is... They also make a mean-ass Greyhound, with freshly squeezed Grapefruit Juice--prices are a little high on the specialty drinks though. I've heard stories about this place and the overwhelming amount of weekend douchebaggary, which leads me to believe if you want a decent time at this spot you should simply visit them during the week. Here's to foo-foo drinks & Mike the kickass curly-haired bartender...Rosie F and I thought he was top notch. *yelp.com/biz/snDFfHqX65-…

WUOURRbJhrPAKUA5pOAZEw.review_text: The Lion Pub, my sweet hidden gem. Literally, the building is covered in vines, have someone point you there if you can't see it.   Call me vain, but I love a big mirror at the bar so I can check myself out and I slowly drift into inebriation. On this big mirror behind the bartenders juicing and muddling fresh herbs and fruit, they've written their own little drink menu in dry erase (I assume) markers. They have all their different mojitos and a list of shots and drop shots that YOU MUST TRY.   If I remember correctly, the Chuck Norris is the grossest one of all: a shot of bourbon dropped into a half pint of Bud Light. IS THIS LEGAL?   I did one once, but only after the bartender assured me that 2x in the past, patrons have tried to drink it and vomited back into the glass. But hey, I'm a risk taker like that.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: 3.5 stars.  Not sure why I keep thinking this place is called Lion's Den. Pub. Pub. Lion PUB.   Anyhow, I stumbled here on a Friday evening after a work HH with some co-workers. It was packed by the time we got there. Very interestingly narrow space. If it were shaped more like a square you could probably socialize with people better without feeling too crammed.  The price of the drinks are decent -- around $9 for a strawberry mojito. Lots of young people hang here. Overall it's fun, good music.

Su8-7xh0iNbRgvnzg6piZQ.review_text: Great little local bar, looks like a house on the outside but has a great dark vibe on the inside. Killer cocktails, gets pretty weird Friday and Saturday night. Last time I was there I had my first (and last) "Charlie Sheen" drink.

c4iie1PzgE9ggmS1VpigAA.review_text: it's my neighborhood bar which is a plus, when it's not too douchy.  Their fresh squeezed juices REALLY make the drinks fantastic.  Love the screwhounds and the watermelon vodkas.  Good music and good drinks.  If you're not into the douche scene try to go on the off nights or go early.  I've been wanting to try their happy hour, but i can't quite tell what it is.  If you like fruit drinks, you've gotta try this place.  Especially the seasonal fruit.

U1R5x4SpCybNTkUGec5-AQ.review_text: 5 stars for the chunks of cheese and baskets of crackers they put out! Free!

F01s5dK-Rit8g_SlSkJdTA.review_text: This place is PRETTY inside. Very tropical and jungley - but not cheesy like Disney-Tonga Lounge.  I have definitely walked in a few times and it has been completely empty - I think it was mid-week.   Cozy and cute. Loves it.

O2WfOgwdSxIl-4UkqY88dA.review_text: Just had a drink this eve at the Lion Pub.  I love the exterior look - very mysterious with no sign and the palms rock! But it's all so confusing! Is it a tropical oasis? No. There is a darn rock fireplace inside. Meshed with rattan chairs and tables. Hmmm.  They need to bring the lion statutes to the forefront by the way. Maybe they kept them to the side to prevent moronic drunks like my friend from straddling them and playing Jane of the Jungle. Whatever, it was a cool place to chill mid-week and have a drink. Low key with w disco ball spinning the light in the room.  I'll have to check it out on a weekend as I am sure its packed. Nice to see a lot of 30+s out there tonight!!

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: They have fresh-squeezed fruit juices, so order something like a Greyhound. The bar is always lively enough to elevate it out of just-for-locals status, and the fireplace and complimentary cheese and crackers (during happy hour)are added attractions.

buDSnVubyjxGRFPYKadrrQ.review_text: I've been frequenting this place lately, in no small part because my friend knows the bartender and hooks us up with discounted greyhounds, which are the only greyhounds I drink in SF.   This place definitely passes my kitsch test -- how could it not with the lion statues, Tonga Room decor, cheese spread and disco ball? It's disjointed, but somehow it works.   And for those brave men able to handle the large crowds and hot air on the weekend, they're likely to find no shortage of attractive and frisky females here. One young cutie here grabbed my ass as I was walking past her last weekend, and we hung out for an hour. Now THAT'S a friendly bar!  This place strikes me as a less-pretentious Marina bar, and as long as my ass gets grabbed and the greyhounds pour, I'll be coming back.

ZKlOnMidHbjqmCaeb5utyw.review_text: awesome bar!  we found it via yelp (new to the area and needed to celebrate) and we weren't disappointed.    awesome doorman? check  the fresh squeezed juices and something called a basil greyhound? check cheese platter? check cute bartenders? check reasonable prices? check drunk frat types with trust funds and/or newfound money? check awesome, cozy decor? check cash only? dar.  all in all, a great place and i can't wait to go back.

HWTOELslgXUrsgMOj9T9oA.review_text: This pretty place is pretty sweet.   From the outside it looks like you are about to travel into the Amazon, and I like that. Its exotic. Inside looks like a 70s porno mixed with a jungle theme. I like that too. There is a ton of seating, and even with a packed bar my friends and I had 0 problem finding a table to accommodate 4 people.   The drinks are sweet, its cool that they mix it with fruit right in front of you. I had some watermelon/vodka concoction, and it had chunks of watermelon, which I really was into. The drinks are strong, which is how I like them. Also they have a free cheese and cracker table, which is amazing while intoxicated. My friends and I raided that many times, with little to no shame at all. I wish more bars did that.  The draw backs, cash only!

8jnfZIQnfDJ1gKdWT8VVWA.review_text: i love lion's pub/den. although their happy hour specials are nothing spectacular (mondays and tuesdays are the best nights), and their drinks can be pricey, i will keep coming back! the raspberry mojitos are amazing. their beer selection is okay! the fireplace and many tables ROCK! my friends work all over the city, so it's central location makes it an awesome happy hour meeting place. i also enjoy the cheese spread that comes out at 7pm (sometimes earlier if you ask the bartender) and their indie rock tunes. please note; i would never go here on weekends.

AYPeuEr4esJ8FvoPipLEMQ.review_text: amazing drinks - so fresh! they take a whole grapefruit and cut it in half right in front of you then put it in the juicer for a fresh fruit cocktail! you feel so healthy drinking it! also great atmosphere and young crowd. seats to sit plus bar to stand. good for everyone.

zejhY7mSVWETy51MUpLJ1g.review_text: Yummy, yummy pineapple-blueberry mojitos!  Yes, I know that might sound like a strange combination, but it sure is tasty...and the fresh fruit rocks!  Oh, and it beats the raspberry mojitos at Solstice!  Nice after work spot (mellow), but can be uncomfortably crowded on the weekends.

ayDJwiqty-u3PJ4q6REVIw.review_text: cool fireplace (great for those cold days, i bet). interesting palm-like leaves. lots of flexible seating. great for groups like that. free hors d'oeurves after 10pm! mouth-watering seasonal cocktails (strawberry mango mojito, watermelon vodka, blueberry mojito, YUM!) very diverse crowd. friendly bartenders who do not discriminantly serve.  beware - CASH only!  [that's as much as my brain can come up with the morning after a few too many watermelon vodkas!]

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: the first time i came here i thought this place was a surefire 5.  i have been back once since then, and now i'm feelin' one star less.  they keep a table of food out for patrons, which is pretty cool. granted it's not the best food in the world (cheese, veggies, etc) not many places give anything. the drinks are made with fresh squeezed fruit, which is pretty snazzy as well.
