WRSVf-0vgbEGlF2DU8JAZg.review_text: I like going to the Lion's Pub. The atmosphere is pretty cool. The crowd for the most part is good. The bartenders are attractive and provide good service. Not to mention, the drinks are excellent. The mojitios and the greyhounds are made with fresh fruit right at the bar. They are known for their greyhounds, but I would definitely recommend you try their mojitos. Plus, they have gourmet cheese and crackers out to snack on for free :)  On the downside the drinks can get pricey and sometimes the bar can get very crowded almost claustrophobic. Overall though, I really like going to the Lion's Pub. I would recommend going there on a Friday/Saturday night.

J7fmfD8q5v64eAmHE4dI6w.review_text: Decent Bar.  The crowd is like mid 20's to mid-30s.  The mixed drinks are very yummy - all are made with fresh fruits.  I love the strawberry lemon drop martini.  I am not usually the type of gal to get a fruity cocktail.  I usually go for wine or beer, but this is the place where I am willing to make an exception. It's very crowded on Friday/Saturday, but a crowded bar makes for a fun atmosphere here.  If you are particular about bathrooms, this place only has one for girls.  There's almost always a line, so don't hold it until the very last second.  Overall, I like this place and I recommend it to anyone who wants good drinks and a fun atmosphere.

1NB9LAg_Z_NfRvKwcNSbWQ.review_text: Oooo, me likie. Anyplace with a disco ball is automatically a five star. The Lion Pub is classy, and not only because of their loud tunes, hot people and stellar location, but they make the best citrus drinks in town. No really. Have you tried their mojito? These guys go-to-work on your drink, crushing the mint and pinapple and strawberries with avengance. 8.50 later you are throwing one back (but make sure to bring your cash, cause this place won't deal with plastic).

uXSVu2ldBncOGMcvI9SW2Q.review_text: Three words- strawberry mango mojito. Three more words- cantaloupe passion-fruit mojito.  Heaven in a glass. Free food and seating? The nearly perfect bar. One star knocked off for being cash only and since my beloved mojitos are $9 a pop, it adds up.

hppHpQlhXmMexAKgAA0Nfw.review_text: This place is fun and really busy on a Friday night. They have really yummy drinks I must say! I had the raspberry mojito and it was fresh and really good- kinda dangerous.   The feel of the place is kinda tikki room at Disneyland. And there is a distinct smell to the place, kinda pine treeish.   Great bouncer he was such a sweet guy!

KBfCzD23iXLDyWajMpSHvw.review_text: So, I think this place is pretty cool!   They make there own fresh squeezed juices, with your cocktails!   I had the bloodhound-which was pretty tasty. It was really "orangy."  I had something with peaches and vodka. Fresh squeezed peach juice, AND real chopped up peaches. Yum! (My fav. drink for the night!) And I had something called the trade winds...or something like that... Which was made with rum and real lime juice. And of course, real lime pieces. It tasted like limeade or something, lol.    And each drink was no more than, $7-$9 a piece. Not bad!!!

swhjg4DOaRH6b627iSISHQ.review_text: Its a great neighborhood bar where the shots are generous and you always feel loved. The bartenders are friendly and theres a spread with cheese and stuff. That has all been previously mentioned. Never had a problem with the crowd, people seem to be friendly and just so long as you don't ask for too much out of the bar this place is great.

1jbnGoG6w7EIVcj3jPlBOw.review_text: Fell in LOVE with their strawberry lemon drop... they use fresh fruit and there's cheese and crackers!  can't go wrong = P   The music was decent and it had a good atmosphere... would definitely go back

ht--3Gch2Ynq_KJaMGXnCw.review_text: How yummy are the greyhounds here? With fresh squeezed grapefruit juice too! I love the cozy fire place, the crowd and the free cheese platter!

LXP7tyBw9ySrTIQ_a4NZMw.review_text: Watermelon vodka = love. Soo freakin good, nice and strongggg! Love the fresh fruit juices they use in a lot of their drinks too. Nice ambience, pretty dark...good for dates. Me and the bf didn't know we were sitting next to the owner a few weeks back and he got us a round of drinks after talking to him for a few mins...super nice! Downside is cash only, but still love this place!

rQCkAEOa6krhBC2PJO7RDA.review_text: One of our favorite neighborhood haunts.  We decided to randomly walk here last night and our favorite bartender, John, was there and mixed a mean jalapeno margarita for my boyfriend...and remembered not to put salt on the glass.  We haven't been here in months and John remembered the way we like our drinks.  We grabbed our favorite spot by the fireplace, listened to some great music and thoroughly enjoyed the night.

DLsrlcMlCXYpTElqJ856-A.review_text: My cousin took me to this place for the first time and it was different. It's a pretty romantic ambience (did I spell that right?) oh well. Since it was soo dark the first thing I said to her was "this a place where you can take an ugly date" haha of course i was just kidding.   Anyways, the place is sort of hidden so it's either you know it's there or not. I was there pretty early in the day around 5ish so it wasn't that crowded. We didn't stay there too long but long enough to finish one of their fresh fruit mojitos. I got their cantaloupe passion fruit mojito and it was okay. The drink was a tad bit too tart and I couldn't really taste the canteloupe.   Last but not least, let me talk about the bathroom...let's just say I felt like a lion in a cave! It was soooo dark and no light switch. It was a little akward and there were no toilet seat covers so of course i had to do the squat and in dark!!..so not cool.   All in all, I would go back someday to try the rest of their fresh fruit drinks.  = )

-zuV9Du1HFHaQ6GnVyGWsQ.review_text: This place gets 4 stars from me because all the  are made with fresh fruit. They squeeze it right in front of you. Fresh Greyhounds are yummy (my favorites), but you can even go more crazy and get a fresh-squeezed blueberry  or a strawberry infused martini?   The Happy Hour food is not your standard run of the mill fare, but sushi, cheese/crackers/bread, smoked salmon, veggies....great when you forget to eat dinner on those nights out.   Cash only, which kind of sucks!

-qDiotF8Qd0ThdLNEpg9Aw.review_text: You could live 3 blocks from this place for a year and not know it existed. I should know, that's what I did. What gives this place the ultimate mystique? First of all, it inhabits the ground floor of what appears to be an average Pac Hts. Victorian. It's on Divis, sure, but it's a couple blocks removed from the bustle of the Fishbowl, Tortilla Hts. and Solstice. So you wouldn't expect to find it here. Next, there's practically no signage. And finally, the windows are concealed by towering fronds and other mutant houseplants, so there's scant evidence that anyone even lives here, let alone operates a bar here.   The Lion is the perfect weeknight bar. It fills up, but it feels kind of underground having a drink there for some reason. The place is dark and wooden, with mirrored walls and dependable bartenders. It's one of those quintessentially local bars that don't make you feel like you're there just to say you're there or want you to feel like you're part of the "in" crowd. Such trivialities have no place at the Lion Pub. Just good drinks, good friends and an easy drunken stumble back to your bed after close.

20oN_TBSfZwQfSvqMYhM3w.review_text: This is a great place to take a date during the early part of the week.  There is a fireplace, and plenty of tables to sit at.  The drinks aren't cheap, but they are tasty and have a nice amount of booze in them.  There is also a drink special on Tuesday, the night I was there, and I think Monday as well.

zAF6yw7Bz-U6fj8NXFa3gw.review_text: Aghh! Claustrophobia is not something I like to experience in a bar. After making headway through the blue button down shirt and khaki sea of guys, I finally got a drink (which was actually a good drink), then had to press my way through the sea of peeps to get to a table. It honestly took 10 minutes to walk 15 feet.  Not my crowd.  A few bonuses though: my husband got cougar cruised twice going to the bathroom, and we got to observe an extremely drunken gent playing fake golf outside the bar.

YBgoVgBt681vm2dZLUPN1Q.review_text: Ok, i'm mainly giving this place a 4 because of the FREE snacks they have there!  So today, we went into this cute pac heights bar and they have a bunch of free appetizers in the back.  We went straight to the back cuz we were super hungry w/o having eaten dinner and all.  They had 8 different kinds of cheese there!!  Mmmmm and crackers, and hummus, and smoked salmon.  Damn!  So we stocked up on the food and didnt really feel like drinking after.  Hahah, and then we left.  I have been here for drinks b4 too, and i remember the cosmo being good.  Anyway, I think normally I would give this place a 3 because of the absolute lack of diversity, which makes it only ok.  But the free yummy nice cheeses really bumped it up to a 4 for me, as in, I would definitely go back there :).

2feX-HoiFo0XAKemgKxlTw.review_text: I always thought this was called the Lion's Den. Huh. Anyways, they have the most amazing mo-jo-jo's (stawberry! mint! watermelon!) and the cheese and crackers during happy hour is great (although it gets pretty mangled looking towards the end). I came here on New Year's a few year's back, and they were selling some crappy bottle of champs for $25/ea. We had so many bottles on our table I felt like Jay-z.. Holla!

Fq0yXmkDooLkF9RGGSYTgw.review_text: Mojitos here are pure bliss!! It's hard to find althentic/ fresh cocktails places that don't cost a dent in the wallet for a weekend night out, but Lion Pub offers just that. Great Drinks at good value, it gets very hectic during weekend but usually we'd manage to find seats anyway.    Crowd is usually quite polite even if you have to fight through them to order the drinks againm.  Can't blame them for being popular at all!!

CDap0lATTsXsRzTe7HYK-g.review_text: Best greyhounds in town (vodka and grapefruit juice)! All of their cocktails are made with fresh squeezed juice which makes them heavenly! They have a legit mojito too.   There is usually a fun scene and a random cheese platter in the back for late night munching.

BtJ0LLoGIlQY1xzeMUz7SQ.review_text: Let the bartender make whatever they want, you'll get a better drink.  Get there early enough to set up by the fire.   Really mellow vibe with a distinct, snug ambiance.

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: OMG Lion Pub! How much do I like you? So much that I came both Friday and Saturday night this weekend. That's ridiculous. Thank you, thank you, thank you, handsome stranger who recommended this place! :)  When my friend and I walked up we weren't really sure what we were getting into. She was convinced we were going to barge in to someone's living room. Lion Pub has a tropical meets disco meets cozy feel to it. Weird description, I know, but this place rocks my socks.  Crowd seems to be rather eclectic- but certainly gets douchier as the weekend-night progresses. Bar tenders are friendly dudes who seem to really enjoy their jobs. (Except the one that has anger management issues- I'm not really sure what the exchange was between him and a customer, but it was not friendly.)  Drinks are reasonably priced ($6.50 for a Greyhound- and these are amazing here), $10 for a Raspberry Mojito. Love that everything is fresh squeezed!  Absolutely a go to spot from this point forward.

Ln0Q0eO_GQ8A8-zu8d_7Pw.review_text: This place is great because it's walking distance and looks like someone's mansion out of pacific heights but is really an awesome little place on the inside. I feel just at home, don't feel like I have to dress up much. Its not one of those "night out on the town" type places. Just a chill place to drink, eat cheese and relax by the fire.  The perks:   Strawberry Mango Mojito, fresh and with real crushed fruit (I'm Cuban, I know a good Mojito!) Free Cheese and Crakers! Warm and cozy fire Friendly Staff Used to be cougarville but not so much lately  The cons: Bad Poppy Music Steamy on Saturday evenings and can get quite crowdy Cash only! Mean Mean ATM machine in the back with a ridiculous operative fee.  4 p.m. and lonely? Head over here and have some cheese while you are at it.

J9H0Z2dTAtIrkLQBNpRDKA.review_text: decked out with plants on the outside, you wouldnt even know that its a happening bar inside.  real fruit in your drinks.  what more can i say?  the mojitos (mango, strawberry, etc) are addictive!!!  also try the crushed infused watermelon (kinda like a watermelon martinia).  it's spectacular.  just drooling thinking about it!!!  what gives it a 5 star rather than 4??? the FOOOOOOOOOOOOOD!  they have cheese, cheese, cheese and if you're lucky - even simple sushi!!!

Njr-4deTIXPvXfKHaXn_0A.review_text: Num Num Num Num Num  Tastiest drinks in town!  Order any sort of mojito here and I guarantee you, you will be one happy camper. I am a mojito FIEND, and after finally swooping in on the opportunity to go, I was nothing but happy sippin' on these fresh-squeezed tasty 'tails. And the even better part?? The muddled blackberry shots! My friends and I were so enamored w/ them we had 1 to kick things off, walked back to our tables in the back and immediately U-Turned it back to the bar for another. And then... followed up w/ another. And after waiting outside for the gang to head out, we went back for our last blackberry hurrah!   1 word: Addicted.  I've yet to try their complimentary cheese spread, but just the thought of it makes me love Lion's Pub even more.  If you come here, just know that it's more a place to hang than cut a rug.

UrNZX_VNtxdBa4NczA_zAw.review_text: The drinks here are great! I love the strawberry mojitos. The bartender are nice and Kelly, the owner, is an interesting and sweet man.   If you go there on Friday and Saturday, be prepared for a younger crowd. That can be a good or bad thing depending what you're looking for

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: $6 Pimme's! What a STEAL.   I love that the juices are fresh, but the mixologists are nothing like the ones at Bourbon or Burritt - drinks are less well balanced.  Oh, and don't get the "Vodka Salad." It literally tastes like a liquid salad with vodka.

nkN_do3fJ9xekchVC-v68A.review_text: My name is Jeremy, and I'm a strawberry mango mojitolic. Of the night spots in Pacific Heights this seems to be the most hopping. I like the drinks and they have a nice free cheese bar...if you don't mind eating man-handled cheese...but after a few mojitos who's thinking about that?

8DqQqPnWLMllH2Dd0bETtQ.review_text: I'll let you in on a little secret.  Most guys like girly drinks.  They  will never voluntarily order it or attempt to coax a girlfriend to get it for them, due to fear of ridicule and scrutiny from their friends all night long.  So what happens when you go to a bar that specializes in hand pump juicers and mixing it into their cocktails, a boy who surfed all day early that same day and was extremely dehydrated, and finally was able to order those drinks he for so long secretly desired?  ***************** Section was deemed inappropriate ********************* *** To small children, pregnant woman and small barn yard animals*** ************************* And removed from Yelp **************************  But let's rewind the evening where everything began, we did arrive early  Our evening started driving into Pacific Heights and coming a little early to find parking, we walked to the corner of Divs and Sacramento, I was initially not even sure where Lion's Pub was, we were walking on the border of a residential area and the Lion Pub looks almost nondescript, with ivy climbing onto the walls outside, and the entrance from the corner on the street is inaccessible, it almost looks like it is apart of the residential buildings that is above it, the main entrance is actually on Sacramento and is pretty subtle from the front, no bright neon lights or anything tacky facing the streets and later at night, and inside earlier on in the evening the place was very chill, easy to walk up and get an order of drinks, hit up the cheese and cracker bar and exchange laughs and bits of conversation with your friends.    We had arrived by about 8:00 on a Saturday for my buddy's birthday party, which would go into the later evening hours...  we were able to reserve a good section of the tables (about 6 that ran from the cheese bar to the ATM) which was a good thing, because within an hour and half this place blew up, it got very full of people, jamming up the routes to the bar, and stayed that way almost all night long.  Good thing the drinks were good and that we had a place to sit to relax and chat while we had our drinks.  So what I was told coming here was that this place has hand operate juice pumps and will extract a number of fresh fruits juices into our cocktails.  Now I did see that they had a number of beers on tap and a few other more traditional shots on the wall that you could order, but because it is something that they are known for I couldn't pass it up.  I was able to proudly order some of my fruit infused drinks from the bar with no weird looks and come back to table and enjoy them with no harassing comments from my friends.    Grey hound - Started out with this one, vodka went down smooth with the fresh grapefruit. Screw hound - Similar to a greyhound, but in addition to the grapefruit they crush it a orange too...  Pretty tasty. Mojito - Fresh mint muddled and lime made for a good drink, could have used a little more lime...   Pineapple blue berry mojito - This one was a little weird, I like blueberries and pineapples, just not together. Strawberry mango mojito - This one tasted like a meal, it was thick.  Very sweet.  But the mint worked well with it.  I am aware that these are fruity drinks, but I noticed if you have enough of it, you can still get pretty sloshed if you have enough of it.  Notice as time went on, I started fairly conservative and as night the wore on I progressed to sampling some of the other dirnks...  Only a few things of note that I didn't quite care for.  - Cash only and the ATM in the back charges you 2.25 to use it.   - Getting orders at the bar is like the people on the floor trading stocks with the market crashing.  Pure chaos. - The staff that walk around can be dicks and take your drinks away before you've finished them.  Twice I was sitting there telling him I'm not finished and while hes looking at me he is stacking it in another cup.  Damn it man is there a shortage of cups?  Still despite these few hiccups, I love how there is no dress code, no cover and no lines, especially if you come early.  So next time you have that urge to have some fruity drinks, no need to make them secretly behind the doors of your home away from prying eyes and make you way to the Pacific Heights and give this bar a try.  Oh and btw, resist the temptation to straddle the Lion in the bar, they frown on that there...

zNJKX5RXeaqGeS4rVIEAvw.review_text: I'd heard this place was known for great specialty cocktails but I'm 0-for-2 and will not be attempting a third time's a charm.

psHMFSnnIEqVkrz22-HCqw.review_text: I always tend to end up at Lion Pub whenever I'm gallivanting up in The City. A Thanksgiving trip home with the pseudo-boyfriend send us and our friends out and about to show the sites. Lion Pub was our only stop. A few stiff strawberry lemon drops and cantaloupe margaritas had us laughing and losing time. Cheese and crackers is a nice touch and definitely kept us from leaving for food. Good atmosphere, but, as usual in The City, crummy crummy parking.

m5B7oLeXWLJwTx16Re3h_Q.review_text: Great drinks and great staff.  The guys who work here are generally good-looking and eye candy is always nice, right ladies?  :)  The drinks are great - made with fresh fruit!  It can get really crowded, which is the only downside but it's usually a good ratio for women - more men than women.  Fun place to hang out and meet people and the music is always great too!

FzcxrgY_i7Hb4AtJBYB8Fg.review_text: drinks, ambiance, and most especially, music are top shelf here. sadly, it's brimming with douschebag patrons. I guess the trick is to go when no one else is there.   the cocktails are the bomb.  tip the bartenders well and you'll get fast service w a smile.

STe0UgkKX6DkmF_chajDog.review_text: I would like this to be the local bar for me until I find something better I suppose.  It's so close, and it's just so neatly tucked away.  We literally almost walked past it after a friend suggested we try it out.  I love the decor and inside everyone seemed to be really chill and enjoying their time.  There's a fireplace and table of cheese and crackers? I didn't partake but I will if someone okays it.  The music was a good mix, and there was plenty of room at the bar that night, which is always a plus for me.  I hate it when bars are too crowded.  The drinks are pretty tasty! Yes, they are fruity, but I'm not afraid to admit I like a fruity drink every now and then.  They were a little expensive though, but I haven't gone out much in SF yet, so maybe that's standard? Prove me wrong and tell me where to go if you know! The caipirinhas weren't as tasty as some places I've had, but the mojitos are awesome.  This place is cash bar only, and I'd go back.

puQjB58za9EMEAP_Y3rd5A.review_text: 5 stars:  This is a no-brainer.  They give you cheese...for free.  And they give you real fruit in your drinks...at no real extra charge.  I don't know about everyone else but I can think of a lot of things that a bar can give you that are not as pleasant and thoughtful.  For instance: *A wicked hangover... *The drunk shits... *Or how 'bout a lovely case of the clap if you go home with someone who's been around the block one too many times? *OR worse, a bar can even take away from you -- it could steal your ID, your purse/wallet and your cellphone while you're innocently getting blacked-out!  So how can I give Lion's Pub less than 5 stars when all it's giving me is the gift of cheese?

ymvrm2FstTIAe9r0bTlBMA.review_text: fresh squeezed fruity mixed drinks so good, you'll actually taste them even if you're eons beyond three sheets to the wind.

O96W92S732Iu18FKNM1Rfw.review_text: 3 stars at midnight. 4 stars at 9 p.m.  Early to the bars, that's how I roll baby. I don't know if it's my old age, but I really dislike when bars not only are standing room only, but when you gotta suck it in for fear that you're standing cheek to cheek with some random sweaty dude. (you know what cheeks I mean)  Lion Pub gets really crowded during the time normal people go out. Therefore I am less of fan. But during any other time I enjoy Lion Pub for:  ~ Their Tasty Mojitos, mmmmm ~ They're complimentary cheese table (when it's blocks of cheese, not crumbs likely picked over by the glazed over masses) ~ Their other drinks that I don't drink by my friends do. i.e. the greyhound and the burt reynolds  My only gripes are one time I think we lost our keys in this place. And their giant lion by the door isn't sturdy enough for people to ride on. And well, we've decided that this is the safe haven for when douches want to do up Pacific Heights, so sometimes there's your fair share of those guys. Maybe you're into those guys though, so there you go.

S2n6Av5Id6nExA9qyDwIPw.review_text: Great mixed drinks with fresh squeezed juices, can't go wrong. The also have heavy pours so don't worry about not getting enough liquor. The ambiance is a little weird, but the drinks and friendly staff make up for it

HF0YkO5b5JJDxEYTMC_cPw.review_text: Some friends and I ventured from SOMA into pac heights to meet up with some ladies who lived in the area.  We arrived at this non-descript locale at a reasonable hour, maybe 10:30, and joked with the friendly (albeit huge) bouncer as he carded us and then we were in.  Wasn't that crowded for a Saturday night, the 'buffet' was in its regular spot over by the fake palm tree to the left of the bar, and we managed to get a drink quickly.  Price wasn't bad, $6 for a jack&coke...I've paid more for less.  Met with the ladies and got a table next to some classic looking Pac Heights types (popped collars, sweater over the collared shirt, sideways Von Dutch hats, etc.).  We exchanged pleasantries when we first sat down and they kept it going (maybe b/c we were actually with women...who knows?), long story short one of these guys makes some unwanted sexual advances involving his balls and my friend's mouth.  This guy explained that it would be fun to take a picture and kept telling my friend to "open his mouth".    Friend: "Get back and get bent." Sideways Von Dutch hat looked sad and hurt by the remark.  Then proceed to scream "LET'S GO OUTSIDE" at our table for the next 30 minutes, while occasionally throwing balled up napkins at us.  Naturally, we started talking shit.  Here's the kicker, here's why I'm never setting foot in this wretched establishment EVER again.  My friends and I tried to squash this problem many times, but sideways Von Dutch hat wouldn't drop it...eventually a bar back came by and was clearing our table, we asked him if he could say a few words to the bouncer b/c the gentleman behind us would not shut it.  He told us we were "babies" and needed to "take it outside".    For a trendy, douche-infested bar in Pacific Heights, I was pretty shocked that this bartender wasn't THRILLED with us for alerting him of a potential violent scene erupting in his bar.  Instead, the bouncer comes over, and explains to US that we needed to "stop talking shit" and that he didn't have "time to fucking babysit " us.  So much for the good times we had with him on the way in.  We were getting ready to leave, when I saw the bouncer go over to sideways Von Dutch hat and give him some fist pound action...these guys were FRIENDS.  Just a terrible bar, with terrible food (even if it is free) full of terrible idiots (like sideways Von Dutch) who have connections with the staff that allow them to get away with acting like belligerent assholes.

XSZ3IaOAzem3kuYBfbhfuQ.review_text: I used to come to this place years ago with gay friends from work when it was a gay bar.  The drinks are definitely better than they were back then. The reason for the minus two stars in the decibel level in this place.  JFC when did women get so f'ing loud when they are drunk?  As guys we are totally obnoxious when we have had too many but "some" (by no means all) of these 20 something year old women need to shut the hell up.  I think I will leave this place for the 20 and 30 something year olds...

UJ6PbpekurMBe_Nc6-T0TQ.review_text: this is a one of a kind bar. Always a good time!

EjVRsZhNyG7vkCxVci7xHQ.review_text: Exuberant amounts of fresh fruit that is happily muddled with fresh mint and alcohol, can you say yum?...YUM!! The mojitos and margaritas are where it's at if you head to Lion Pub. I suggest the pomegranate margarita, a bit stronger than the mojitos and in a cuter glass.   This place gets jam-packed and it can be difficult to grab a table. Keep your eye out for the tables by the ATM in the back (they are not bad). The bartenders are nice here and will do pretty much any drink no matter how ridic you try to make it. Shooters are fun too. Ladies always get served first!   SPECIAL NOTE: one of the bartenders charged my friend for an extra Magners accidentally and 20mins later when he realized it, he walked over to our table and handed my friend the cash that was wrongly charged. Honesty is always appreciated and what a great surprise to our night. What else to do but celebrate with another round of drinks!   Be prepared: CASH ONLY, but there is an ATM in the back.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: In my treasure hunt for the best cocktails that the world has to offer, Lion Pub (though I thought it was called Lion's Den) is definitely some serious treasure! I love the strawberry mango mojito and all of the drinks with fresh fruit in them! A greyhound with fresh grapefruit juice? Wow! The cocktails are a little pricier than some other bars but you definitely get what you pay for here! You can always opt for a cheaper bottled beer if you need too also...  I love the jungle-like decor and the big table near the fireplace. I also enjoy the spread of (slightly stale) foods. It's probably pretty sketchy to eat spinach dip at a bar with tons of strangers, but that never seems to stop me... there is also often cheese and crackers, veggies, etc.   Lion Den is definitely gold: delicious cocktails, free food, fun crowd, and great decor!

0J6h-N-7KXMcMb7pL2lJmw.review_text: 5 star for nice drink selection. But the bartenders and happy hour specials are nothing to rave about. Atmosphere nice enough.

5n_dkk0dEHFSNIJN5AMmvw.review_text: Excellent spot, although my memory of that Friday night is kinda hazy. We started with shochu and beer in Japantown, almost got into a bar fight at SFAC with some douchey bros, and managed to settle in here for a more chill vibe.  Their infamous greyhounds: freshly squeezed grapefruit is a nice touch, and the bartenders are not stingy in their pours. In fact, vodka with a splash of grapefruit juice is more apropos.  Overall, a very cool spot to commiserate over good drinks.

VYd409xPNzlzPf6nTWuAdw.review_text: Based on a single visit, Lion Pub appears to be a good place to pick up average looking girls in their early 30's.  Despite the almost complete lack of urine smell there's still something creepy about this place.  I'd be more likely to visit regularly if I lived in the immediate neighborhood.

hkOiI-ctPYFuurzJZF6H9Q.review_text: Fresh fruit in the drinks and free cheese and crackers make your stomach happy... the location on sacto and divis make your feet happy... and the pull of the bar that brings in marina peeps with good taste, stanford gsb'ers who have friends in the city, and folks from the haight who are tired of the contact high makes your eyes happy...

l0rgSl1kKnQf6e2HRUbpgg.review_text: I like it.  Partly because people call it so many different names: Lion Pub, Lion's Den, Lion Bar, etc.  I guess it's actually called Lion Pub.  Now I know.  Anyway, their drinks are good, free snacks, fun atmosphere.  One time my friend and I were a little tipsy and started helping ourselves to the lovely array of fresh fruit garnishes.  The bartender playfully yelled, "Hey, this ain't Jamba Juice!" instead of kicking us out which would be very likely at most other bars.  The fact that it's mere blocks from my house doesn't hurt, either.

dvWG4YISBsSSDeEgKHuOqg.review_text: The best damn Mojito I have ever had!!!! If you want a well made drink and an awesome view, this is the place to go!!! Oh yes ladies I'm not lying!!!

xyNdK7m0i1Y4pb4gJicA6g.review_text: Young Pac Hts locals come here. The draw is the lush foliage decor, the free cheese, crackers and hummus platters, and the fresh fruit cocktails. The Strawberry Mango Mojito and Greyhound are two drinks to try. Perhaps the best fruit cocktails in the city are made here. Only here have I been consistenly delighted with them.  Those who are put off by the 20something Pac Hts crowd, as have been repeatedly discussed in other reviews, can find respite closer to the gas-lit fireplace. The table seating near there makes for better mood lighting and conversation, away from the din of the people getting soused at the bar. Better yet, come before 9 or 10pm, when they start filing in. But that also seems to be when the staff puts out the platters.  When the bar does get crowded, however, you will be pressed to get at those free platters.

mxy3AnzzHZnqoPbgM_tyPA.review_text: HOLY YUM!!!! fresh squeezed (like in front of you-at the bar with ginormous squeeze thingy) juices for the drinks! greyhounds are the best ive ever had. entire drink menu is very creative and very good, and verrrry reasonable prices. i will go back, asap, like this weekend.  plus they serve free cheese and crackers-could it get better?!?! a fave place FOR SURE!

A6jJ20wf9AauCAi_qVvuWw.review_text: Good place if you want to sit and enjoy a drink that tastes good.  A fair amount of seating and fresh juice drinks.  I like bars with fireplaces too.

0xnYnsOBBuY8hgjed-gpKQ.review_text: Hands down one of the best Mojitos I've ever had.  Their cocktails all taste deceivingly healthy b/c it's made with real fruit!  Hmm imagine Jamba Juice loaded with booze (always a winning combo).  And there's misc snacks like crackers and cheese around the place. And if you get really plastered, there's a giant wooden (?) lion you can molest :)

wPu-IJdZMEbFVEFSXflIAg.review_text: M and I met at this bar so I am biased. It gets two thumbs up from me. I'm not in love with the stinky bathroom or the strangely congested seating area - it's like a maze of tiki - but I go ga ga over the greyhounds. They are sure to please and get you wasted in no time. Be careful on a date with someone you don't know very well. You could end up engaged and marrying them...! HAHA. I warned YOU!  Apparently this used to be a gay bar so whenever I tell people I met my future husband here they look at me a little funny. ALL are welcome!  Also, the bartenders can be cute. But then again, the excessive consumption of greyhounds will make anyone look fine - again, warning about getting drunk, hooking up and then getting married.

Ud6j2HN40qEhycq2PuwcBA.review_text: I can't believe I did not know the existence of this place until my friend pointed it out to me when we drove from Marina to the Haight/Ashbury area last weekend. I wasn't sure if it was a bar since it looked more like an ordinary corner house in Pac Heights. She reassured me that yes, it was a bar/lounge and it's fun. I dragged bf out there last night after movie and supper and it was packed as we entered through the doors. There were not tables or seats available so we just hung out in one corner....snacked on some of the crackers and hummus (they were delicious) along with mozarrella and tomatoes and several offering of cheese!  This place is cool in its own way with all these plants and patio like seats, would be best to return on a quieter night with a few friends. Music was loud last night together with the basketball game that was on the large screens.  Their drinks menu consists of some really delicious and fruity drinks, strawberry mango mojito and so many other good combos with the likes of passionfruit, mangoes, orange, blueberries and the whole works.

WCAyi4kJIkS2LvkK6yD-yA.review_text: Sweet Nectar of the Gods!  With four dollar whiskey and cokes, fruity drinks for unsuspecting ladies, and fellows decked out in vests, Lion Pub is the place to meet your next ex-girlfriend.  I made it to Lion Pub on a Thursday night with a suitable amount of cash (thank you yelp) and plenty of gusto.  I was pleasantly surprised by the crowd, which was not only sizable for a weeknight, but filled with interesting people.  We were fast friends.    I would not like to see this place on a weekend, I imagine it violates the fire code, but if I am drinking on a weeknight, I will go back.

bT0zEuQIxTqt5kQiDmcZGA.review_text: Good god. I cannot believe that people like this place.   The place is crowded on the weekends. Impossible to move around.  The drinks are ok. "Fresh fruit" is a total gimmick. Most of the people I see in this place are too wasted to taste any difference there might be between a bottled mixer and fresh fruit. Still, as far as gimmicks go it's a good one...until you see the drink prices.   This place caters to the Marina/Pac Heights crowd. Get used to seeing both men and women wearing "The Uniform". Everyone looks the same, everyone talks the same, everyone acts the same. Be prepared for the "whoooo!" mating call of the drunk ex-fratboy in J-Crew every 20 minutes or so. Be prepared for the incessant click of the lip-smacking ex-sorority girl as well. It really is fascinating to see the mating calls of these two creatures in their native environment. I guess this place reminds me of a frat party for people who aren't in college anymore.   Drinks are on the pricey side and I was unimpressed with the ones I had. They have a snack spread that I wouldn't touch. Let me get this straight? I'm supposed to eat the smoked salmon that has been sitting on that table being picked over since 8pm? That's classy.   Everyone I know calls the place Lion's Den, but it doesn't really matter. You should not be drinking there. Many better places to drink exist in SF.   Go there instead.

tfDSt2MZ4Nz4UWX-2d-_HQ.review_text: I'm not the biggest fan of Mojito's but this place made me a believer that you have to try things more than once. I don't think there's a place in the bay area that makes a better assortment of Mojitos. What makes it so different is that they have FRESH FRUIT for their drinks. They literally have a basket of fruit and juice squeezers right at the bar. Their Greyhound drinks are Mucho mucho bueno!  One thing I'm sure plenty of reviewers have written is the fact that it does get hot and crowded. Be prepared to stand for awhile before you get a table or seat.

GXn4ZsasLKh0qZ5g3nIqcQ.review_text: Am I in the jungle or at a pub? Oh wait, there's a fireplace amidst the foliage and statues. Kind of cool little spot with a cheese plate and decent drinks. Not a huge fan of this place, but it's pretty cool every now and again. I get sleepy when I'm in here what with all the plush settings and everything, so it's a nice stop along the way to other bars...

vXYxtW_JpMMdjNzcw91u7A.review_text: A weem awa aweem away, A weem awa aweem away . . . . . Ooooohh, Ooohhh, Ooooh, Ooh, Oooh, Oooh, Oooh Ooooh Oooooh. The Lion Sleeps Tonight.  That's how I feel when I walk into Lion Pub.  I'm not so sure what "Scene" people are referring to in their reviews of Lion Pub, probably because when I'm there, it's totally my scene. And by that I mean, mellow, just me and my posse and maybe a few others. I always felt like this place was a secret. You know, like one of those places you take people when you don't want to see people.   Anyhoo, I've always liked Lion Pub, it's comfortable, clean and unique. I LOVE the fireplace. It's dark, has lots of plants and mirrors and comfortable seating.   The staff has always been pleasant and the bevies good and satisfying. I guess perhaps you can expect a different "scene" there on weekends, but I think it's a great place to grab a drink during the week.

W43j7wvFHZ1k40kf5fBgMw.review_text: So I was just logging on to write the exact same review that Jessica B. just did.  I, too, love the fresh grapefuit greyhounds.  In fact, it's the only thing I drink when I'm there and the only place I drink them!    It had been a while since I'd hung out there but my love of the place came rushing back to me Friday night.  Good stuff!

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: This is a super fun bar.   Dark and cool atmosphere. No sign outside.  Was a perfect place until it got too busy, and too douchey.  Fresh juices add to the tiki character of the place.

sHc-rTRwd2Us0_p6gWBKpA.review_text: I may be biased because I live a short 100 yards away, but that is just my stroke of luck, nothing else.  To say this place is a diamond in the rough would be premature, because the secret's been out for some time now.  As soon as ou walk thru the door you are smacked in the face with good vibes, good drinks, and consistently good tunage.  The beauty of the place is the loungey atmosphere; dark, chill, amiable.  And not to mention a bevy of beautfiul babies strewn about from wall to wall. And who needs dinner when there's a tremendous display of international cheeses that I've never heard of before?  I can only refrain from giving this killer establishment a solid 5 stars because of the lack of credit card acceptance.  Shame! Don't you know how much money could be had once the booze starts a-flowin' and dude only has plastic? Regardless, if they could set up a cot for me with my name on it right by the lion statues, I'd be there 24/7/364.  Christmas not included.

6IRroPYD9oHkjB_UyL6dEw.review_text: Ahhh...the Den.  It really just makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside.  I probably go here at least once a week and have only ever had one drink: Ketel Greyhound.  Let me tell you its the best greyhound I've ever had.  The bartenders here are cool because they really  have to work to make some of these drinks with all the fresh squeezed fruit.  On top of that you have the fireplace, the lion statues and the cheese/cracker spread (yes I'm that guy who goes crazy on the free food)  I do agree though that it can get a little too crowded with bros and screechy girls, otherwise I'd give it 5 stars for sure.

-DmpYICjBii640Zny46cLQ.review_text: i'm very happy i got the chance to find out about this place before i depart from the city once again. i came with a couple friends who said it was like a well kept secret. the place gave off a pleasant and relaxing ambiance: dimmed lighting, a vibrantly lit bar, lion statues everywhere, and CHEESE AND CRACKERS! i think that was the best part.   the bar has a couple specialty drinks that my friends recommended. kinda pricey though, but kinda worth your buck considering the amount and the kinds of alcohol they put in there. all my guy friends seemed to be a fan of the chuck norris and the burt reynolds. yes, they were both successful at achieving my rare asian glow. i also got a taste of their strawberry lemon drop, mojito, choc cake shot, and cactus cooler. all tasty. what makes it even more amazing is that they use fresh squeezed juice. my lemon drop was quite refreshing and the mojitos are legit.   bartenders were also really nice as well as the crowd.   we had a good time.  cash only =(  but atm available  they also host parties for free apparently.  yes, i'm coming back.

KeZjKwMbqPU2qQO7oGgWLw.review_text: Great bar - good music - cash only - the cheese plate SAVES me from when you go out without eating first.

niUyDPg9rDgS5R7uYyDngQ.review_text: I can't really remark about the drinks because I don't remember those.  I can really only attest to the fact that there is at least one super hot bartender.  That's right... 5-star hot!

0L1-6hDowdoVzV3DpPcdKg.review_text: This place was Amazing!  I loved the atmosphere, the setup of the bar, the drink specials, and the free cheese and crackers table!  The bartenders were super friendly to our group and helped us pick out some of their specialty drinks they had that night which were definitely unique and incorporated freshly squeezed juices.  My friends and I agreed that this was the bar with the best drinks all night!

0qaI3F0KpKt-r5YZQyI8MQ.review_text: Alright alright. so i dont really like this place. All my friends pull me here and i love me some greyhounds now and then, but besides the fresh squeezed grapefruit cocktails i dont know what else makes me go there.. the setup is a bit awkward, especially when it's crowded-- right when you walk in you have to choose: go right for the stand up bar. go left to (hopefully) snag one of the mashed together tables and hope someone will volunteer to go get drinks. The lighting is really dark so if you want to steal a kiss or whisper some gossip about the table next to you, feel obliged. the music's pretty good and they even have an aperitivo of crackers, cheese and carrots...   i'm not opposed to going there, i'd just rather go there with a flashlight.

eIEE-h40qFVtc07030lqLg.review_text: Chill spot to start or end the night. Solid drinks, especially the fresh fruit greyhounds.

2FLKPWJiM_Zo0Ar68chxQQ.review_text: First off, this place is called Lion PUB - look at the name up there.  NOT Lion's Den.  It's the LP.  Pub, pub, pub.  Of my many pet peeves, this is up there.  Stop trying to sound cool.  You're not.  OK, review time.  The mojitos are ridiculously good.  I could easily drink 4, 5, 6, ok a lot.  It's like refreshing fruit juice, who can say no to that?  I dig the interior, very cool.  Lots of seating (which is sort of set off from the "standing" crowd) and a pimp fireplace.  The fireplace gets REALLY hot though, so don't sit too closely.  You may forget this rule after a few mojitos.  The bartenders are great.  After giving one of them a really hard time about making a drink wrong, he gave us a free drink AND a round of shots on him.  Minus one for CASH ONLY.  Yeah, they do have an ATM in there, which is good because I never have cash on me.  But really, I'd spend way more money at your establishment if I could throw it on a credit card, when I use cash I actually realize how much I'm spending!

IAxrqUQFeGzlDHQeMFktQg.review_text: Nice hidden local bar. Not the best of mixed drinks, but will do when your in the area. Had their jalapeño margarita. It was nice and spicy, but not the best tasting margarita...tastes like a mix. CASH ONLY! Forget your cards, although they do have an atm.

5Mp_jB8yL3xMfgjFu6Xo3Q.review_text: I'm biased because I live a block away from here, but I love this place. There are always people here, but it's never so crowded I can't get a drink. Bartenders are friendly, and so is pretty much everyone else in here. The best part about the bar is the the free snacks they serve, although sometimes they are completely eaten up by the time I get there. I wish drink prices were a little lower, but other than that it's a great place to go any night of the week.

Cmf92YHJvDDOT6g4zTCeAg.review_text: Someone asked me about this place recently and it took me back to the "old days" when this was one of the truly high class gay bars in The City. It was always hard to find. Never had a sign other than the stained glass lion. The crowd was always very well dressed and thoughtful of the neighbors. Someone once told me that the "scene" was older/younger but I never could tell for sure. It has been interesting to watch it transition to the place it is now. Still a nice crowd, just straight. The place is still beautifully kept.

GYI8sCpWkRf8Rz46hJ31bA.review_text: This place is fricking awesome. Period. However, let me clear the air before you go off and say "wait a second, why didn't he give it 5* if it's awesome?" The only reason this place doesn't get 5 is because it's cash only -- and in my world, that's a major buzzkill.   I LOVE that I live within a 90 second walk of this place because it's a great default go-to with some friends if there's not much else going on.  My reasons for loving this place:  - The bouncers are friendly - The drinks are cheap yet strong -- $6 for the greyhound; $3 upsell to Grey Goose if that's how you roll - The bartenders aren't assholes and are very quick at noticing who needs to order - The free cheese and crackers are always fresh and tasty - Never had trouble with finding a place to sit - And finally, the douche-level of the patrons is just right. It's not quite Marina status, but definitely enough for me to feel right at home.

YlJNqoHqIssCHP25h2sUFA.review_text: Great cocktails and they have cheese!  In these tough economic times, it's important to find bars that give more bang for your buck (or in this case, cheese to your ass!)  Lion Pub is a great local tavern-esque bar located on the edge of Pac Heights.  The crowd seems to vary from college students to early 30's.  There are always an interesting assortment of cocktails on the menu.  Down side is that they don't take credit cards so have cash handy!  There's not much in this area in the way of bars so it's pretty good considering that.  However, it's not a go to bar for me...just if I happen to be in the area.

HcQ_Ki2mDdiIOQ_ggB7egw.review_text: i heard from a friend that they've started using wider straws!  haven't been back to see it myself yet but i'll definitely have to stop in soon.

KCyOtarf661fTelbDtaO4g.review_text: If Disneyland opened up a bar in Adventureland, this is what it would look like. Jungle plants and lions...my kind of place!  Went on a pub crawl in the Lower Pac Heights/Laurel Heights area and this place was my favorite. The Strawberry-Mango Mojito is SO good! Who doesn't love a freshly squeezed juice cocktail?!

jJlYRJXPdIolKbuqGiZ-CQ.review_text: When I first moved to the city, I would walk past the Lion Pub almost everyday and had no idea that it was a bar -no signage. It's a nice neighborhood bar, all dark.  If you get there early enough you can grab the table by the fireplace, which gives almost everyone the perfect lighting. There's a little TV in the corner of the bar, so you can get your sports fix.  They always have the best drinking music on, nothing that you can sing to, just something that makes you want another drink.  The owner hooks up the place with free apps on the weekend.  But the key for this bar is cash- that's all they take! Cash and carry baby!  Oh yeah, get there early when it's still a neighborhood bar, anything after 11:30 pm it has become free for all.

7CJBasUIoN6Ioo99dl_kqA.review_text: $10-$50 dollars for a drink,bring your wallet  average $10-12  $5.50 for a beer  don't bring a date here,thats $120 for 6 drinks each looking at the alcohol pour(small)you  will not get drunk,the rest is all juice or soda ,they had trainee bartender,so he did not know any of big list drinks cash only, half gay crowd,half straight marina crowd that got lost, candles everwhere,fire hazard as back door is locked, they pipe in Pandora music starting to see wear and tear,had about 18 people during the week,the place is small because its designed so bad,bar is nearly at entrance,it would be packed at weekends because it is so small,they could bring prices down and pour more alcohol ok bar but too expensive  they also don't fill the beer glasses to the top,which annoys me,your losing 10th pint each time,its a trendy dive bar

dmj50NyY2iJ4asrLm2HQdw.review_text: Great spot in a great location! And ohhh the decor! Awesome drinks, esspecially the fresh squeezed greyhounds! The bartenders are all pretty nice as well. All around fun place!

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: The watermelon vodka is pretty good but not sure if I would venture out all the way out here to find parking and hang out.  It's right at the residential area but parking was ok.  There were several people puking - in the sink and outside - and it wasn't even 11p yet.  There are tables and a fireplace where you can sit but you should come early to snag a table and chairs.

RVKadMPQnfWj7CxyX_gaGQ.review_text: Lion's DEN.  fresh squeezed oj in your screwdriver, okaaay!  there is a fireplace...but i can't recall if it's real or faux....which means the drinks are that good!

mKBaaQMW5NYRkh9uLEe_SA.review_text: tasty mixed cocktails made with real fruit!  I would recommend the bartlett pear mojito.  Not the most happening place in the area during the weekday and also, its super dark in there!  Can't see a soul!

qgvfpFKkJZ-JaLFDuy6Aag.review_text: The drinks here are delicious - ditto to everyone else that the fresh squeezed juice takes a greyhound, (or any other drink,) to a whole new level.   The atmosphere was great, too - dimly lit and cozy, with a fireplace!  The place was packed, but full of really polite people. (My friends and I were offered a table by a group of other girls - that's unheard of!) If you're "well heeled"  and under 30, this is your place. My heels felt a little too inexpensive to be here, but that wont stop me from coming back some time, especially if weeknights are as mellow as everyone here says.

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: Looking to boost your Vitamin C intake and get your buzz on at the same time? I love this place for their FRESH FRUIT mentality. Try a Greyhound or combo mojito--soooo good.   Also, if you time it right, you can score some free sushi or cheese and cracker snacks. Yum.

OYN8JcC1WS9WgezpeQdZRQ.review_text: Great place for seasonal fresh fruit cocktails. Love ordering off the menu and Christian, the bartender, is great at improvising. Definitely recommend the fresh basil vodka gimlet, which tastes like savory pizza in a glass or try the watermelon mojito.  Dimly lit and cozy atmosphere with fireplace. $1 off weekday happy hour until 7. Ideal for large group or small party.

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: Hello & welcome to Lion Pub. I would first like you to take a look around & note that our patrons are wearing extremely nice clothing. There is nary an untucked shirt in the place. Adjust your wardrobe accordingly, please. You seem distracted. Why YES, that IS a table full of dips & fine cheeses in the corner, free of charge to YOU, the loyal customer. Of COURSE we understand that only fine cheeses will do. You're a guy/gal with class, grace & impeccable taste. We wouldn't dare try to take that away from you...  I'm starting to realize that the foundation of my sardonic commentary is on shaky ground. When you make free food seem like a bad thing, people are going to think your'e crazy. Okay, okay, I really do like the physical layout of the place & they DO make a mean greyhound. I'm just not a big fan of the yuppie weekend crowd. This would be a much more tolerable place on a Monday or Tuesday, for sure.

epS_iB4nRr9ru8qkQHrU4Q.review_text: Came here on a Friday night and it was packed....to the point it was humid inside and uncomfortable.  But their Greyhounds are pretty good...perhaps a good place for a pre/post-party.

pQB71XVAJpxSo-JQsmMJTQ.review_text: Love this cozy little gem! Modest bar in Pac Heights - great music, drinks and ambiance.

VL8apbjr8DO12StXwWhUNQ.review_text: A hidden treat..literally, there's no sign and the outside is covered in foliage. Freshly squeezed juiced-up cocktails make this a lively place.  Casual and fun atmosphere.  Cash only.

yv2UlWzXy6buGLwyoyNkNw.review_text: I really probably should not be reviewing this place. The one and only time I set foot in here I was extremely intoxicated (think St. Patty's day and we started our drink fest at 11). Oddly enough for it being the drinking holiday of the year this place was EMPTY, I mean so EMPTY I could've done a friggen round off back handspring in the center of the bar. Ok not safe, because I was intoxicated. Anyhow, the drinks were good and strong, not super pricey I guess. (Mind you this is coming from a drunken memory) The buffet was interesting. I should give em an extra star, my bff stole the brie at the end of the night. *shame* Yes it was she who stuffed the queso into her Coach bag with the damn cheese fork still in it.  EEK!

xck0NxyewG2WB_41U-r3Aw.review_text: Went to this bar last Friday night for a coworker's bday get together and was quickly reminded of why I don't go to bars. The crowd is YOUNG. Felt like I was back in college at a frat party. IT GETS HOT AS A MO FO IN THERE. Beckram yoga hot. Thanks for curling my hair up Lion's den. Loud as hell too. Get me the hella outta here.

LKJT1KEwW7HlAMDEjtnkmg.review_text: The greyhounds are what keep me coming back.  Fresh squeezed grapefruit juice and vodka for only $5 a drink...pretty sweet.  Actually, to be quite honest, I have only ever had the greyhound...haha, it was so good that i didn't want to eff up a good thing...  That and all the cheese my heart desires...goat cheese, brie, blue cheese, Swiss...the list goes on, as will my attendance at this bar.   It gets packed with a certain douchey crowd, but hey, I would brave it just for the drinks and cheese.  Plus, at least it's not the marina.

qlJVwqTNPKDv91NOfi0k9A.review_text: i've never been to this pub during peak hours.  stopped by one time on a random weekday around maybe 4 or 5.  it was real dead, and we were probably the only ones there.  i had heard there were some free snacks that they put out, but they weren't there that time.  i was under the impression that it was during happy or something, but after reading the reviews i see it's later @ night.. okay.    we had mojitos.  they were tasty.  i'm picky about how i like mine... lots of lime juice and mint, and not too sweet, but not at all sour... like a healthy balance/medium between the two.  i don't like crowded bars, so i would probably only go when it's a off night.    i like how it's dark in there.  it's decorated real cool.  we sat in the corner near the fire.  when me and the bf were there, it was actually after we fought, so it was pretty silent for a while.  it gave me a chance to observe and appreciate the decor. haha.  silent treatment...a man's favorite.  hah! ;)

1xvmDofA0MvWDSD2hJAvyw.review_text: Who can refuse fresh squeezed juice cocktails and free munchies?!  FREE!  Around 10:30 or so they bring out platters of food! ie. cheese and crackers, veggies and dip, sushi, etc.  Plenty of seats and a fireplace.  On the busy nights, it can get overly crowded and thats when I take off.  As mentioned in previous reviews, I can't deal with the too loud, impossible to move or get a drink bars.  They're normally only cool on the off days.  They don't take credit cards though, so that can be a pain in the ass, but they have an ATM in the back.

ssXAz7RahuYNDx7FeRe4Aw.review_text: It's kinda reminiscient of an underground ski lodge. Lots of warm wood lined walls lead to an even warmer fireplace. The atmosphere is jovial and everyone seemed to be smiling or laughing.   Hey, who ordered me this strawberry lemon-ade thing? Oh yeah, I did. I was sold the second I saw the large bowl of fresh strawberries on the bar and the bushel of fresh citrus on the side. I don't mind having a girly drink when it tastes this good! Next up was a couple of greyhounds! MMMmmmm! A heavy pour of vodka with fresh grapefruit was so refreshing!! Only downside is most of the alky in their well is pretty poor stuff so make sure and call your spirits.

V1ra0vxOSalQADQKi1TCLg.review_text: I love, love, love this place!!! They have the best fresh-squeezed drinks and usually have cheese & crackers as well as veggies out to munch on. Only downside is they are cash only, but definitely worth it!

-TGTFsrzc1-fT05jd77_rg.review_text: This past Wednesday, I was happily entertained by a hilarious conversation with a person who shall remain nameless while relaxing to good music and sipping drinks at Lion Pub. I drank a "Blueberry Pineapple Mojito" which was quite fresh albeit a bit sweet for my liking. The bar had a very relaxing atmosphere as I sat by a roaring fire and watched as everyone's faces took on a healthy glow from the lighting. The cheese, fruit, and vegetables were an adorable touch to what was already such a nice evening. Why not five stars?? The crowd was quite a bit less diverse than one would have hoped. I like to see a healthy mix of colors!!

cx6CMeztrzFYAY0gpaC3Mg.review_text: Don't ask me why I was out on a Tuesday night.   It was fairly empty but who cares about that?! More drinks for me!  We had the bar tender all to ourselves. I love how you really can't tell this place is a bar. Looked like a house to me! hehe.  I tried the Watermelon vodka. LOVED it. I'm pretty disappointed when I order fresh fruit drinks because they are either really sweet or have to much alcohol and you can't taste the fruit. Mine was perfection.  The hospitality of this place is like no other! Cheese platters and from other reviews I read, it looks like sushi on some nights too! Beats pretzels and nuts if you ask me!

PmrFSehNLWAn8pMWtB53Lg.review_text: yes it's true - fresh juice squeezed right into the glass makes some of the most delish cocktails known to mankind.  And the gods who created Lions' Pub decreed that mere mortals would not have to pay $10 a cocktail for the privilege - I seem to remember my lovely greyhounds being $5 apiece.  I would tell you more but I don't remember a damn thing after the fifth greyhound..sixth greyhound...ummm

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: Totally molested Nick Lachey's doppleganger here.  Love the free cheese and strawberry lemonade thingy m'bobbers.  Met some dude who went to the same elementary school as me and we talked about the old ass P.E. teacher who taught us how to juggle scarves.  I snuck beer in here that I stole from the 49ers box fridge.

CUQZ5fr6HUcWXT4rN7J9Vg.review_text: The Lions pub has introduced me to a new drink and a drink I want to come back for: the salty dog!! Vodka with fresh squeezed grapefruit juice with a salt rim. Salty and tangy. Good mix! OH and by fresh squeezed I mean they take a half of a grapefruit and put it in their juicer and squeeze the juice right into your glass!!! AND this cocktail was 5.5!!! Super reasonable considering it was made with fresh juice and the bartender was super nice! (he made our drinks before a large group so we didn't have to wait 10 minutes!!)  I also like all the lions and the fire place. It is a real cozy place to have drinks with friends at. PLUS we were there on a Wednesday night and they had a free platter of cheese and crackers. AND the cheese wasn't too bad.

SuHt70nQ8uGVAWXPO26hUg.review_text: Yummy fresh fruit drinks! Watermelon vodka is a must!

zpnd-D0-ahcfrYYLvt04oA.review_text: Worse case scenario: Drunken Kelly E and a gigantic plate of CHEESE!!!!   I'd heard about this place for so long, but didn't get to check it out until randomly cruising in there with a herd of friends on Saturday night.  I've never experienced such psychic bartending.  I don't think I actually utilized my voice to express what I was ordering, but somehow he read my slurring lips to understand that it was blueberry vodka and soda that I was hoping to achieve.  Miraculous.  Sip of drink, wedge of cheese.

9M9JmaJ3uWQABX0HN8IF8A.review_text: Fresh fruit, strong drinks, FREE cheese and crackers, and good service.  What's not to love about this place?  Any of the mojitos with your choice of fruit is delicious.  It tastes so good that you don't realize how drunk you are until you've finished your third one!  The only thing that sucked was that it was $9 each (not including the tip).  I know it takes a while to make each one, but still a little too pricey for a pseudo dive bar.  Other great drinks are the greyhound or the salty dog (which is just a greyhound rimmed in salt).  I've never had it with fresh grapefruit before and it's just yummo!  These only cost $6, which isn't too bad, but still pricey for something I can easily make at home.   The two best things about this place: 1) Cheese and crackers - and it's not just cheap cheese and crackers - it's a good variety of both that will keep you coming back for more 2)  A lion statue right when you walk in.  If you can get a picture on it without getting caught by the bar staff, then you're golden.  But be careful, they will definitely kick you out if they see you (yes, it's happened before!)  *TIPS -cash only!!  There's an ATM inside but bring cash ahead of time so you don't get charged the $3 service fee from the ATM and whatever your bank charges you for not using their ATMS -HAPPY HOUR is 4:30-7pm EVERYDAY!  We got there right at 7pm and missed happy hour prices.  Boo!  But now, I know!

gAFW1IrNeE6bDvuU4r77VQ.review_text: One of the few quality watering holes with nice places to sit down and relax.

BCXnt5v3hy9MS8kLgdfCag.review_text: The drinks were great and well priced!  The greyhounds and mojitos are delicious and I love seeing the fruit and watching the bartenders work their magic.  Both times I've been its a fun, young crowd.    I LOVE that they bring cheese and crackers!!  Why does free food make me so happy? :o)

kyG14FyCWmVW3Uefs_GE_Q.review_text: Love this place during the week when it's not crowded.  They have some great drinks on the menu and squeeze their own oranges, blood oranges and grapefruits.    During the weekend this place is "A hella ghetto douche bag hell" as Tatyana K has quoted me saying which I probably did the first time I walked through the door on a Friday or Saturday night.  You've been warned!  Thanks Tatyana and Daniel for showing me this great neighborhood bar!

pwwL6Uo8lfA7oOC3qOliPQ.review_text: This place is money.  Great bartenders, excellent music, and good drink options.  It's a versatile place; kind of a lounge on Sunday to Wednesday, but it starts to pick up on Thursday and by Friday "The Den" is packed.

4rscUhRnHPie0Uv3VEcoOQ.review_text: Any bar that serves fresh greyhounds and screwdrivers (read = fresh fruit, not juice) rocks in my book.   Any bar that serves fresh greyhounds, screwdrivers AND free cheeses, crackers, hummus and more carby goodness rocks my friggin' world.  Word. I love you, Lion Pub.

ZBIAB6FDoqosJEzKEU_ojA.review_text: Ok so many I'm biased... my husband use to work here many moons ago, but I love this place! The first time I went was on a trip up to SF a few years ago for Valentine's Day. So of course my boy had to show me his old stomping grounds.   The fireplace was lit, the lighting was moody, and the music was awesome (a little electronic stuff spinning). The owner (as I was told) had a nice spread of cheese, crackers, etc. on a large table so you could grab a drink and a little something to snack on as well. SUCH a nice touch! And as a few others have mentioned they make a delicious Greyhound!!! But any drink with fruit is awesome since they are all fresh squeezed...again a very nice touch.  So all in all....this place is just the perfect little spot to chill out, tie on a few drinks, and carry on a nice conversation!

NWqHVMUIHQU2DW8RU3T_DQ.review_text: Cocktails were weak and the place was full of ex-frat boy types on a friday night.  The entry was perpetually filled with the bouncer's mates (drinking beer in paper bags).  The decor is eclectic.  It can't seem to decide what it wants to be: christmas lights, fireplace, buddha statue, cheese bar, giant lion heads.  Odd.  Plus cash only.

ruRHp0Ce2wxDmY7ZSYEYSg.review_text: Best drinks in town (if you get them made by the hot bartender, erin)  they offer fresh mojitos and drinks on a daily basis.  water melon mojitos, blueberry mojitos, starwberry mojitos, more fresh fruit drinks (can't think of others off the top of my head).  The place is somewhat hidden. I didn't even know that it was a bar as you pass it. A friend said to meet there and i was like....i'm here, but i don't see it. Just listen for the music and wait til you see crowds outside on a friday or saturday night.   There is an unusual mix of fixtures on the inside though. Mostly bar furniture but there is an animal statue (....a bear? i can't remember). Looks like they found it somewhere and was like hey, that'd be perfect for the bar......really? i've yet to see anyone sit on it but I think it's random!  anyway, look for the chick waitress that gets hit on by a lot of drunk guys. tip her well and she'll reward you with FANTASTIC drinks. If you are looking for the frutiy girly drinks, she's your bartender.   If you are looking for those boring manly drinks she can do those too. If you order a jack & coke or something similar, she gets a good mix and isn't heavy handed like some bars i've been to.   Nothing is worse than ordering a _____ (insert choice of alcohol) and _____ (insert juice/soda/energy drink, etc.) and getting 99% alcohol and a drop of juice. like i said, be sure to tip well and she'll treat you good.  don't be mean to the guy bartenders either, they aren't shy to hop the counter to box with asshole customers or break up a bar fight.

4h4unLs0_kpiBsJqtZS27g.review_text: I came here the first time last year after Bay to Breakers with some random, American-appareled partiers.  After such a long and debaucherous day, I didn't quite "catch" on that the greyhound was the specialty there, but we were drinkin' em up.  The cheese and cracker platter helped too.  I enjoyed this time but will admit it was a tad fuzzy.  I came back again and definitely had fun although there were a couple of obnoxious dudes (hazard of any bar I suppose). It's a lively crowd and I love the moody dark vibe and fireplace.  I was there last week on a date and I can say that Sunday is a good time to go if you're looking for a more laid-back time there as its nearly empty.  The music was quite an eclectic mix that I enjoyed.  I'm sure some will hem and haw about the Marina crowd but if you're looking something beyond the run-of-the-mill SF bar, I'd check out the Den!

9wLtMApHLswed6DbvXscwg.review_text: Cool spot and not pretentious at all, which I dig.  But the music selection was way off the mark (popular gangsta rap) and the clientele was solely caucasian.  Which is weird.  I never like to go anywhere where everybody is white.

raCKh2I0F-41J5U0OBZz3Q.review_text: Ladies bust out your seven jeans, guys put on your best striped shirt.  This place is a meat/meet market.

HKC-j6ShF_wUfB0q1BH5cw.review_text: Nice little (more or less) hidden neighborhood bar in Pacific Heights. Modern decor, ambient vibe, fireplace, great bar. They do their drinks with freshly squeezed juice and that alone is something to come back for!   I loved the Strawberry Mango Mojito and the Greyhound (grapefruit, vodka) which was nicely balanced and refreshing. So, if you love fresh juice and booze, this is your place!  No surprise it can get mad on a Friday/Saturday night but hey, the drinks and the interior are worth it.

VjUuaL2A0QwrRZ8hDdFf7Q.review_text: well kept secret - they regularly update their margaritas with fresh seasonal fruits.    my favorites: mango margarita - with muddled mango and spicy chili salt.  LOVE the spicy salt. peach margarita - tons of peach at the bottom, like a spiked fruit salad, watch out! jalapeno margarita - YIKES!  talk about heat.  if you want the savory in your drink, this is the one.  all the fresh fruit makes me feel less guilty about all that tequila (and boy, talk about a generous pours.)  it's "healthy!"

sI1AEPejbOupnZRDNlcvaQ.review_text: Already a gazillion reviews about how pretentious and how crowded this place is... but nontheless.. i like! There are great fruity mojitos... the bartenders dont mind making a mojito even with the crowd. +1 star! Free food/snacks, even smoked salmon +1 star! OK so don't come here to meet people... if you think they are pretentious. just come here with friends.. grab a place by the fire, chit chat, and people watch. it totally makes the night worth it. watch out for random girls  and their flingin' pony tails. :X

x0SwOM8vQXsPfiILj1pBdg.review_text: Weird location. Drinks were weak. Service was horrible. Must was WAY TO LOUD!

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: OK, OK, we get it...they have killer mojitos and are known for their amazing greyhounds.  But how much are you willing to sacrifice for a good drink? Some people cant handle cash only...I'm OK with it, as long as i know ahead of time so i can prepare accordingly. Some people cant handle the pac heights scene, and seeing as though its right on the edge, this bar definitely has some "fratty" types.  Personally, not so big a fan of the crowd or potential men id be meeting. I guess its not really a sacrifice when a place offers free cheese and goodies for your consumption.  It is a sacrifice however when that cheese has been sitting out for HOURS, and gives you a belly ache before the hangover even kicks in. I don't know.  I'm kind of meh about this bar. Take it or leave it.  If people are there, and that's where they choose to go, i'll go.  We usually end up here after Solstice which is a step in the wrong direction, or after The Fishbowl in which anything is a step up.  Meh.

Zr5Il-XqYU4kHd7iY5v_RA.review_text: Tucked away behind some palm trees on the corner of Divisadero and Sacramento, this little gem is easy to miss. But you shouldn't if you like FRESH FRUIT in your mojitos and/or margaritas! There are a gajillion (or so) drinks written on the mirror behind the bar, but I'm all about the strawberry, mango mojitos!  Cash only - come prepared :)

SckKccgLWQmku8Xp5iaA-w.review_text: This is one of my local favorites!!!  The crowd has a great vibe to it.  I absolutely LOVE their strawberry mojito.  I never appreciated grapefruit juice until I had a Greyhound at this place.  The freshly squeezed fruit juices are amazing in your cocktail.  Some nights this place can be a bit too crowded for my liking, but that is only a minor frustration.  Only other annoyance here is the fact it is a cash only bar.  It is really cool that they have a cheese and crackers station in the back.

GFzqVgNWxAGHGBo1oHV-jQ.review_text: Oh my! I miss the Lion pub so much. I used to go this place every weekend back in the days way before Yelp; when I lived in San Francisco. Great place to drink and hang out. The bartender are speedy and also very friendly. They have best fresh squeezed drinks in town. Just be aware that it may be hard to find parking space.

mxcPTBI__H3DOqzLJ7tSHg.review_text: I actually enjoy Lion's Bar (it's a "pub"? How did that fact escape me?) and I'm not really a bar kind of girl.  Here though, I like the comfy chairs, the fireplace, drinks I think deserve their high price tag, and the fact that I can reconvene the chairs in any order to accommodate my friends. Usually, pubs put me to sleep but this place is a hot jungle and a nice way to end a workday.  Special note: I don't come here on the weekends so I miss the crowd-tastic nights. I tried once but shouldering through large men to reach my passion fruit-melon mojito just wasn't the same (take away one star for crowd-control). Otherwise, this place is the perfect spot to catch up with people you actually want to be able to talk to and hear above the din...

JahGSXy3uvsZr1KVgJrrag.review_text: As I'm writing this review I am still tipsy from the few "Greyhounds" ($6) I got here, which were a combination of Vodka and freshly squeezed grapefruit. The bartender literally squeezes the grapefruit in front of you, sweet.  I liked the decor and lowly dimmed lighting. (But, wtf, even the bathroom is so dark you don't know where you're pissing.)  But the best part of all is the FREE CHEESE AND CRACKERS! Nomnomnom, tastes like gold fishes. Not literally gold fishes, but the cheesy goldfish crackers.  p.s. - This place is CASH ONLY

SpPCjUqNWaT2yflt57hcFQ.review_text: This place is fun, but for God's sake: open a window up somewhere! It turns into a sauna even on cold nights because there's no ventilation. I am on the hot-blooded side so this becomes a bit uncomfortable at times.

um9XhouzTg4zZC5fVwCMVw.review_text: Home away from home.  From a starving student to other starving students, dinner on Fri and Sat nights w/ your cocktail for free.  Good smoked salmon!  Hang your coat on a lion and enjoy the neighborhood bar.

9OyPEDQ0N6i0rWv9S-XjgQ.review_text: Who doesn't like large lion statues in intimate, dark dives with a fire places? Pretty much my new favorite bar in SF. You just can't beat riding lions while drunk. Plus they make really good Greyhounds (grapefruit juice and gin or vodka).  Weekend nights apparently get crowded and crazy, but I came on a Thursday and there was a nice crowd but still room to sit. Weekdays are the way to go!

XgGv0Mm9n4xLlRbsYssWOg.review_text: I loved this place.   It is neighborhood bar in the location.  Every Friday I came here with my friend.  Bartenders are nice.  Great bar with an eclectic background music.  Fresh fruit drinks and better range.   Also the best mixed of drinks.  Great menu of alcohol and cool inside.

xEnhU2d-_R6HO3Lh_ce7rw.review_text: First pub in SF i have been to. It's very chill and has all types of drinks just gotta know your alchy! (know your pallet).

4Po_4vgdBFk2GPeKfJqVww.review_text: How is it that I've never been here before?  Watching the hunky bartenders squeeze the s#!t out of those grapefruit to make me one helluva greyhound is a show in and of itself.   It does become a cluster later on Fri/Sat nights, but if you can find a time to visit while avoiding the crowds, its not a bad place to get your drank on.  Definitely one of the better options in that 'hood...

dtSXEME51GuvmClBoyympg.review_text: I come here all the time!! They use fresh fruit for all mixed drinks. Greyhounds are awesome. Margaritas are delicious and as simple as they get, tequila, agave nectar, and lime. No sweet/sour, no mix, no triple sec, no BS. Try a raspberry mojito too!!! There always seems to be a good crowd as well. Trust me, you'll enjoy this place.

Nlfemj273YV_Ro3dwep8Kw.review_text: "free" cheese and crackers = nice! also with a bunch of fresh spinach leaves this evening. FRESH squeezed fruit juice in the mixed drinks. such as the greyhound (fresh grapefruit juice with vodka) and the mojito (fresh muddled mint) and the fresh oj and vodka. this place is kinda like a jamba juice with booze. without the loud blenders and wheatgrass. super dark with a fireplace and a bunch of tables. beware - cash only  but still a nice place for a couple drinks before or after dinner.

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: Chill lookin spot that serves fresh squeezed drinks. Had the greyhound (grapefruit and vodka) and the strawberry mojito, defintiely on the strong side.   This is a typical lounge place, a little more classy than a pub type but it only has one little 19 inch TV. It ain't gonna cut it for sports games.

yYx7gYhabz_fnbeTQ3pmYw.review_text: Another bar that looks to have 4 or 5 star potential but just falls short.   Came here on a Wednesday night with a large group and was please with the spacious, laid back atmosphere. Kinda reminded me of bigger, trendier Lone Palm. They also have a nice selection of mixed drinks and beer.   Service was definitely the down fall. One bartender was vigorously mixing drinks while two others watched a basketball game. Maybe they were intimidated with making a Mojito but that shouldn't stop you from scanning the bar once every 2 minutes. When I want a beer I need you to turnaround and get to work!   First bar I've been too in SF that doesn't have food but will not let you bring any in. Cheese and crackers are nice, just not what I want for dinner.

JR0G0xlQRep0jRea1_9QIQ.review_text: I gotta say. i like it.  The place is pretty cool, seems like its pretty packed all the time. Good looking bar. Yuppy enough looking that I didn't feel like I was at a college bar, not too modernish so I didn't feel like i was at a douchey bar.   The mojitos, lived up to the hype. I didn't feel a bit girly about getting such a dang tasty fruity drink. Go with the cantaloupe passion fruit mojito. I tried the strawberry mango one - good but not as good.  What really sold me though was the cheese and crackers they had out. CHEESE AND CRACKERS. Genius. I don't even like cheese and crackers like some white folk/and females do, but I was touched. I ate my fill, had two drinks. It was the makings of a good night.

ZGZ9sMJuL-iOMV7lC54l6Q.review_text: My friend and I decided to stop by the Lion Pub on a Friday night because it looked cool and I had read that they had good fresh fruit cocktails. When we got inside it was jam packed with people but it didn't take us too long to order drinks. We got two greyhounds which were very nice and refreshing, although somewhat on the expensive side ($7.50 each). It was cool to see them squeeze the fruit directly into the glass from an old-fashioned fruit press. After a few minutes my friend and I scored a couple of seats at the bar, where we ordered two more greyhounds from a different bartender, who was NOT as nice as the first one. He deliberately ignored my friend when she was trying to get his attention (Mind you, she is a very pretty and nice lady) And then finally, very impatiently took our order and my friend handed him $20.
