Our drinks (which were not as good as the first ones) finally arrived and after a moment we realized that we had not gotten our change back. My friend had to struggle to get his attention again and told him that he still owed us $5. Instead of trying to help us, he simply said, "I didn't make your drinks," turned away and continued to ignore us until we finished our drinks and left. It was very rude and it really pissed me off because we hadn't done anything to deserve such treatment. All in all though, I'd like to visit this place again someday when it's not so busy, and try some of their other delightful sounding cocktails. Hopefully on a calmer night their drinks (and bartenders) are much better!

6BzZrhEegID8el3o6d-LwA.review_text: This spot is pretty hit-and-miss as far as the quality of the crowd but I was there last night and am always impressed by the fact that they squeeze fresh grapefruits for my greyhounds.  A nice touch...and tasty too.

X4KP6ZK0ST-jF46KpAhxzg.review_text: Cathy G. would give this a 5-star.  :) I'll go with 4--the evening cheese bar is nice.  Drinks flow and overcrowding happens, but it normally thins out around midnite, enough for some elbow room.  Good lighting and good seating.

0tb0sF3DjDdAxxhhnwDSJg.review_text: Wen't there last night with a few friends and loved the vibe. Very cool atmosphere and ambiance. Definitely a good place to bring a date and have a couple of drinks.  Try their drinks with fresh squeezed juices. Watermelon and Vodka was great and so was their Mojito.   The music was a mix of a bunch of cool jams. Mostly hiphop and pop.

rKkpHJkJ27xOwnhy_bMkvA.review_text: I think it's time I write an update for Lion Pub.  I still absolutely LOVE this place.  My best friend still lives 2 blocks away, and it is super convenient to walk to (or stumble home from).  I like that it doesn't really look like much from the outside.  Just an ivy covered front, no sign or anything.  It's kind of a weird set up - the bar feels really loooooong and narrow.  And it gets crowded.  Good luck finding a seat on a Friday or Saturday.  I can't say much about the crowd - I've never experienced any ridiculously douchey people while I was there - in general I feel that most San Franciscans act pretty douchey, but that may be a bit harsh.  I live in Las Vegas, where we can get free or extremely cheap drinks 24 hours a day.  And I didn't even blink an eye when I saw the prices at Lion Pub.  $10 is not crazy, folks.  They have an interesting selection of drinks that are made with super fresh ingredients.  In my opinion, they are well worth the cost.  The 1st time I was here, my friend Heather ordered a cantaloupe margarita that she literally could not finish because it was too strong.  I love the mojitos and the different concoctions they come up with - and I am usually strictly a beer girl.  The first time I was brought here, it was because I was told that they have the best greyhound in the city and that I absolutely must try it.  It didn't disappoint!  Parking is tough - but where in San Francisco isn't it?  Take a cab and quit your bitchin!  The fireplace is amazing.  And the music has also always been on point.  Also - I have been here past "last call" quite a few times. I've even arrived to the bar and been served a drink at almost 1:30am. That is unheard of for California!  This is a place that I always make sure I stop at when I am in town

W5cwxNwGiZJd393PCDQEvA.review_text: This place is weird, but I like it.    I've lived very close by to Lion Pub since moving to SF, but I had never heard of it let alone been there until this past Saturday.  Like others have said, it's hidden & almost seems like it doesn't belong there.  It almost seems like it should be a swanky bar, but it really is down to earth.    It's dark on the inside, and I think there's a patio ( I say "think" because the place is pretty dark, and it was at night and I was drunk so for all I know the whole place could have been indoors but I'm pretty sure there really was a patio).  I  only stayed for about 40 minutes, but like I said I like what I saw.  The place has a lot of greenery and almost has a tropical feel to it, but it's not cheesy.    I like the complimentary cheese & crackers they leave out, but I think if I was there with someone I wanted to take home at the end of the night, I'd just stick to the crackers ;)  Someone else was buying drinks and just put them in my hand, so I'm not really sure what kind of selection they have, but it looks like a full bar.  I had a couple of greyhounds, which I usually wouldn't order but were yummy.  Now after glancing over the reviews here I know why the dude buying was getting greyhounds because apparently this place specializes in them.  I like this place and I'll be back.  It's just a weird atmosphere.  Check it out though!

tyT5SuNWUQOW_zcjPOfayQ.review_text: The ambiance is very nice with the fireplace going.  It was pretty dead on Wednesday (bring a date if you got one).  The bartenders are pretty cool though and the bar is nice.   They specialize in mixed drinks (especially ones that have citrus -- Greyhound, bloodhound, bunch of others).  They have a $5 special on Wednesdays that should draw in the ladies.

wNAkYIf1XQckk2c82tOBhw.review_text: Went here this last Friday and it was a great surprise! I had no idea this chic little bar existed... & the CHEESE PLATE of free help yourself & nibble on some cheese! Loved it and the entire idea. The crowd is laid back and easy going- classy but not snobby. Enough chairs and tables for everyone. I will absolutely be back.

UhYYT7VPI_K5O3JJ06UZog.review_text: Tasty drinks made with REAL fruit, reasonably priced, chill atmosphere, snacks provided some nights of the week....I love this place!!    The only two cons that come to mind are the parking---it can be difficult at times (street parking), and that they don't accept credit/debit cards.  However there is an ATM inside.....

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text:
The entire time my friend Michael and I were walking to the bar, I kept saying "where?  where?" in the way that I mean that I think he's mistaken about the location and we need to go repark the car.  
  The Lion Pub is discreetly located on a corner (now that's a feat - try hiding yourself on a corner sometime) in Pac Heights.  You walk in to what feels like either a store or residence, and suddenly you are in a rattan-chair, plant-laden bar with a fireplace - like some old tropical club on a cruise ship in the 1930's.
  While it no longer is exclusively a gay bar, it definitely maintains the spirit.  I felt it right when we walked in, from the disco ball to the dance soundtrack being played at 5:45pm.  When you compare it to a pub such as Ireland 32 for example, the difference is night and gay.
 (Sorry, I couldn't resist!). It somehow manages to pull off being both an upscale and comfortable neighborhood bar, like where interior decorators might meet their business owner friends after a long day to kick up their well-heeled heels and have a stiff drink.  My kind of place!
  The fruit mojitos are delicious and divine.  And I am not usually one to support a drink that deviates too much from the original - but these are not to be missed.   The fresh fruit is muddled in the glass along with the mint, so the flavor is distributed throughout.   We knocked back 3 different varieties:  Strawberry Mango, Blueberry Pineapple, and Cantaloupe Pomegranate.  YUM.  They go down easy, and they're only $8.00, so pace yourself.
  The bartender was very nice and accommodated my request to play a certain Tosca track that I love and they had on their rotation.  It's not even my neighborhood and I felt like I was being treated like a regular.  Nice.
  My review is only based on one visit, on a Friday evening, so I cannot comment on the crowds or different experiences on different days/nights.  But how about I go back an few times and check it out, just for the sake of accuracy and consistency.  It's no problem, really. And I think there might be a few more mojitos that I need to try as well....

evQA8xLN4oncMEjH5PBDJQ.review_text: Great on weeknights. Can be over crowded on weekends.  If you like fresh fruit with your mixed drinks, this is the place to go because they are TASTY! I like to sit at the bar, order a screwhound (fresh grapefruit, fresh orange, vodka) and watch them squeeze the juice into my glass through a huge old-school crank powered stainless steel metal juicer.  It also doesn't hurt that they've got a free cheese and crackers spread, although if you're going to eat some, I'd go earlier in the night before dozens of other fingers have touched it all.  Decent music is usually playing, bartenders are friendly, there are tables to sit at, and the lighting is just right.    Also, don't forget it's cash only!

DAf3UOAONCpgETWlNTERKg.review_text: When it comes to cheese, all rules of social propriety fly out the window, and I have no shame. If you're a friend of mine, you know that I'm lactose intolerant...but I regularly indulge in defiance of Mother Nature and chomp chomp, poot poot away (but don't worry, only the ones I love are lucky enough to witness the latter). Where was I, reviewing a bar? Oh yes, well Lion Pub is infamous for its FREE spread of cheeses, dips, and the like. It is also known for its use of fresh fruit (strawberries, grapefruit, orange, etc) in its cocktails. But damn, those drinks are trop cher! Ang mahal! Nearly $10 per drink. Yeah, it's yummy, pulpy goodness, but with this little breathing room it's difficult to fully appreciate it. The seating is group friendly, set up like someone's backyard patio complete with wicker furniture. The vibe is reminscent of a random college party - young, loud, hot, sweaty.  I probably wouldn't choose to come here on my own, but I will not protest if I've already had a "successful night,"  am hungry, and don't give a crap what other people think about me hovering around the food table.

A3tEi-379Vq0e9z-SOytwQ.review_text: Yes, I will grant that I loved the fruity mojito. So much that I had two more on an empty stomach and was feeling no pain by the time the bar started filling up with former frat boys ("I'm in IB these days...") and their incredibly primped and glossy-lipped dates. I'm either getting old or getting snobby or both, but I just liked it better in the early evening when it was a quiet neighborhood bar.   Reading the other reviews made me realize what a total germaophobe I am because I would never have eaten anything off the fruit and cheese plates. I thought I saw the former frat boys picking up pieces of food and then putting it back. Was the last thing they touched before they touched that piece of cheese their own penis? Or the germ-covered bathroom door? Or the body of a drunken Marina girl, also in the men's bathroom? Yeah, so, no public food for me.

cvkLinqobaKn4jAh-SHS6w.review_text: You started out a 5.  Then you let the Marina Flunkies in.    But I still give you high marks because of the mojitos.  Fresh squeezed lime is a plus.  And when I am lucky enough that a girl wants to buy me a drink... sometimes I get to have a strawberry mojito without feeling too guilty about it.

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: Two words: Grey Hound! Fresh squeezed grapefruit, so this drink is their specialty.  I like the layout of this spot, with plenty of space and tables good for groups.   Nice to have in the 'hood. Cash only.

vjWMEJblrrCGFW7D8FiWQQ.review_text: After a few late nights at work, I needed a drink. My friend suggested this place because it's known for their drinks and it's something new for us to check out. When I walked in all I saw was polo shirts, sweater vest with collars, holy shit....... I blend in! Instead of having one, I ended up having four, It must be the fresh squeezed juices! Usually I'm strictly a Jack and coke type of guy, but this time I got adventurous.   My drinks:  -basil gimlet (excellent)  -mint julep (ok)  -some sort of passion fruit concoction (I'll admit it, I liked it)  -forgot the last one, but it gave me a bitter beer face.   After 2 drinks, I was fiending for another one, before heading up to the bar I asked my friend if she wanted a 3rd screw hound (orange/grapefruit juicd/vodka), her eyes lit up with a kiddish nod and a slight smile, she was super adorable..., she must of loved her juice boxes when she was little. As for my other friend, he ONLY drinks captain, but he caught me off guard and ordered a watermelon vodka, not 1 but 2....WTF!   Just what I needed on a Thursday night! Come here for the spiked juices and listen to some great tunes!

j0QzHCYxlOp_8KqSqopyHg.review_text: Real fruit in their drinks. Yea, it's pretty bomb.

maEDOyw7sL9vaCGeKW_iog.review_text: I like the fact that this place is sort of tucked away and doesn't draw the suckerfish.  But the seating sort of bums me out...I actually like the interior - nice wood, fireplace, plants, etc. - but the arrangement of the damn wicker chairs & tables serves to isolate people.  It sort of makes the place feel like a restaurant that's stayed open after regular hours, instead of a decent bar.

VGp0bf9vQWKOxgS4XvOpDA.review_text: If you're not with Mojito in hand you are missing out.  This place seems quiet because it's in an obscure, hidden off the the chestnut & fillmore st foot traffic, area but damn it's pretty bumpin...really crowded on  typical fri/sat nights but must say it's a great crowd. Non douchey, non hipster over load, just ppl there to have a good time. Parking isn't that bad if you look more residential not on Divis and don't mind walking like 3-4 blocks.   If you don't want to have an extreme night out but don't want to be lame at  home... LIONS PUB is one of my solid spots of choice. don't mess it up!

AKy1Ds72r0YrToNTwlnK2Q.review_text: Had a great time last week.  This was my first time there!! I asked the Gorgeous Bartender what to order.  He made me the most amazing Watermelon Vodka drink!   It was crushed up watermelon and vodka.  What more could you ask for.  Cute place.  On the small side, but good to go on a weekday.  I could see this place getting super busy on a weekend.

5_XikCbJ2jZ8u248e0Wzug.review_text: They have free food!!!  I will say it again... they have free food!!!  They also have booze, which means this place meets all of my requirements.

WkBSBfRRloP6QFH7O8I5dg.review_text: Gotta love this place...on the corner of Divisadero & Sacramento, this little Pac Heights neighborhood bar is  a local favorite for my friends and I.  The place is very cozy with a fireplace, sit-down tables and full bar area.  Decor is nice with lots of plants & not overly glamorized.  Bar staff is the best in SF at making awesome drinks and just being low-key & nice.  Though I'm usually more of a Rum or Jack&Coke kinda guy, I have to say that this is the one place where I'll just order their specialty mixed drinks...they're simply that good.  Best thing on their arsenal is easily the Strawberry-Mango Mojito (where they grind up actual fresh fruit & mint).  Crowd here definitely varies.  On weekend nights after 9pm, the place is zoo-like and literally packed to the brim with Marina-esque individuals.  Weekday nights are completely the opposite and totally chill...actually a good place to have normal-volume conversations & stick around for their complimentary cheese table.  Since this is one of my fav SF bars, I'm probably a little biased...so go check it out and you be the judge.

s4U_v9NQVVaYiLdXmPk2bA.review_text: When I lived close by, this place was one of my regular haunts. Now that I moved across town I'm kind of happy I'll never go there again. That said, it is a nice place and worth visiting if you like the Marina/Union Street crowd.  The staff is very nice as is the decor. The drinks are also pretty good (try a greyhound) and they often have free snacks. My main rant about this place is that it gets inundated after about 11pm and the layout is not very conducive to moving around.   Everyone I know calls this place Lion's Den.

3UzVsIOwGAQr6wS6GXW_zw.review_text: Absolutely love the fresh squeezed fruit that goes into their drinks- it makes all the difference!  Nothing beats a peach vodka with fresh peach- so simple, I really don't understand why this isn't more common at other bars in the city.  This bar is not pretentious, it doesn't even have a sign outside.  More so, it's super easy to miss with all the shrubs and trees hiding the building!  Still, it's packed like a can of tunas on weekday nights- you're lucky if you snag a table.

Q_8qAEFkzrzTVAJhLsxmBg.review_text: Ah, Lion Pub. Their greyhounds and mojitos are my drinks of choice, depending on my mood of course. The first time I came here I was very deceived, though- the second time I arrived I was a little surprised to discover the place wasn't as big as I originally thought.   I first came on a busy Thursday night, and those mirrors tricked me into thinking there was a whole other side! I know... I know. I have done this before, only at a store in the Haight. (see my pictures to capture the essence of my experience). Sigh.   Alas, the next time I came here it was far less packed and I was able to properly interpret the decor. It's a great hang out to chat with friends on a slow night- the music is 100% excellent as well. My friend and I had a greyhound there last night and had to fight back yawning- the cozy environment, chill music, and dim lighting was the perfect night cap.  The cheese freaks me out, though.

wqoXYLWmpkEH0YvTmHBsJQ.review_text: My local bar.   You should definitely go here, the drinks are really tasty especially the grey hound. They juice the fruit in front of you. Little known fact, Lion Pub was the first gay bar in the city, but it isn't much of a gay bar anymore. It's mostly a mix of pac heights and marina now. If you come late on a Friday/Saturday it will be packed with little room to move around. It's still always has good energy and the bar tenders do a good job getting everyone drinks.   Overall 5 stars and it's spitting distance to my place.

SEoAIVVZvnCK2igoKK1XLQ.review_text: mmmm.  The greyhound is an awesome drink.  I have only been here on a Saturday night and it did get crowded very fast (mind you, this was not my crowd - a little too Marina).  Want to check it out again on a weeknight and definitely need to see what that strawberry mojito is all about - yum!  One star away as this place is CASH ONLY.

zm_4SRc9DJfdko1lIIwWrA.review_text: Neighborhood bar-- I like having it here, but I wouldn't go if I couldn't walk there.  Best thing: I ordered "chocolate cake" not knowing whether it was a dessert or a drink and got something that blew my mind. It was completely clear and transparent liquid (indistinguishable from water or vodka), yet the smell and taste were like I was eating a big brown slice of cake. It's crazy. What a fantastic drink! You've gotta try it. The other fruity drinks ordered were very good as well, fresh.  Worst thing: Crowded with people, couldn't get in the door at first because of people standing and smoking literally right in front of the door, couldn't get to the bar, couldn't find a place to stand (forget about sit).. which was awkward. The music was kinda fun but not good enough to dance to.  I got the distinct impression that everyone there was either still in college or trying to act like they were. A bit of a strange experience.  So, go, but only for drinks. Then spend your night somewhere else.

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: How have I not written a review for Lions Pub yet?! My friends took me here the night of my 21st birthday and I was officially introduced to the best mojitos ever and a cute little bar.  While Lions Pub is a little out of the way for me, I will definitely go there if I want a freshly made mojito. The bartenders really take their time making them and only use fresh ingredients. The regular mojito and strawberry mojito are amazing. YUM. They also have a table set up by the bar with different kinds of cheese and crackers. Double YUM.  They also play some pretty good music and I love the decor - its fun to watch people sit and take pictures with the lions, heh.   It does get crowded so get here a little early to get a table.

E4SfIfuU0H3RtDKwDvc_Uw.review_text: The whole bar is decked out in leafy, fragrant flower arrangements. Wait, I can't tell if the flowers smell, because I'm overwhelmed by the aroma of mint, staple of that mojito drink all the cool kids reportedly partake of. Mint smells fresh, so once I settled in, I felt as clean and crisp as freshly ground spices despite the fact that I had been drinking since the middle of the afternoon and had just come off of Muni. Hester's blueberry and pineapple concoction definitely had a whiff of the healthy, so I stuck to my boyfriend, Jack Daniels. Unfortunately, my man cost me a disproportionate amount to the volume of him in my glass. But I guess that's what happens when your boyfriends come in bottles.

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: Since Tataki was just down the street from the Lion Pub, we decided to stop in for a drink. Walking in made me feel like we were in India or somewhere exotic in the 20's, without the malaria or rattlesnakes, which shouldn't really bother me considering my 99 year old great-grandmother used to kill them with her bare hands in the middle of the desert by herself, all standing at 4'11''.   The place was almost empty, save a couple people at some tables, and a few extra spots at the bar, and the bartender informed us that it was happy hour ALL NIGHT for beers, YAY! One Stella, please!  Oh look, free cheese plate that doesn't look questionable! :)

--rpFxc_x14BWF708pfR6Q.review_text: I really love that they put fresh fruit in your drinks, it makes them taste a little more refreshing.  They are a little expensive so if you're tight on cash this might not be the place for you.  Atmosphere was nice, it was a bit crowded on a Friday night and def not a place to really talk to someone.  However it's nice for groups (not too huge though) and the place isn't stuffy so it's great for a fun night out with friends.

DSakdjejUJY9sn3eaUyezw.review_text: Love this place!   Different vibe here for sure. Dark and kind of dive bar-ish but that is a good thing to break the monotony of your everyday bar scene.  I would take a cab to this bar any day to enjoy a couple of the fresh squeezed grey hounds. Try the blood orange grey hounds too - so good.  At one time they had a huge spread of cheese and crackers - didn't see it last time though.

J4sv-OKmwoCE1YmMLdhKog.review_text: Lion Pub made me realise something. Australians don't fresh-squeeze Grapefruits. No wonder you guys love this stuff so much!! I had seen fellow 'Friscan friends order a drink referred to as a Greyhound (grapefruit juice + vodka) and thought it was a little odd...until I was given one here. The grapefruit juice is perfectly sweet/tart and fresh - a drink I adored here but would never order at home again in Melbourne. Which for me was kind of perfect for my trip here. I do love to adopt local culture in cities I visit and step outside my home life.   My friends and I sat at the bar and were able to hear each other audibly, having a good time and enjoying nice drinks. The service was a tad lax at times, but overall we had a really great time and were far from disappointed with our drink orders.  I'd come back again, 100%. But I might be scroogey with my tips unless I get a bartender that is a little more attentive.

b4sh3USeRiUQJY3y83b12w.review_text: You know, it's kinda near my house. So good place to go to walk and meet a friend for a quick drink. And it is pretty, cute little disco globe, fireplace, lions (of course). But... hmmm... not my scene I guess.  I'd say go, check it out, and bring company so if the scene ain't for you at least your got your peeps. Lots of men picking up on you if you are a lady. Which for some is a good thing (I find it annoying personally).  They make a good Greyhound cocktail. They gave me one for free on the house as a welcome to the neighborhood when I first moved.

hp9fXNWVkX3oT3xvutpGRA.review_text: I went to Lion Pub last night for my birthday and aside from the one bartender with the curly hair acting like a total jerk to several of my friends I had a fun time. The other bartenders were quite friendly and didn't roll their eyes after being told that the drink order was incorrect.

3BgbiJckxpz2_smN3dKSyQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite bar's in the city. I wouldn't say its that great of a place to hang out with the boy's but its a nice place to go with a friend or that special some one. I've never been a fan of fruity foo foo drinks but they use fresh fruits at this place and I could drink a Greygoose greyhound all night. The bartenders are friendly and I like the crowd. It's a younger hip crowd. You will find younger financial district peeps as well as college student types. They get packed starting Thursday night so i like going on Wednesday when it's lively but not as packed. Make sure you bring cash because they don't take credit.

m_JlNBv_lkFplkUoi8TyJQ.review_text: Been coming to lions pub for years and really enjoy the Mojitos and the always delicious cheese tray which has often been a complement to the liquid dinner.  Although this place can get crowded on the weekends they have a great staff of bartenders who don't mind muddling mint.  If it gets too crowded inside take a step outside to cool off...if you're there on a Friday there is a cool new doorman named Jesse who you may be able to convince to sing you (or your lady) a song.  don't forget to bring some green...this place is cash only.

qethMNVnmuHd1I4on52Hhw.review_text: Well, looks like I found another place that specializes in fresh fruit cocktails: my absolute favorite kind of cocktail EVER!   I had one strawberry mango mojito and one screwhound....which was made with FRESH SQUEEZED grapefruit juice! WOW this was good! You COULD NOT taste the vodka!!! Need I say more? If I hadn't needed to drive home later that night I could have put away quite a few of these!!!  There were also some great looking guys hanging out in here on a friday night, although they were all a bit too clean-cut for my taste...If they could've just grown out a beard or something along those lines...and hey, not that I was looking! but ya know...just FYI.  My BFF just moved into a place a few blocks from here...so I have a feeling it's going to become a regular spot which I am extremely excited about!!!

DOHhSb9e46xhPYHB7BIEiw.review_text: First time in San Francisco some friends brought me to this place.  First off, this place is definitely in the cut (off the beaten path).  If you don't know where this place is it will be hard to find.  However, thats what I like about this place.  The decor makes you feel like you're in a cave of sorts.  I guess you just have to take it for what it is.  The music sounded as if it was playing on an iPod shuffle list, but given the some what early time we went in, this can be forgiven.  I was told this is a pretty active spot amongst locals, and as we were leaving people began to trickle in.  I don't know why more places don't have a fruit press for juicing fresh juice.  The mojitos here are freshly squeeze, and that makes ALL the difference.  Really good variety of flavor combinations.  If you want a great mojito/margarita, find this place and order up. Cheers.

YiOKNwVM2yRFCYZj6f7kDw.review_text: Fresh fruit drinks are no joke. They are so tasty here and the drink combos are pretty creative. The fireplace is another plus, but it's dark, the bathrooms are gross and I can never find a table. Worth a visit though!

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Interesting crowd here on the night I went.  Nice enough bar, good drinks.  They are known for their delicious mojitos.  They offer snacks for patrons, things like crackers and cheese (yum), 7 layer bean dip, salsa, hummus.  Anyhow, the sketch part about this bar were the people I saw there.  One drunk couple was totally making out next to my group (I'm talking heated breath, tongue and all).  There were some thug-ish guys hanging out by the bar.  When I walked by with my girlfriends (pretty buttoned up Pac Heights gals), they said something like, "Woe, look at all the hoes in here tonight."  I laughed.  Um, hoes in a button up cardigan?  To each their own.  I probably would have had more fun if I were more intoxicated.  However, fun place to come with friends and just have a great jolly time.  Nice orchids.

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: + fresh squeezed fruit in alcoholic drinks...YUM! I got the fresh peach with vodka. delicious.

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: How about a 3.5 star here.  I came here on a thursday night recently.  The crowd was nice and very friendly.  The staff was awesome...they even had cheese out for the patrons here.  But how in the world can you be cash only.  Being my first time here and meeting up some friends.....let's just say I was trying to buy a round and the bartender says cash only.  Eh what can I say....thanks girls for getting this round.  I'll be sure to stop by the bank for some cash before I come here again.

n-eYeIpSTiKhoDeubO1mmA.review_text: Going to the Lion Pub is like an online date.   You look her up, and everything seems to be in order. She's apparently into decent music, appreciates good drinks, and likely puts out. (Sorry, couldn't find a good analogy for ATM on premises.)   Visually, she's gorgeous. Dark features, looks great in moody lighting, has an air of openness about her.   You check out the zip code and go, Hey, I can walk there! Things sound pretty good if things work out.   So you meet. The first impression is good. In fact, it's great. She's not only good looking, but she does indeed have an inoffensive music collection, and she can put down some stiff-ass drinks, even if you have to wait a little while between them to keep a proper pace.   This could be good, you think. Will it be something regular?   Then after an hour or so, the hideous personality flaws come out. The pretentiousness. The high-pitched squeals you can't stand. You find that when night falls, she surrounds herself with jerkwad guys and airheaded girls.   There's only one thing you can do. RUN! SAVE YOURSELF!   Such a shame, because she looked so hot on the outside.

7CWRoP0f4TLwRkYR5syiqQ.review_text: Cougar town baby. I didn't stay long, but I heard this was the cougar spot and it definitely was for the short time I was there.

NlrmR5RgQutT1Nngb-Driw.review_text: As someone else wrote, this place is douchebag central.  When it was still a gay bar in the 90s, it was filled with gay douchebags.  Now that it's the post-frat clubhouse, it's filled with straight douchebags.  Your chances of getting a blowjob from a member of the same sex in the bathroom remain the same.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: The drinks are yummy, the place was overly packed, rude ass lawyers getting all up in my space, you know who you guys are! I socked you a few times  and told you you are RUDE! Besides that, I am a huge fan of the fresh squeezed drinks and I was too full for cheese but nice touch! Bleh, for the crowd, but fun place with good friends

36MiqVe8V1zsp_FmqhCEBw.review_text: this place rocked!  also visited during the mac 'n cheese tour... obviously no mac here, but my friends wanted me to see this place.  like everyone else has said, fresh squeezed juices mixed in to your favorite drink!  also had good music, fun vibe, and a cheese and cracker table set up.  my friend enforced his "no crackers on the tour" policy when he noticed i stored a couple crackers for the road in my back pocket.  he promptly punched me in the ass-pocket, and i spent the rest of the night pulling crumbs out of my pants, but i digress...  a definite contender for my favorite SF bar i've visited to date...

tRMMRfpbMnkJEV__QmpK7g.review_text: Ok so I'm actually old enough to remember when the Lion used to be a gay bar.  God love the few sweet older gents who still sidle up to the bar and stake their claim to history.  Other reviewers are dissing the teeny-bopper/OC crowd.  This is  a problem at certain hours, yes.  Solution?  We avoid the Lion at peak times and go early - when we're ending our day early and want to hang out with a really good mojito or margarita.  Very good bar.  Not cheap, but good.  I'd avoid the free food because you have to go when it's crowded.  Enjoy the Lion for its moody atmosphere in the earlier hours or during the week.  There are SO FEW neighborhood places with real atmosphere that says "honey, park your pretty self and stay..."  I do so like that.  Why not 5 Stars?    Cash only.  Ugh, ugh, ugh, ugh....  There's only one reason to be a cash only bar and it's all about the IRS and not about your customers.  I'm a big believer in accommodating customers but hey - the original owner (!) has figured out what works for him.  Trouble is - it DOES stop us from "just dropping by" without thinking about it.  I'd go several times a month if they took credit.  They don't so -  I don't.  But a good, atmospheric space if you're early and have cash.

KFaUuuvfw-6rAbTzuYwU0g.review_text: 3.5 this place offers free cheese and crackers. they also have a variety of drinks that uses fresh fruits that are squeezed right when you order. Some notable names were the grey hound, screw hound, and the kobe shot. The prices of the drinks are around $8 so about avg.   Your average bar with a twist in fruit flavor. The drinks are kinda weak though. I would consider coming back especially if its during their happy hour 4-730 to try out their other drinks, but I dont really want to pay full price.

WSvMUpT3z8iy49FfMv80tA.review_text: Personally I think other reviewers are being generous.  9 bucks for a mojitos.  Now i know, that shit has fresh fruit and other crap like that, but come on, 9 bucks! If that expensive of a drink doesn't give me an orgasm, it at least better get me drunk.  I am aware that 9 bucks for a cocktail in SF isn't too high these days.  Still doesn't justify it though if you ask me.  Too many  yuppies too.   On the other hand, beer was no more than other places.  Free cheese and crackers is a nice touch too.

nu4NZLFnJ57TIIwSsXd33w.review_text: i was here for a mellow Saturday night. enjoyed myself but wasn't overly impressed. the bar irradiates a casual, cool bar aura, and perfectly captures what its striving for.   there is some sort of elaborate press to make a widely popular drink, and for the most part, bar service is pretty snappy.  a sweet compliment to the experience was the free variety of cheeses offered to the patrons. this gave my rating an additional star, and left my tummy with a smile.

7UjCWqU3ntqoDN8Smtpx_w.review_text: Lion's pub is a perfect "hidden" bar on  Divisidero if you're ever in Lower Pac Heights. It's right on the corner of Sacramento Street and looks like a house on the outside.   I came here on a Wednesday night when it was pretty empty at 10 pm. I had a greyhound where they used fresh grapefruit and it was perfectly mixed. The beer selection is a little small, but the mixed drinks and happy hour specials make up for it.   I also came on a Saturday night and it was packed. It's not ideal for large groups as the space is cramped and the bar area is overwhelming, but the atmosphere is amazing.

aJrnB9XN_kHvWvZzQoUAPg.review_text: I'm just sad my favorite gay bar in SF has been taken over by straight people. It was always welcoming to occasional straight patrons (which I appreciated) but reading these reviews, those days seem to be gone. Ce la vie. I'm happy the bar is still there at least and being enjoyed by people from all over the world and especially the locals... but I have to shed a tear for days gone by.  One myth I'd like to dispel - Lion Pub was NOT the first gay bar in San Francisco.

dBrFv8iwboVNxE5hX74EVQ.review_text: I'm not normally a fan of dark little neighborhood bars (avoiding the term "dive") but this is a sweet little spot offering a most delightful and surprising variety of drinks...and...okay, on-the-house artisan cheeses and crackers. Cheerio!  Their drinks range from the standard Greyhound, Screwdriver, etc. to the exotic fresh fruit margaritas and mojitos. I had a peach margarita and a cantaloupe margarita, with lots of fresh fruit and even MORE tequila (yowza that bad boy had some bite!). My sister and my friend sipped on strawberry mojitos. All our drinks were about $9 each, which was a score considering how yummy they were. I also spotted a li hing margarita on the menu, which I'm totally intrigued by. I love li hing dried mango, but not sure about a li hing cocktail. Someone please tell me if this is a green light!  In terms of personas, there seems to be a high number of man-packs that frequent this bar. As in, lots of dudes. I read in another review that these are "OC rejects" but in my eyes, I would say typical San Franciscans. A colorful mix of normal, bad, and just plain weird outfits on a wide range of body types. But overall, lots of dudes.  Oh, and the cheese-and-crackers hoarding is so entertaining to watch. I'm just sayin!

WJnEifJRkI6bCH2iw8brFg.review_text: Easy going neighborhood bar... no dress code, plenty of seats, fresh ingredients (bartenders don't roll their eyes when you ask for a mojito, they even suggest fresh blueberries!)... 100% recommended if you're looking for an fun nite out without the hassle.

mUzcG-qHkXdKKytv6zZ1Gg.review_text: One of my favorite spots. The drinks are so good! All bars should really use fresh fruit and fruit juices, but most don't. That's what makes their drinks great. The prices are standard for everything. We always get some strawberry mojitos to start, and have the bartenders mix us up whatever they want.   I'd say like 80 or 90% of the time it's full of cute guys, and the guy to girl ratio is definitely in our favor. That being said, there have definitely been a few off nights, but the drinks are still good so who cares!   I haven't gone during the week, but I've been meaning to. I hear they have a decent happy hour.

_Xt-1-GcOYJ8SaOrCGKxyg.review_text: Ok, this review is going to be inspired by laura b.'s syllogism talk thread.  I don't like crowded places. Lion Pub is crowded weekend nights. Therefore I don't like Lion Pub on weekend nights.  Ok this syllogism was not funny, unlike some of the ones yelpers came up with.  But I think you get my main point.  Go on a weeknight, or earlier on the weekend.  Get a drink made with fresh squeezed juice and chill by the fire.

Fyp5rxbzoWQwm0z2gW3w5g.review_text: It's a rare treat when you can find a bar that combines the perfect elements of low-key and "happening" without being overly populated with a horde of SF socialites looking for the next meat-market. To me, this place walks the line almost perfectly. Its non-descript exterior and its low lights and jungle type foliage inside combine with numerous nooks and corners that not only allow semi-privacy but possible eating of their free hor de'vors without catching an elbow from a passing patron.  The drinks are tasty too--they use fresh juices when they can, squeezing them in front of you when you order, which makes their greyhounds worth twice what they charge (I remember them being rather reasonably priced). I must had consumed 6 my last visit and it was the drink to have of the lot. Service is friendly and prompt without being overbearing and impatient.   Overall a great experience and well recommended.  I have been a number of times, going back because of how much I enjoy it. The non-perfect score is for the bathrooms, which can be a disaster. I am not one to complain, typically, but they are out-dated and overused. This was likely due to a rather large Friday crowd, when they come.

2iTwlNlEGXHsOW9trFK8gg.review_text: Went on a Thursday night. Free delish cheese and crackers and nice ambiance (mellow, low light, fireplace).

UWN-IXDJNqE3Ldl2lJY76w.review_text: Looks like a secluded corner house in Pac Heights. Drive by too fast, or hell, even walk by too fast and you would miss it. But GO.  Inside, it's hip and dark, and looks like the downstairs floor from the Munsters TV show. They use real fruit and real fruit juices for the drinks.How freakin cool is that? So yes when it's busy, expect that it will take your poor bartender a bit longer to make your drink. I mean, you will see him mash an orange or even some raspberries or something! But remember, it's for your benefit.  It's nectar from the Gods.  The prices are on point. It gets super crowded after 8 or so on weekends. The kind of crowded where the guy at the door can't even open it without hitting someone standing just inside. And yes, you will get the DBag Marina dudes with button downs of course. But who cares. Ignore them and deal with it. It's not as bad as say, Balboa Cafe.  Stop by. Sooooooo worth it. Bring an out of towner and you will inevitably hear...."GOD, I LOVE San Francisco! You guys are so cool."  Thanks! We know!

l0I8QAnHJoLhEozrFilONg.review_text: You ever notice how about 66% of bartenders in trendy, straight-ish SF pour-stations are chicks, usually lookers? The rest, nominally male, can reasonably be expected to exhibit at least one of the following traits:  A) skilled mixologist  B) charismatic raconteur C) so good-looking and magnetic I turn on a heel (saying "eep") and leave as I know I will be invisible to all potential lady loves within his immediate hot zone D) better looking than meself at the barest minimum  Let's see, our fella yesterday was a remedial mixologist (mojito, check! he makes with it tonic water...huh!?!), a mid-level grump, had reverse magnetism and the grown-out remains of a prison haircut. All kitted out in laundry day togs. That said, his immediate replacement was a looker AND a skilled bartendress. Two in my group each picked a bartender with the lovely night shift braumaiden mixing Yelper X a fine, friendly drink as Yelper Y waited with her teeth in her mouth for guytender to notice her that she might order a Manhattan that he could put ginger ale in. And Yelper Y was a cute chick fer fooks seck!    And know ye this, if I can't be plied with honeyed words, inexpensive drinks or red lipstick on a near-sighted girl who snorts a little when she laughs, laying out a platter of various cheeses is the easiest way to get me to shill for you. Lion Pub did this. About a yard and a half of cheeses. Yet still I whinge about their inequities.  As Agent J's Law Of Saloon Douchery begins to takes effect (wherein, if you're not starting to fall in love with a bar during a Friday happy hour, by 9:30 you'll want the joint to have a single, collective hinder with your funky feet kicking it like Bob Fosse) I try to step outside for a breather. Packed ass to nuts, I can barely squeeze my way to the door. One gigantic douche ignores my "excuse me" AND my "beg pardon", both uttered with the civility of Bugs Bunny at the cinema. So I pass him, without a body check, but one needed to pass and he clearly wasn't The Quality. He turns and gives me that incredulous look that greazy haired yuppie fleas like him always do when ired. The one that says, "Brah, WTF?" and has all the legitimacy of OJ pretending the gloves are tight. To his wordless protest I said "I excused myself and begged your pardon. Dude." Somehow this rattled the ox and he stepped aside.   I won't be back soon, as it was not my kind of joint at all. Subjectively, I freely admit. Bog-Standard drinks, rather pricey. The nail-bound ladies. The above ox and his brethren, in no short supply. Whitey. But that was some mighty fine cheese.

FNcaFDTiv4muY8Z2QMdQUw.review_text: I miss the old days of this place when it was a gay bar.  Thats right it used to be a gay bar.  No longer, now its full of straight preppie guys wearing the standard black shirt and jeans trying to pick up on chicks.  It used to be a fun place to pop into before or after Rassella's jazz club across the street (which is now in the Fillmore and seems to have lost it soul).  Went to the Lion's Pub recently and it was still a nice cute place, but seems to be a pick-up bar just like any other now.

8-cYaX4GPkH3EtEeGfVNIQ.review_text: I dont get what are so good about the mojitos...yeah they put fresh fruit in it but for $9 I would hope they do. They were pretty good and dtrong but the fruit also takes up most of the glass. The bartender seemed like he was trying to be snobby, but maybe not. I went right when they were opening and they didnt seem to pleased we were there right then as they were opening. I might go back, but it wont be my idea to go if I do end up there.

JseBksW8DVL596kJ18GGpA.review_text:
Being a leo, I was already primed to love the Lion Pub. I thought I was just there on a special night when I saw the cheese and other treats in the grubbin spread. Like maybe I came in right after a dot com party or something, but no, it's there every day! G Bar has cheese as well, but really gross, hard squares that I'll only touch if my liquid dinner needs supplementing to prevent me from falling on my face. And Sugar Lounge has free warm food, but it's all pretty gelatinous. Lion Pub acts like they're throwing a nice cocktail party for friends every night! 
  I had my 30th birthday party here and it was perfect. They let my DJ friends spin until the cops made us take it down a notch. The only thing keeping my review from 5 stars is that the neighbors really keep the place in check, noise-wise. I'm sure listening to music and conversations of smokers outside isn't fun, but it does make you feel like a high school kid at a busted party every time the cops show up. 
  I've been back recently just for happy hour and finally tried their greyhound with fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice and letmetellyou it is a downright refreshing way to start the weekend.

VeuwCtfmB4VyXWuUYbZp8w.review_text: Actually more like 1 1/2 stars for going here on a Saturday night.  If you are into wall to wall people pushing you to get from one end of the bar to the other end then this is the place for you.    I'm not sure why this is the venue of choice for group gatherings celebrating a birthday or a going away or out of town guests - it's way too packed with people trying to get something other than just a drink.  It's a nice enough bar, they have Stella on tap and the fruit mojitos are good.   I get nervous eating the snacks that have been out all night with people touching every piece so I usually don't partake in that activity.  I normally enjoy the fire place, but with a bazillion people in there you really don't need the additional heat.  Last comment for anyone reading this - really it's ok to say "excuse me" or "I'm sorry" when pushing your way through.  Do they not teach manners anymore?

550B-8-vghglND86h1GnjQ.review_text: I used to go here pretty often... until I built a memory of "point of no return"... (In my defense, I went there earlier than usual, i.e. there were a lot to drink)  If I were writing this a year ago, this place would be a solid 4-star place. Each side of decoration is unique, they might not blend well, but then you don't circle around as you drink.  and of course... the cheese and crackers... always helps my drinks. I think I noticed their cheese before cougars by the entrance. I was wondering why it was a LION PUB during my first visits.   They used to make good drinks, decent prices, and mostly good crowd. Some could be misbehaving, but there are always those people once in a while. But nevertheless, your eyes will be pleased more often than not.   But, music could be hard to hear, and often not so impressive.  But just last weekend, during my first visit in months, I had to get shitty drinks from a bartender who does not know how to make drinks including Tom Collins... and the dude was keep giving the drinks in wrong glasses! Everything was as I remembered, but damn, the drinks were big disappointments. If I get the same drinks again, I will give them 2-3 stars.

DWbcEKJDBR6vPaNxb00sgw.review_text: I finally made it to this place after reading all the reviews on Yelp. I wish I had started out my night here and stayed here. It seems like the perfect place for good friends to sit around a table and get completely trashed and tell crazy stories. You can probably walk out of here completely trashed for under 25 bucks. I didn't get to try the Greyhound because I was so wasted by the time I got there. Seems like a really chill place with a cool crowd and friendly people just getting sloshed. It's kind of like the marina meets the mission, so you get a bar that's a bit upscale without the attitude of one.

UuxiH2oLycDhMv7TKQ5EVw.review_text: A neat spot on Divis that serves some of the tastiest mixes of fruit and booze you will ever have, hands down.  The inside has a neat kinda "fern garden" thing going for it. Dark, cavey lounge kinda feel. Can get pretty crowded on a Fri or Sat after 10.   I really like getting a table in here and enjoying raspberry mojitos with friends. Yes, I said raspberry mojitos. That's what you're gonna order when you come here. Strawberry lemon drops, raspberry mojitos... the fruitiest, girliest drinks you can muster the courage to order. And they are awesome. There is no shame in ordering a drink that good! "Yes I'm sipping a Strawberry lemon drop from a sugar rimmed martini glass and I am comfortable in my sexuality!"  All their specialty drinks are made with fresh squeezed fruits of all flavors and the bartenders really take their time to make a quality product. You get what you pay for and prices for one of these little concoctions are kinda steep but hey, you can't put a price on a good Mango whos-a-whatsit.

vzNYQaFyBnIU_bBkJsUJQA.review_text: came on a friday.  my friend knows the bartender.  and i was in awe of what a sweet place it was.  nice dark interior that was overflowing with cheese, crackers, fresh fruit, delicious drool-inducing mojitos, and a ton of lively people.  did i mention the snackeroos are free?  i might come back on a less busy day next time though.

1vT-1gtksBsx14uKi7UsbQ.review_text: Never mind that I can't get the name of this place right. (I just want to call it Lion's Den or something like that.) Never mind that its facade is unsuspecting (and the entrance is actually on Sacramento, not Divisadero).   It's actually a pretty decent bar.  The menu is full of delicious cocktails that come from freshly squeezed fruit. Lemondrops actually come from lemons, and you can accent them with blueberrys, raspberries, etc. Combine that with the free cheese plate, and it equals a tasty night out.  It's a great place to bring a decent group of people for an after-work drink, as I recently did. Would it be a place that I return to often? Probably not, and that's based on the crowd that it attracts (being closed to Pac Heights, and all.)  I was surprised at the music being played (assumed it was a bartender's iPod) as it definitely had a gay twist on it. (And reading other reviews, it used to be a gay bar, so perhaps some things simply remain the same, for the better!)  All in all, an enjoyable place to start your night out in Lower Pac Heights.

DqvPZh-crUdz4vN4tuVw-Q.review_text: Went on a Tuesday night and the place was nearly empty, just the way I like a booze hole to be.  The pub is EXTREMELY dark with some sweet red lighting.  The darkness is both a plus and a minus.  Could get you into some trouble after a few greyhounds.    I was impressed and delighted by the fireplace, friendly bartender and fresh fruit to accompany the drinks.  Don't be a baby about the cash only, it is not that big of a deal.    Music was a great mix of hits and styles, kudos on Janet Jackson's "I want to rock with you" at the height of my buzz.   I usually do not venture out from booze n soda, but the pub has a really cool assortment of offerings.    Only reasons I could not give 4-5 stars was because the music was a bit loud and it was difficult to hear my gentlemen friend, and the bathrooms were so dark I could not peep my drunk face.

1oesrOIBYtaJUr2Ug5aioQ.review_text: It's only really worth coming here for the greyhounds. The fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice IS truly outstanding. That being said, the rest of the experience was rather mediocre. I wasn't thrilled with the service: the bartender didn't make eye contact at all and the only way I knew that he paid attention is because he came back with my drink.  I was here on Friday night around 11 and the place was so packed you literally couldn't move around. If you are claustrophobic in crowds of people (like me) then this is not the place for you. It's also quite the Marina crowd = not my scene.   I would definitely enjoy Lion's Pub on a less-crowded evening. For now, I'll stick with the dive bars in my neighborhood...

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: When I think of pubs, I usually think of the UK version of a pub but I guess that is not the case here. Regardless, Lion Pub has a nice atmosphere. There are plenty of places to sit (assuming its not packed) and music is entertaining as well. Bar is only cash which is kinda of a pain and funny enough they price drinks at like $4.50 as to $4 or $5. Not a big deal to me but I'd think bartender would wanna stop messing w/ coins with a bar full of people. On the other hand, if you are parked in meter parking, you know the register has a bevvy of quarters to change out.  i keep seeing people say 'fresh' drinks and I have no idea what that means. Alcohol doesn't exactly get 'old' aside from beer get skunky and not using real fruit or something in there mixed drinks. I feel like that's like saying  'fresh preserved food'. Kind of an oxymoron wouldn't you say? Anyways, great establishment.

WcKhdyAJd3YIRemYr6pAFA.review_text: Living in San Francisco, you have probably driven by this fine establishment many times without knowing it. It sits unmarked on a corner of Divisidero, so any time you drive this route through PacHeights, you are passing it. The Lion pub is a great place to chill out and drink on a week night (notice, I didn't say weekend, too crowded). They serve some fantastic drinks that aren't too expensive and there are plenty of tables and chairs to be had. The only thing I don't get is why they don't have a door on the men's bathroom.

hrbhaZ3LVI_QMXvRMgSP2Q.review_text: I first went to this bar with my boyfriend and a friend of his for my 26th birthday!  I must say that at first I did not know what to expect, actually just thought it was a regular bar but I was wrong and was pretty impressed by the fresh fruit drinks on their menu!  I had the strawberry mango mojito and the cantaloupe margarita. mmMmmMm...I went back here a 2nd time and realized they had free cheese and crackers, oh man, that hit the spot!  I've been meaning to come back since it has been months!  This bar definitely meets one of the top bars on my list!

fZcPESCG5UVCAchaVTwAHg.review_text: A strange mixture: The place is gorgeous inside. The drinks are expensive (but stiff). The cocktails are made from fresh fruit. Yet, the vibe is very frat-boy, with college radio tracks and barely 21 slobbering drunks. We even saw one girl give her boy a quick flash of the "girls". So, if this sounds like your kind of party, then Lion Pub is the place for you. For the rest of us, it's good for a laugh, and we can claim to get our daily fruit requirement with every drink, but that's about it.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text:
Fresh squeezed grapefruit juice for one of my favorites, greyhound.  It's not just that its squeezed, I like the juice squeezer they squeeze it with.  Its a big hefty machine and just one easy push down, and voila, fresh juice.
  Poleng does the same with same machine.

sinLZcwqvXAYLGM2aKHVcw.review_text: Best friggin greyhound I've ever had.  Suuuuper popular though, so it can be kind of a fat crowd.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: thanks to lion pub i feel like a train wreck today... and i look it. but that's ok, i realize when you play you pay. yep, finally checked out lion pub last night with new yelp friends megan w, jay h, stephen w.... and of course my dear friends amanda h., brian and deanna. what a great choice for happy hour! its really cute with a nice layout and plenty of room if you're with a group. there's a dark but intimate feel here and i can imagine myself wanting to come here on a cold rainy night.... i was in such a wild frenzy of drinking and talking i cant remember a whole lot about details of this place. although the fruity cocktails looked wonderful, i found myself sticking to a vodka tonic. in fact, i'm not sure what i was thinking when i started ordering doubles.... but painfully i will admit it that it led me to do some really embarassing karaoke later that night with my friends brian and deanna.... will i ever learn? haha. probably not. PS: oh, and I FINALLY GOT MY YELP SHIRT-- THANKS MEGAN : )

hSD2Lu8Z_62klnMDND5sSg.review_text: SUPER DUPER loud, and obnoxious people abound.

wzENY_T3jUPbYmPYkJfkNg.review_text: The Lion Pub has always confused me.  It was rumored to have been a gay bar, there's stories of secret rooms and floors (the floor above the bar is always suspiciously dark).  It's got a disco ball, but you'll never see anyone dancing there.  There's a fresh cheese plate every night, with some drunk guy with the munchies picking over the leftovers at the end of the nights  Lots of plants, and I've never really understood why owners put plants in bars.  Just invites cigarette buts and unwanted drinks.  You can go there on some random Thursday and it might be packed.  The next night it'll feel like a ski lodge bar out of season.  The doorman takes the ID checking duty pretty seriously even though the average age seems to be around 30.  The drinks however, are some of the best in the city.  They've got a nightly special always with fresh fruit.  And it's possibly the best greyhound I've had (fresh squeezed grapefruit).  And that would be the reason to go.  Well, that and you can stuff yourself on cheese.

bfV_6wJKldhVfdO8up660Q.review_text: Oh, Arshia. The coolest bartender EVER.   Recommend getting the greyhound which has freshly squeezed grapefruit juice right in front of your eyes!   Music on a Saturday night was top 40s.

kxhr5NtIxeJ-G6fy5uYwWQ.review_text: I can't really complain too much about a bar that features a) free cheese and crackers, and b) is only 2 blocks from my place.  Being from Wisconsin, the cheese is a real draw...just kidding, but after a few drinks, munchies are always appreciated.  There are plenty of seats, a cozy fireplace, and the drinks are reasonably priced.  I wish they had a more extensive beer selection, but I usually end up drinking some fresh fruity drink here anyway.

px2IZkW5G9-n6ueOT4Z6QA.review_text: I love Lions Pub!  The first time I drove by I new that was a spot I had to explore. The outside decor reminds me a bit of something from a Disneyland ride but whateves if you're sneaky enough you can ride one of the lions, and inside is super cozy - fireplace and all!  The Mojitos are amazing...literally I think you can get any type of fresh fruit drink here!  They are generous with the booze and the service is attentive.   There are snacks lying out but maybe it's the germaphobe in me... I'd steer clear.   It is cash only so make sure you hit up the ATM before going

sr5ThmDuk8daEADGWSzLyg.review_text: Thank you to the cute bartender who made my pear mojito.  Thank you to everyone I have met/talked to her for always being nice and not a rude asshole/douche.  Nice place, good music, good vibe, friendly ppl (still the annoying marina girl crowd though sometimes) but cute and relaxed.  Love this place. The End.

swqPgaC_wLtmVbCYxIpOqw.review_text: This place is fine. The best part is the fresh squeezed juices. It's a good spot to have as an option in the neighborhood but the crowd isn't great. It's super dark, and gets very crowded on weekends.

g4qdXv9tO5f-XxD2KVlKpA.review_text: This seems to be the perfect spot to go for what we needed: A girl's 26th birthday party where her main objective was to get herself and as many of her friends as wasted as possible.  That seemed to be the theme of the night too since when we got there, the reason we got seats by the bar was because the prior team at the bar had a girl (maybe the birthday girl?) that was so trashed she kept falling off her stool and they finally had to carry her out.  Yep.  All class in there.  Go there for the classy chix!  They are loaded with girl-friendly high-alcohol options.  Various fruity drinks, lots of WAY f***ed up shots .... They had shots for $7 that were basically a full shot of alcohol plus about two-thirds of a beer that you drop the shot into and chug the whole thing.  So you're pretty much chugging a beer and a shot at once.  Oh yeah, that sounds totally responsible to me.  give the designated driver two!   Anyway, I was in my own crowd there so I can't speak for the attractiveness of the other attendees.  passing glances were that they were acceptable without being knock over gorgeous people.  Seemed pretty lily white which is rare in the non-marina bars that I've been to.  So if you're into the young and caucasion and you're anxious to get with the wasted crowd then head over.  I will give it high marks for the décor and overall execution of what they are trying to do.  The location must be hard to attract people to but they've done a good job of creating an environment that brings in the young and lovelies.

s1DSkbdFEuO3ODbMWQqSvw.review_text: This place seems like it would be really amazing if I could even move around at all. Very marina-y (Pac Heights-y?), very crowded, but seemed like maybe on an off night it could be good. I'll keep trying.

M5eUNWQMrpHu8Hne1HzeJA.review_text: I find excuses to visit this bar!  Who can go wrong with free hors d'oeuvre's that hit the spot?!  It is a perfect place to cozy up on a cold night in SF, and enjoy the fireplace.  I have nothing bad to say about this place, but I wish they did not only accept cash.  Bartenders rock, drinks are delicious, and the music is bumping (in a good way).

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text: Beckoned by overflowing cheese platters and fruity mojitos, you would not believe the sheer volume of dumb, blonde Pac Heights bimbos frequenting this place in flocks, droves and gaggles on a weekend night.   (but me likey. me **really** likey.)

KBNceewFFeTK-vnv6Y-s7Q.review_text: The freshest of freshly squeezed juices for your drinks.  The bartender was flashing his bicep/tricep curl as he squeezed and pressed the fruit.  Happy Hour - 2 dollahs off your drinks  Complimentary snackity snacks - blocks (seriously 4 different cheeses the size of well...blocks), carrots, and a variety of crackers  Loungy and casual, no airs - I like.

HkKQnZd8jT8WtlJKH0X77w.review_text: Ok.  Cool space, good drinks.  Awesome mojitos.  BUT.  The cheese scares me.  Stay away from the cheese.

OC4flAEFeI-3NKv44HU39w.review_text: I used to come here all the time when I lived two doors away and loved it. I went last night with a bunch of people and it was DEAD, on a Saturday night! I now understand why.  The bartenders are assholes to their patrons. BIG MISTAKE. Let me clarify that I truly did nothing to deserve the attitude that I was given except for ask about an old bartender who worked there when I lived around the corner...Whatever I did, it's a service industry so grin and bear it dude. My money is as good as anyone else's and no bartender should make me feel differently. That's the last time I will be going there which is unfortunate because it's a cool spot.

Uqg8zgMw-JYJNpjVtFXqng.review_text: GO IF: you want to see/be seen, feel like a trendy, important Pac Heights woman, and if you want to get picked up DON'T GO IF: you like obscure, hole-in-the-wall places and want to avoid men at all costs  I agree with Aaron m. - the mojitos are fabulous.

gn7gPcHRlyOQ90RLtVYNsg.review_text: Hmmm. First off- I only go here at 5PM on Saturdays when it is completely  deserted. Based on the other reviews that seems to be wise. Also, I go with the distinct goal of drinking so many strawberry mojitos that I am wildly inappropriate. Since the target of my impropriety last time was the bartender, I'll be putting some time in at other places before my next visit. The drinks here are god's gift to fruity cocktails. It is on the 1 bus line. Sometimes a little sun comes in through the windows.

cwLmq5xN6AWi3fAIxMVxKQ.review_text: Drinks are quality and there is usually a cheese bar but unfortunately there wasn't one the last time I went.  Good prices but they only take cash (there is an ATM). Points off because there is a bad smell that hits you when you enter and it's super dark.  I like how it looks like a regular house on a block and it's kind of an oasis when you walk in.

ioAXfcirYv66SGMNQHi5Lg.review_text: Great fruity drinks.  My favorite is the strawberry mojito!

WO4ojAvstSzj7cQ42nV-Yg.review_text: The "Lion's Den" with with it's understated exterior and junglesque decor is the perfect neighborhood bar. While this pub doesn't have any happy hour prices because the owner believes in "giving freebies rather than lowering prices," it is a great place to spend happy hour with some friends. My friends and I grabbed a table in the corner by the fire, enjoyed some Coronas and margaritas, and had a great time scheming different ways to prank our friends. As the evening went on, more people trickled in but it was never overcrowded. We also enjoyed the fresh strawberries and watermelon left by the bar.  Definitely worth checking out earlier in the evening if you live in Pac Heights. AND later in the evening if you want to take advantage of their awesome and FREE cheese spread.

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: I want to like this place.  I went to the Lion's Pub last night for my roommate's birthday and I enjoyed the crowd despite it not being my usual.  Maybe I was just enjoying watching all the pretty people frolicking.  It seems to be draw a young and affluent demographic.    I walked in and my first thought was that the $25 in my pocket wasn't going to get me very far, but drinks were actually reasonable.  I picked up a Pyramid Heffeweizen for myself and a vodka-cranberry for Carla's boyfriend, and it was only nine bucks.  That's decent in my book, especially considering the sexy crowd, no cover at the door, and a ridiculous spread of food that came out around 11:30.  Great cheese plate and the rest of the buffet looked good too.  My big grievance is the bartenders.  What a bunch of putzes.  These guys ignore everybody they aren't hoping to sleep with, have minimal bartending skills, and are just generally slower than shit.  I lucked out on the second round and was able to order immediately, but twice it took almost ten minutes when they weren't busy and there were four or five guys working behind the bar.  At one point, a couple went to the bar to grab drinks and were gone so long that we thought they left.  Apparently, this place used to be a popular gay bar, still reflected in the mixed drink specials, but the straights overwhelmed the place and it seems to be a pretty heterogeneously hetero place.  I saw a mid-thirties male couple go inside and cruise back out within 25 seconds.  I'm guessing they hadn't been there in a while and it wasn't at all what they remembered.  So yeah, it's a nice spot to go with a group and the drinks are reasonable, but order in bulk because it will take you a while to get another round.

s6xZpSHNteqqsLzuC3Jd8A.review_text: Perfect for the health-conscious! This is basically a fresh-squeezed juice joint that doesn't use added sweetener. Who doesn't love the taste of straight-up vodka or tequila with a hint of fruit essence?   The cash only policy is annoying, but there's an ATM inside the bar.

LrvKFG_j93umkuctQwvLEA.review_text: I always have a great time here, whether its a quick happy hour cocktail, or a drunken reunion with friends, the night is a success. It probably has something to do with the lion. (Yes I have a picture on the lion.) It could also be the abundant fake plants, mirrors and gold combined with low lighting. Sort of a creepy deco jungle feel. You def can't take yourself too seriously in here and I love it. There is a great selection of fruit and juices that are fresh and super delicious and the bartenders are great at making recommendations. This is the only place I ever order "girly" drinks.   I could not write this review without mentioning the cheese display. Every time I have been here there are several different cheeses and crackers spread out for patrons to snack on. I love bar snacks. I dislike cheese. Sometimes I eat it anyways. A friend once stole a block of cheese from their display. I felt bad, but it was pretty funny to see her carry a big orange block of cheese home.

4XpJ4HKD5OQ3H5Gy330CkA.review_text: It's kinda hit or miss with Lion Pub.  The first couple of times, I think I quite enjoyed my visits.  Nice that they have the cheese and crackers to help absorb the alcohol.  Bartenders were friendly, talkative and serve up some yummy tasting mojitos.  The last two times I went, however, it was super packed and the bartenders weren't as friendly as before.    Dig the chill vibe...everyone just out to have fun atmosphere.  The tiki-like feel is off, but wonder if anyone even notices it.  Crowd is mixed in age, and a cross between the Marina and Mission folks.    During my last visit, I was forced to get another drink because the bartender said they ran out of Maker's Mark (for my Maker's ginger-ale).  I was bummed, but settled for a caipirnha which I enjoyed (though I've made better at home); very refreshing.  Later I noticed there was a bottle of Maker's Mark, and thought I'd comment to the bartender which later resulted in 2 free Maker's ginger-ales for me and my companion.  Sweet!    Decent default bar in the Pac Heights.  I think I'll stick to their specialty drinks while I'm there (i.e. mojitos).

FG_cmTqI_8CiM_nqGz4lsw.review_text: My first bad review. I usually don't bother posting bad reviews, but I couldn't resist. The one good thing about this place is that they make tasty cocktails, but who doesn't these days here in the city? The things that make this place so lame are the people that hang out there and the music. If you still like to party and act like you're in college, but you're 32, this is the bar for you. Music selection spinning through the airways was that of Top 40 and 80's-90's tunes you'd hear at a friend, of a friend's wedding. Downright just bad. This also seems to be the place if you're looking for that special someone for a brief relationship that only lasts until the next morning.  I will say that I came on a Saturday night, so maybe the scene is different during the week. I really liked the decor and wish it was more of a lounge wine bar with hip, sexy cool music.

e331pQV1I-SSnWw_w0PfMA.review_text: You know, the fruit mojitos (strawberry mango, strawberry blackberry etc..) here are damn good and all.....  But while still not feeling the alcohol after a couple of $9 dollar drinks, you know what I realized?  I could be having 4 original Jamba Juices instead!

kYBV4bJd4aoXqwpsVTpAGw.review_text: amazing drinks.  fresh fruit in almost every one.  some of the best in sf.  went on a friday night - lots of people so might not be the best place if you're looking for a quiet night.  but if you're looking for an upbeat crowd, or to meet people, this is the place to be.  they have a fireplace and wifi, so you can go there during weekdays and it's much calmer.  great place, i'd put it on on my list of things to def see/do in SF

YqgiEbk7hGxxATkl2Llveg.review_text: LOOOVE it here.  The best, most delicious fresh fruit mojitos.  I can drink 'em down like kool-aid.  Cozy fire and lots of foliage makes me want to stay in this bar for hours and hours.   Drinks are pricey but DEFINITELY worth it!  The bar tender is slow as molasses, but can you really blame him when he's squeezing fresh fruit, and crushin up mint leaves for such a wonderful concoction?  No, you can't.   You should come here often.

Fg1ZhF_2pHcRwgyq_6yUiQ.review_text: why do the bars i actually like end up being cash only? it's a tragedy. a travesty. it's an OUTRAGE.  for years i never knew this was a bar, just some neighbor's over-decorated house on my way down from University High. upon closer inspection, it looked exactly like one of the many hollister stores that dot the american landscape.  but when you step inside, it actually resembles a pub located in a tropical place, say, barbados. the lights have a certain orangy-reddish hue that denotes heat. and if you squint your eyes [or open your eyes, depending on how squinty your eyes happen to be by default] you can think that you're actually in, say, barbados.  the drinks were the standard fare but bring good friends here, get a table, and relax. the noise level actually isn't too bad so it's entirely possible to hold a conversation.  just bring a lot of cash. those bitches.

NTRktHjkhDlCf406L6YaFQ.review_text: Douchetacular. Lots of metal buddhas and overpriced drinks.  I don't remember how much my gin and tonic was but I'm pretty sure it was way too much. Also: it was loud.

XG-JynrbKiiNaqT4ffdI_w.review_text: Great causual bar/lounge with some excellent cocktails and some good free appetizers. Inside is a africa/jungle/safari theme done pretty well.

M_SxfmZjepJYxE_vNbWK4g.review_text: Or Lion's Den, as I've been calling it, is great on weekdays or for an early drink on the weekend bcus this place gets packed in the evenings.   I've been telling people for years that they make the best mojitos EVER! Maybe not the best ever, but I'm sure it's pretty damn close, and the Greyhounds are excellent also (with fresh squeezed grapefruit). When I'm here, you can find me all over the cheese bar; there's nothing I like more than booze with fresh fruit and free cheese =D.   The bartender and I had a bet goin to see how many people were proper tippers. I seemed to have more faith in my fellow drinkers than he did, but he gave me my free drink anyway. The standard tip is a dollar more for a mojito apparently. There's a lot of labor and elbow grease that goes into those suckers, ya know?  The bartender sometimes walk out to help people nab cabs after the bar closes. Who do you know does that?!

x-zOrdzGSxavw6J1_Q2Fpw.review_text: what's a greyhound and why do they call it that? if you want the answer to that question you should visit this place.   very divey place, small, cramped, hot and popping. we managed to find tables to sit on...i think they almost looked like patio furniture.   what? they have cheese and crackers? sweet

PSJ9LP_U3jF5K9avjvPPRw.review_text: Nice place for brews and drinks with the significant other or your group, though it can get noisy.  The late night hours are attractive if you and your date need a place to just sit and enjoy yourselves for a few hours longer.  Parking isn't the greatest around this area, as you might have walk a little longer for a spot.  The "Den" is a great place to hang out overall.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Nice fresh fruit cocktails, but not as tasty as I had hoped for. In my case, the cantaloupe mojito.

ltfsBefhwBH4K_dnUyGucg.review_text: Fresh yummy drinks, but it's cash only :-/  Also, what happened to the cheese plate?  Be aware it gets super crowded and HOT on the weekends.

e58WqXc-MbCHGCC_XfVKkg.review_text: This place reminds of Adventureland in Disneyland. I can dig the dimly lit atmosphere, but I'm not sure I'd come back. Drinks are around $7-10 and happy hours is $1 off all drinks.

3hjeA6vwna_Cbm2TXV_klw.review_text: This place is great, especially if you can get a seat.  If you are a vodka drinker, don't even think about ordering anything but a greyhound.  I love cheese, but am always suspicious of their spread...until I have three greyhounds.  Then, I find myself stuffing my face with triscuits and chedder cheese.  I always regret my performance the next morning, but the greyhounds give me easy hangovers.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: Bad wine, great bartenders, creepy crowd...and I haven't been this hung over since last weekend... %$#^%$!@!!!!!

kxQ1uQ_VadGzT5MPzLUWeA.review_text: It was a toss up btwn 3-4 stars, mostly I really like this place, but a few weeks ago we were in there and I swear, it took the bartender a crazy amount of time to make a drink... Seriously, how much time does it take to make a greyhound and to pour a beer... Maybe he was new... That's why I'm still giving it 4 stars!  It's in the hood so we usually hit this spot a couple of times a month. The fresh squeezed greyhounds are really a step above the usual!

sVu7dQ_isyUr1toSBBrBFg.review_text: Okay, so I'm often a bit far gone by the time I leave (and sometimes by the time I get to) this place, so my memory might be hazy. But the greyhounds are fantastic! The place gets packed, and after one sip, you'll know why.

h71P3ey0eKyRzbyThCv6Lw.review_text: This is place is so unique and fun. All of the juices are fresh squeeze in front you. All of the cocktails are tasty. They have a big spread of cheese and crackers for everyone to enjoy. Its pretty and inside and out, from the outside you would never tell it's a bar. It's a very laid back environment, a little crowd at times but always fun!

K5OIx8kNtoE2CthmjGwKHQ.review_text: By this late afternoon, more chapters weigh on my thumb-- having been read and flipped on their sides. Gone through.   One book sustained a whole Sunday.  Then I will go to the Pub for my regular drink. Where the bartender knows  every patron-- or at least recognizes me with or without reading glasses.   I prefer the high stools at the bar rather than their wicker chairs.  Call me old-fashioned.

EHejCuyAEhQBT1QuyI6pmA.review_text: The Lion's Den might be my favorite bar in the City.  It has a very cool vibe that is classy but at the same time not pretentious.  Weeknights are usually low key and I would highly recommend this spot for a date.  Hors'deover table at night, a fireplace, good drinks that are not overpriced.  No sign out front and just far enough out of the way so not everyone knows about it.  Sit in the back by the fireplace and enjoy each other's company.  If you're on the prowl or in a group weekends are usually pretty crowded and fun.  Try to get there early and get a table if you just want to hang with your friends.

I3aNBlJFWq8uvTqqjWyozQ.review_text: The drinks are so good here and I love the lively yet laid back environment. The tables and chairs are great for groups of friends to sit and catch up with each other. The fireplace makes this place so cozy and the free appetizers are a plus too!

MhZPgthtiMeHv9vQs2ezzw.review_text: I know you get in trouble for not enough bartenders and being too crowded but don't worry, you are my fav no matter what!  How can you not be!? You introduced me to my best friend (the greyhound), you keep me warm with you fire, and you provide me with late night munchies. Ample tender loving care! Most recently you introduced me to another friend, Burt Reynolds, which I cannot stop ordering to make sure everyone I know tries it!  Don't like the crowds? Come early to kick off the night right or skip the weekend warriors and hit it up midweek.   Ps: I also love that you are conveniently located approx. 2 blocks from where I live. Muh!

4Fyf9qPOqjpYofVqNVQfgA.review_text: I dunno.
