I work down the street from this place and every time I work someone asks me, "Where's the Lion's Den?" or "Where's the Lion Bar?" but rarely does anyone ever ask, "Where's Lion Pub?" After four years of giving directions but never recommendations I finally went with a coworker. I felt like I was in the Haunted House at Disneyland but not in a magical way and not in a creepy way... just a sort of cheesy way. I'm sure the scene varies but I think it was high school night when I went. I did get a free beer with my shot of tequila and they had my favorite... tequila, that is. I get free beer where I work so there's no real need to ever go back to Lion. Been there, done that. But don't let my review sway you. You might like this place.

xsMd6OnEJ6_Np6Es0uxOIg.review_text: I asked the bartender if he could make me a "Surfer on Acid" and he didn't know what is was. I told him what was in it (jaeger, malibu, and pineapple juice in case you were wondering) and it didn't taste bad at all. I even ordered a second one. Three stars for that.

I-xzzSC6yu9Pm47-DkvY7w.review_text: Honestly I like some of the drinks here... but the crowd is hit or miss.  If you like a good cocktail with fresh juice... than a greyhound or screwdriver here is so simple but so tasty.

yuhu7mu_VZeCOvKLRT-G0g.review_text: This is my favorite neighborhood bar in Pacific Heights. I love the decor - the giant lion and Buddhist statues are cool to look at. Remember to take a picture of yourself riding a lion if it's your first time there as it is tradition. The drinks are made with fresh fruit which really makes a difference in my opinion. The crowd is pretty mixed to make for a well-balanced atmosphere.

jgsElszDUWlh0XruWzXf2g.review_text: I've been looking for a bar with nice ambience where you can hear each other talk, and I think I've found it. I scored a nice seat by the fireplace. I don't know about their specialty drinks, though. I tried a champagne mojito, which was a little too tart, and a strawberry mango mojito, which was full of pieces of fruit that clogged my straw and was impossible to drink.   It looked as though there was free cheese and crackers, but, as it seemed too good to be true, I was too afraid to eat it.

3zWYE-sXRgbT6pHzGo8LNw.review_text: it was pretty crowded but not at first - around 11 the crowd rolls in.  the bar tenders were still pretty fast to get me a drink, even if i wasn't an attractive girl that was also waiting.  first come, first serve is their policy.  i would go back.  i did hate the fact that you can't start a tab.  who carries cash these days?

MjlNTynslY_aLDTfGODuIg.review_text: come here on and off, this place has great fresh fruit mojitos!!! for 10 dollars, which is on par with what bars charge these days. parking can be difficult, and seating in the pub can be impossible if you come at a busy time (i.e. fri/sat night).  if you are lucky enough to get a seat next to the fireplace, you may never want to leave...dimly lit ambiance, with people chatter that's drowned out by a relevant music playlist, good drinks, and a hypnotic fireplace.

Bf87HcPERF9yiSjb2tQBqw.review_text: Amanda and Raaasssss were technically living here at one point, I swear.

CZ36wJqV-Xit758UaOr81A.review_text: Not a great place and not bad either. Cool if you're looking for a bar with a different vibe.  Atmosphere:  Dark, very dark, with a jungle theme - almost tiki room-ish. The place is shaped like a fairly thin but long rectangle. The actual bar takes up about half the space and the other half is filled with tables. Last night (Saturday) was my first time there and honestly, I was impressed with the female talent - some really good looking girls. They have some neon lights and awkward lighting but the crowd is pretty cool. Make sure to snag up a table if you see one. It's way better to be sitting!   Drinks:  Your standard bar. The one drink I had was fairly strong which I like. I appreciate a bartender with a heavy hand - more bang for your bucks. They were decently priced too. I bought me and my buddies the first round of drinks, total of 5 cocktails - it came out to be $32.   Music:  Top 40s. Pop, hip hop. Nothing special even though I oddly did feel like dancing at this place.   Clientele:   Younger, mid 20s to early 30s. Cute girls with style. Guys are the same you see anywhere else in the city.   Not my favorite place but go check it out. It's not bad at all especially if you're kicking it with your friends.

NFU-bQYhVh2hHud49BNryQ.review_text: i love places that offer free food, so yes please to the cheese, crackers, dips!  i also love places that offer fresh cocktails.  yes please to fresh grapefruit greyhounds, fresh watermelon vodkas, and strawberry mojitos!

scIyLRiFryYbzCcJG5l1Fg.review_text: I want to give this place a 4 or 5 star rating I really do, but there were a few issues.  First of all the positives. Who doesn't love fresh squeezed juice in their drinks? Nice touch! Good selection of beers and cool ambiance. Also the place was buzzing with quite a few people.  Now why only 3 stars, well on a Friday night at 7:30pm, there were a lot of people there and only one bartender and not even a barback. The dude was slammed and working his ass off. However, it took a long time to get drinks and the seating area and bar were littered with glasses.  At 9pm two more people came in to help but I felt bad for the guy for that 1.5 hours that I was there.  I'll be back when I'm in the neighborhood because it's as good as it gets on Divisadero.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: Can we please just call this place The Lion's Den?  Please?  I do it accidentally anyway, so *poof* new name.  Thanks all for your compliance.    I'm giving this place four stars on the caveat that you never, ever come on a weekend night.  The Marina kids spill over the hill and clog the hell out of the VERY NARROW bar area.  It doesn't help that the fireplace is usually going, making it not only stifflingly crowded, but unbearably hot as well. That said, it's a great bar.  The space is cozy and I love that the cocktails are all made with fresh juice, not to mention the snack display.  For anyone who knows me, free cheese is a surefire way to make me swoon.  Make sure you're there early when it's fresh, since I know I don't have to explain the state of various cheeses, dips and salmon after several hours of being picked over in a hot and crowded bar.  Squick. Service can be a bit spotty --- I was in with a gentleman caller one evening and we were the only ones in there aside from the bartender's group of friends.  We didn't get much service outta him even though we sat AT the bar, which is a shame since if you have ever had the pulpified watermelon and vodka?  Jeebus they go down quickly.  He could've made twice the money off of us if he was just a tad more aware that we were actually still there. Look for me by the free cheese.

vsfG95vDU20d7upU1Zs6uA.review_text: Fresh squeezed juice in your alcohol beverage? YES PLEASE!!  A lot of people rave about the Greyhound (fresh squeezed grapefruit juice with vodka) which costs only $6! Wow, cheap right?? Well, so is the vodka. I can't drink cheap vodka.  I do love how there's an endless selection of mojitos: strawberry mango, blueberry pineapple, canteloupe passionfruit, basil, etc. I asked the bartender for a canteloupe passionfruit mojito and was given a blueberry mojito. What? Yeah, I have no clue.  I like this place but the one thing I don't like is the fact that it's CASH ONLY. Also, there's no blatant sign that says "LION PUB" so just look for a doorman standing outside a place that is covered in a lot of shrubs/trees/bushes.
